layenge hys hades vpo blessed math c luce c wha gone forth way one ru nynge wyth knye bowed hym prayed hym sayenge good master shall maye optayne lyfe euerlastynge iesus sayd vnto hym doest thou call good deute f ther good saue god thou knowest comaundementes exodi b comytte aduoutry kyll steale beare false wytnesse begyle honoure thy father mother answeryng sayd vnto hym master haue obserued fro youth iesus loked vpon hym loued hym sayd vnto hym one thynge wantyng go tu sell thou hast geue ye poore thou shalt haue treasure heauen come follow beynge discomforted sayenge wente awaye sory hauynge great possession math c luce cand iesus lokyng sayd vnto hys disciple hardly shall haue mony entre kyngdome god ye disciple astonnyed hys wordes iesus answerynge agayne sayde vnto chylderen harde ye hauers confidence mony entre kyngdome god easyer camel passe thorowe ye eye nedle rych entre kyngdome heauen maruayled sayenge selues saued iesus beholdynge sayde wyth men impossible wt god zacha thynges possible wyth god thys beganne peter say vnto hym mat luce c beholde haue forsaken haue followed iesus answerynge sayde verely saye vnto ther noma shal forsake house brother systers father mother chylderen landes myne gospel sake shall receaue hundreth tymes muche thys tyme house brother systers mother landes persecution world come euerlastynge lyfe luce c many fyrst shalbe laste laste ye fyrst math b luce waye goynge vp ierusalem iesus wente afore astonnyed followynge afrayed takynge hym agayne twolue begane tell thynges shulde come vnto hym beholde go vp ierusalem ye sonne man shalbe delyuered vnto ye hygh prestes scribe elder shal condene hym death shall delyuer hym vnto getiles shall mocke hym shal spytte vpo hym shall put hym death thyrde daye shall ryse agayne math c iames ihon chylderen zebede come hym saye master desyre thou vnto v whatsoeuer shall axe sayde vnto wyl ye shal vnto sayde graunte v may syt thy glory one thy ryght thy lefte hand iesus sayde vnto ye know ye axe ye drynke ye cuppe drynke baptysed baptyme shalbe baptysed sayde vnto hym maye iesus sayde vnto cup dede yt drynke shal ye drynk wt baptyme ame baptysed shal ye baptysed syt ryght lefte myne geue vnto vnto yt prepared ten hearynge disdayned iames ihon iesus callynge sayde vnto math marci luce e b ye knowe sene rule amonge gentile rayne lordes ouer theyr prynces haue power shall amonge whoso wyll great shalbe youre mynister wylbe pryncipal amoge shalbe seruaunt sonne man came ministred vnto minister ioh b geue hys lyfe redempcion many math luce b come hierico whan wente hierico hys disciple greate multitude bartimeus blynde sonne tymeus sat beggynge ye waye whiche whan herde iesus nazareth beganne crye saye iesu thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpo many reproued hym shulde holde hys peace cryed much thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpon iesus sta dynge commaunded hym called call blynde sayeng good cheare ryse calleth castynge awaye hys garment came leapynge hym iesus answerynge sayde vnto hym wylt thou shall vnto blynde answered sayd rabboni maye se iesus sayde vnto hym go thy waye thy faythe hath made safe forthwith sawe followed hym waye xi chapter whan came nye ierusale bethany vnto mounte oliuetemath luc c sente two disciple sayeth vnto go towne lyeth ouer agaynste anone entrynge ye shal fynde foale tyed vpon whyche noman hath yet syt e lowse thesame brynge hether yf ony saye vnto ye say ye lorde hath nede anone shall sende hether goynge awye fande foale tyed wythout dore partynge way dyd lowse stode sayd vnto ye lowsynge foale sayd vnto iesus comauded let go led ye foale iesus layed theyr clothes vpo sat vpo hym ioh b many spred theyr clothes waye cut braunches tree strowed waye wente followed cryed sayenge hosanna psal cblessed commeth name ye lord blessed kyngdome father dauid commeth hosanna hyghte entred ierusalem temple whan loked aboute vpo thynges euentyd wente forth bethany wt twolue nexte daye whan wente bethany math b anhungred whan sawe afarre luce fyggetre hauyng leaues came se yf could perchauce fynde ony thynge thereon wha came fande nothynge leaues tyme fygges answerynge sayde vnto let noman eate frute foreuer disciple herde math b luce ioh b come ierusalem whan come teple beganne cast byers seller ye temple ouerthrewe table mony chaungers seates ye seller doues suffred ony man shuld cary vessel thorow temple taught sayenge vnto writte esay b iere reg house shalbe called house prayer vnto al nacions ye haue made dene murtherers ioh hyghe prestes scribe herde sought howe destroye hym feared hym yt people wondered vpon doctrine wha become eue wente forth ye cytie mat b wha wente morow sawe fyggetre wythered eue fro roote pe e remembrynge sayde vnto hym master beholde fyggetre thou dyddest curse wythered awaye iesus answerynge sayde vnto math c luce c haue ye fayth god verely saye vnto whoso euer sayeth vnto mou tayn auoyde cast thy selfe ye see iaco shall doute hys harte shall beleue euer sayeth shall come passe shalbe done vnto hym therfore saye vnto ioha b c ye prayenge axe beleue ye shall receaue shall befall vnto math b c luce whan ye shall stande praye forgeue yf ye haue ought agaynst ony man father also heauen maye forgeue youre synnes yf ye forgeue youre father heaues shall forgeue youre synnes nother math c luce come agayne ierusale whan dyd walke temple hygh prestes scribe elder come hym saye vnto hym authorite doest thou thynges gaue thy thys authorite thou thynges iesus answerynge sayde also wyll demaunde one worde answer shall tell power thynges baptyme ihon heauen men answer thought themselues sayeng yf saye heauen shal saye vnto v dyd ye beleue hym yf saye men feare people euery man helde ihon yf dede prophet answerynge sayde vnto iesus tell iesus answerynge sayde nother tell power thynges xii chapter beganne speake vnto parable certayne man math luce planted vyneyarde made hegge aboute dygged vynepresse buylt tower let vnto husbandemen went straunge contry whan tyme sente seruaunt husbandemen receaue frute vyne whiche taken hym bet hym sent hym awaye empty agayne sente vnto another seruaunte wounded heade intreated hym shamefully agayne sente vnto another hym slewe many beatynge slayenge hauynge therfore yet one moost deare sonne hym sente finally vnto sayenge wyl stand awe sonne husbandman sayde amonge themselues thys ye heyre gene come let v slaye hym heretage shalbe oures takynge hym slewe hym cast hym forth vyneyarde shall lorde vyneyarde therfore shal come destroye husbandemen shall geue hys vyne vnto haue ye red scripture psal c stone whiche buylders refused thys become head stone corner thys done lorde maruaylous oure eye math b luce b sought laye holde vpon hym feared people perceaued spoken parable hym beynge lefte wente theyre waye luce c sede vnto pharises herodes officer take hym worde commynge sayd vnto hym mayster knowe thou arte true carest noman thou beholdest ye outwarde appearaunce men teachest waye god truth lawfull geue tribute vnto emperoure shall geue knowynge theyre wylynesse sayde vnto ye tempte brynge peny maye se brought hym sayde vnto whose ymage superscription thys saye vnto hym emperours iesus answerynge sayde math rom b geue therfore vnto emperoure ye thynges emperours god vnto god maruayled hym math c luce actu saduces whiche saye ther resurrection came hym axed hym sayenge master deut moses hath wrytten vnto v yf ony man brother dead leaue wyfe leaue chylderen hys brother shall take hys wyfe rayse vp sede vnto hys brother ther seuen brother fyrste toke wyfe dyed leauynge sede seconde toke dyed thys lefte sede nother thyrde lykewyse seue lyke maner lefte sede last dyed woman also resurrection therfore whan shall ryse whose wyfe shall seuen wyfe iesus answerynge sayde vnto ye erre therfore knowyng scripture power god whan shall ryse dead shal nother mary maryed angel god heauens dead ryse haue ye red boke moses howe god bushe spake vnto hym sayenge exod actu ame god abraham god isaac god iacob god ye dead lyuynge therfore ye greatly erre math ther came vnto hym one scribe herde disputynge seynge answered well axed chefest commaundemete al iesus answered chefest commaundemente deut b b heare israell lorde thy god one god thou shalt loue lorde thy god wyth thy harte wyth thy soule wyth thy mynde wyth thy power ye chefest comaudemet secod lyke vnto leui c rom b thou shalt loue thy neyghbour thyselfe ther none commaundemet greater scribe sayd vnto hym mayster truth thou hast sayd well ther one god ther none besyde hym yt loued wyth ye whole harte wyth whole vnderstandynge wyth ye whole soule wyth whole strength loue hys neghboure hymselfe burnt offerynges sacrifice iesus seynge answered wysely sayd vnto thou arte farre kyngdome god noman durste axe hym ony mo math luce e iesus answerynge sayde teachynge temple saye scribe christ sonne dauid dauid hymselfe sayeth holy goost psal lorde sayde vnto lorde syt thou ryghte hande tyll shal set thyne enemyes stoole thy fete dauid hymselfe calleth hym lorde whence hys sonne much people herde hym gladly sayde vnto hys teachynge math luce c beware scribe loue go longe garmentes saluted market syt fyrst seates ye synagoges fyrst rowmes meales whych deuoure wedowes house vnder ye pretence longe prayer shall receaue ye greater iudgemet luce iesus syttyng ouer ye reg b god cheste behelde people caste mony god chest many rych cast much wha poore wedowe come put two te yt farthynge callynge disciple together sayd vnto verelye saye vnto thys poore wedowe hath put god cheste al haue put abundaunt vnto hir pou rte hath put euen hyr lyuynge xiii chapter mat luce whan wente oute temple one hys disciple sayd vnto hym mayster loke stone buyldynges iesus answerynge sayd vnto hym doest thou se greate buyldynges ther shall one stone lefte vpon another shall destroyed whan sat vpon mount oliuete ouer agaynst te ple peter iames ihon andrewe axed hym seuerally tell v whan shall done shalbe token whan shall begyn fulfylled iesus answerynge began saye vnto beware noma miscary many shall come name sayenge shall miscary many whan ye shal heare warres rumores warres afrayed thynges must done ende yet esa afor one nacion shal ryse vp agaynst another nacion kyngdome vpon kyngdome ther shalbe earthquake honger begynnynge sorowes mat b loke ye selues shall delyuer councels synagoges ye shalbe beate ye shall stande debites kynges sake wytnes vnto amonge nacios muste fyrst gospell preached math c luce b b wha shal leade delyueryng thynk ye afore ye shal speake whatsoeuer shalbe geuen yt houre speake ye speakynge holy goost brother shall delyuer ye brother vnto death father sone chyldren shall aryse together agaynst elder shal put death ye shalbe hated name sake shal endure vntyl ende shal safe dani mat b luce c whan ye shall se abominacion desolacio stadynge ought readeth let vnderstande let iewry flye vpon hylles vpo thacke let hym come downe house entre may take ought hys house shalbe ye felde let hym turne back fetch garmet wo vnto yt wt chylde geue sucke dayes neuerthelesse praye befal wynter dayes shalbe suche tribulacion begynnynge creature god dyd shape vntyll nowe shalbe wtout lord shortened dayes al flesh ben saued ye choses sake yt hath elect hath shortened dayes mat b luce c yf ony shal tha say vnto lo christe lo beleue ther shal aryse false christes false prophetes shall worke signes wonder myscary yf chosen also take therfore hede beholde haue tolde al thynges befor math c luce c ioel b dayes tribulation ye sone shalbe darkened moone shall geue hir light starres heauen shalbe fallynge downe power heauen shalbe moued dani b shall se sone comynge cloudes wyth great power glory shall sende forth hys angel shall gather hys chosen foure wyndes hyghest earth vnto hyghest heauen math c luce learne similitude ye fyggetre whan hys braunche te der leaues spronge ye shall knowe sommer hande euen ye wha ye se done sure nye euen dores verely saye vnto thys generacion shall passe tyll thynges befall heauen earth shall passe wordes shal passe actu day houre knoweth noman nother ye angel heauen sonne saue father math luce take hede watch praye ye knowe whan tyme lyke man wente straunge contrye lefte hys house gaue vnto hys seruau te authorite euery worke vnto porter commaunded watche watch ye therfore ye knowe whan lorde house wyll come euen mydnyghte cockcrowynge mornynge left whan shall come fynde slepynge say vnto saye vnto watch xiiii chapter math luce ioh two dayes easter ye dayes swete bread ye hygh prestes ye scribe soughte myght deceat laye hold hym slaye hym sayd holy daye leste ther happen rumoure people math luce ioh whan bethany house simo leper sat table ther came woman hauynge alabastre boxe wyth pure precious nardus oyntmet alabastre boxe veynge broke poured vpon hys heade ther disdaynynge wythin themselues sayenge thys waiste oyntmente made thys oyntment myghte haue ben solde thre hu dreth pen geuen poore grudged iesus sayd let reste ye troublous vnto hath wrought good worke vpon ye haue alwayes poore wyth whan euer ye wyll ye maye good vnto shall ye haue alwayes could hath done come anoynte body buriall verely saye vnto euer thys gospell shall preached whole worlde shall also tolde remembraunce hath done math b luce ioha iudas iscariot one twelfe wente hyghe prestes myghte betray hym vnto hearynge glad promysed geue hym mony soughte myght conueniently betray hym exodi c math b luce vpon ye fyrst day swete breade tyme offred easter lambe disciple say vnto hym wylt thou yt go prepare eat ye easterlabe sedeth two disciple sayeth vnto go cytie ther shall mete man bearynge pytcher water follow hym euer shall go say vnto master house mayster sayeth place refreshynge maye eate easterlambe wyth disciple shal shew great parloure paued prepare v hys disciple wente cam cytie fande sayd vnto made ready easterlabe math b luc b ioh c ye euenyng beynge come cam wyth ye twelfe syttynge table eatynge iesus sayd verely saye vnto ye one eateth wyth shall betraye began sory saye vnto hym one another sayd vnto one twelfe dyppeth hys hande platter sonne man truely goeth forth wrytten hym wo vnto whome sonne man shalbe betraied ben better yf ben borne math c luce b cor c eatynge iesus toke bread blessynge brake gaue sayd vnto take thys body cuppe beynge taken geuynge thakes gaue vnto dyd drynke sayd vnto thys bloude new testamet whych shall shed many verely say vnto yt shal drynk ye frut vyne vntyl daye whan shall drynke new kyngdom god grace said wet forth vnto mounte oliuete math c iesus sayd vnto ye shalbe offended thys nyght wrytten zacha shall smyte shepe herd shepe shalbe scattred brode shal ryse agayne actu shall go galile peter sayd vnto hym though shall offended yet shall iesus sayd vnto hym verely saye vnto daye thys nyghte cocke haue crowed twyse thou shalte denye thryse sayde moreouer though must dye wyth wyll denye lykewyse also dyd saye math luce c ioh come felde called gethseman sayeth vnto hys disciple syt ye tyl praye taketh hym peter iames ihon began abasshed anguyshed sayd vnto ioh c soule heauy vnto ye death tary ye watch whan gone lytle farther fell vpon earth prayed yf might done houre shulde passe hym sayd abba father al thynges possible vnto take awaye thys cuppe wyl thou came foude slepyng said vnto peter simon slepest thou couldest thou watch one houre watch ye praye ye entre temptacion sprete truly ready flesh weak math goyng agayn prayed sayenge worde beynge returned founde slepyng agayne theyr eye heuy knewe shuld answere hym came thyrde tyme sayd vnto slepe take youre reste ynoughe houre come beholde sonne man shalbe betrayed handes synners ryse vp let v go beholde shall betraye hande math luce ioha yet speakynge iudas iscariote one twelfe came wyth hym greate multitude wyth sweardes staues hygh prestes scrybes elder hys traytoure geuen ken sayenge whome euer shal kysse laye holde hym leade hym warely whan come strayght waye commynge hym sayde mayster kyssed hym layde handes iesus helde hym one stode drawynge swearde stroke seruaunt hygh preste cut hym eare math f luce iesus answered sayd vnto ye come forth murtherer sweardes staues take dayly teachyng temple ye helde done esay b marci c scripture may fulfylled dyd hys disciple flye leauynge hym yonge followed hym clothed wyth whyte lynnen vpon bare skynne helde hym whyte lynnen lefte fled naked math f luce ioh band delyuered iesus vnto hygh preste prestes scribe elder come together peter dyd follow hym afarre vntyll wythin palace hyghe preste sat wyth seruauntes fyre dyd warme hymselfe math f hygh prestes councell sought wytnesse agaynste iesu myght brynge hym death found many gaue false wytnesse agaynste hym wytnesses agreynge rysynge vp gaue false wytnesse agaynste hym sayenge haue herde hym sayenge ioha c shall breake downe thys temple made wyth handes thre dayes shall buylde another made wyth handes theyr wytnesse agreynge math f hyghe preste rysynge vp myddes axed iesus sayenge answerest thou nothynge thynges whych layed agaynst helde hys peace answered nothyng luce hygh preste axed hym agayne sayde vnto hym arte thou christe sonne ye blessed god iesus sayde vnto ame ioh g ye shall se sonne man syttynge ryght hande ye power comynge wyth cloudes heauen math g hygh preste rentynge hys clothes sayde requyre ony wytnesses ye haue herde blasphemy thynke ye condened hym sayenge hym gylty death beganne spytte vpo couer face buffette hym saye vnto hym prophecy reg ioha b seruauntes bette hym wyth fystes mat g luce ioh b whan peter beneth palace one maydes hygh preste came whan sawe peter warmynge hym lokynge vpon hym sayde werest thou also iesu nazareth denyed sayenge know hym nother wote thou sayest went forth forecourte cock crewe agayn wha mayde sawe hym beganne saye vnto stode aboute thys one denyed agayne lytle whyle stode sayde vnto peter truly thou arte one thou arte galilean beganne curse swear know man ye speake forthwith dyd cock crowe agayn peter remebred worde iesus sayde vnto hym cocke haue crowed twyse thou shalt denye thryse beganne wepe xv chapter psal math luce ioh soone mornynge hygh prestes holdynge counsel elder scribe ye whole coucel byndynge iesus led delyuered hym vnto pilate math pilate axed arte thou kynge iewes answerynge sayd vnto hym thou sayest hygh prestes accused hym many thynges pilate axed hym agayne sayenge answerest thou nothynge beholde many thynges accuse ye iesus gaue answer somuche pilate maruayled math bnowe wonte ye feast day let lowse vnto one presoners whome dyd desyre ther one prisoner sedicious called barrabas ye committed manslaughter vproure whan people come vp beganne praye hym alwaye dyd vnto pilate answered sayd wyl ye shal let louse vnto kynge ye iewes knew hyghe prestes delyuered hym enuy math c hygh prestes moued people saye yt shulde rather let barrabas lowse vnto math c luce b pilate answerynge agayne sayde vnto wyll ye tha shall vnto kynge iewes cryed agayne crucifye hym pilate sayde vnto euell hath done cryed crucifye hym pilate wyllynge satisfye ye people let lowse vnto barrabas delyuered iesus beynge scourged crucifyed math ioh souldyers led comune hall dyd cal whole company clothe hym purple platynge crowne thornes set vpon heade begane salute hym hayle kynge iewes smote hym heade wyth rede spytted vpon hym knelynge worshypped hym ioh b mocked hym stryped hym purple put hys owne clothes ledde hym myghte crucifye hym math luce c compelled one simon cyrene passed commyng fro feloe father alexaunder rufus shuld beare crosse ledde hym place golgotha interpreted ye place skulles gaue hym drynk wyne myxte wyth myrrhe toke psal b math ioh c crucifyenge hym parted hys garmentes castyng lotte vpon euery one shuld take ye thyrde houre crucifyed hym title hys cause wrytte kynge ye iewes crucify two murtherers one ryght hande left hande scripture fulfylled sayeth esay b math f counted euel doer mat c luce went blasphemed hym waggyng theyr heades sayenge fy one destroy est temple god buyldeste agayne thre dayes saue thyself commynge downe crosse lyke wyse hygh prestes wyth scribe mockynge sayde ech hath saued hymselfe saue christe kynge israel let hym nowe come downe crosse maye se beleue crucifyed hym reuyled hym also math e luce whan syxte houre come ther darknesse ouer whole earth ye nyneth hour dyd iesus crye loude voyce sayenge psa eloi eloi la zabathani interpreted god god hast thou forsaken stode aboute hearynge sayd beholde calleth elia math c ioh c one runnynge fyllynge sponge vynegre puttynge rede gaue hym drynke sayenge let ye hym alone let v se whether elia wyll come take downe iesus cryenge loude gaue vp goost vayle teple rente two aboue tyl beneth math f luce e ye centurio stode ouer agaynst hym seynge iesus geuen vp goost cryenge sayde truly thys ye sonne god ioh c ther also woman afarre beholdynge amonge whome mary magdalene mary iames ye lesser mother ioseph salome wha galile luc followed hym ministred vnto many came also vp ierusale math g luce ioh whan become eue daye preparynge ye sabbat ther came one ioseph arimathea noble senatoure also lokynge kyngdome god boldely went vnto pilate axed ye body iesu pilate maruayled dead already centurio beyng called axed hym yf deade already wha knowlege ceturio gaue vnto ioseph body iesu ioseph boughte lynnen cloth takynge hym downe wounde hym therin layd hym graue hewen rocke rolled stone mouth sepulchre math g mary magdalene mary ioseph behelde shulde layde xvi chapter math luc ioh whan sabbat past mary magdalene mary iames salome bought spice co mynge myght anoynte iesu one daye sabbates early wha sone rysen come graue sayd ech shal remoue v stone dore graue lokynge sawe stone rolled awaye great one goyng graue sawe yonge man syttynge ryght hande clothed wyth whyte longe garment abashed math luce sayeth vnto afrayed ye seke iesus nazareth yt crucifyed rysen beholde ye place layed hym go ye tell disciple peter yt shall go galile actu shall ye se hym mar da sayde vnto goynge forth fled awaye graue tremblynge feare come vpon sayde nothynge ony man afrayed math luce iesus rysynge early fyrst daye sabbat cor appeared fyrste vnto mary magdalene whiche caste seuen deuels goynge told vnthem mournynge wepynge hym hearynge lyued sene dyd beleue luce b thys shewed figure vnto two goynge vpon felde goynge tolde nother dyd beleue luce c laste appeared eleue syttynge table vpbrayded theyr vnbelefe ye hardnesse harte beleued sene ryse sayd vnto math c ioh c ye goynge world preach gospel vnto euery creatur whoso shal beleue shall baptysed shalbe saued whoso shal beleue shalbe da ned vnto shall beleue shall token followe actu b c name shall caste oute deuels actu shall speake wyth newe tunges luce b actu shall dryue awaye serpentes yf drynke ony deadly thynge shall hurt actu b shall laye theyr handes vpon sycke shalbe well luce actu b g lorde iesus spoken vnto taken vp heauen sytteth ryght hand god goynge theyr waye preached euery hebre ye lorde workynge wyth confirmynge worde wyth token followynge p ende gospell marke pthe holy gospell iesv christe luke prologe forasmuch many haue endeuoured set order wordes ye actes come passe amoge v lyke delyuered vnto v fyrst saw theyrselues ministres ye word thought good also gotten knowelege begynnynge wryte diligently vnto order good theophile thou mayest knowe truth wordes wherof thou arte enfourmed fyrste chapter ther dayes herode kynge ye iewes preste name zachary par b course abia wyfe doughters aaron hyr name elizabeth ryghteous god walkynge wythoute blame commaundementes iustifications lorde chylde elizabeth baren well gone forth theyr dayes came passe whan zachary executed presthode god ye order hys course ye costume presthode exod b hebr lot wente forth laye incense entryng temple lord multitude ye people prayenge wythout houre incese angell lorde appeared vnto hym standynge ryght hande altare incese zachary seynge hym abashed feare came vpon hym angel sayd vnto hym fear zachary thy prayer herd thy wyfe elizabeth shall brynge forth vnto sone thou shalt call hys name ihon thou shalte haue ioye gladnesse many shall haue ioye hys natiuite shalbe great lorde wyne stronge drynke shall drynke shalbe fylled holy goost yet hys mother wobe shal turne many chyldren israel vnto lorde theyr god shal go sprete power psal malach math b elia may turne harte father vnto chyldre vnbeleuynge wysedome ye ryghteous make ready perfecte people vnto lord zachary sayd vnto ye angel wherby shall know gene e b iudi bfor olde wyfe well gone forth hyr dayes ye angel answeryng sayd vnto hym gabriel yt stande god sent speake vnto ye shew gladtydynges vnto beholde yu shalt dome able speake vntyll thynges shall come passe yu reg dyddest beleue wordes yt shalbe fulfilled tyme ye people waiting zachary maruayled taryed temple beynge gone could speake vnto perceaued sene vision beckenyng vnto abode domme chaunced dayes office fynyshed departed hys house dayes elizabeth hys wyfe dyd conceaue hyd herselfe fyue monethes sayenge thys wyse hath lorde done vnto ye dayes yt hath loked take awaye rebuke amonge men math c syxt moneth ye angel gabriel sent fro god ye cytie galile whose name nazareth vnto virgine spoused vnto whose name ioseph house dauid name virgine mary angell beynge gone vnto sayd hayle full grace ye lorde wyth blessed arte thou amonge wemen wha herde troubled hys worde thought maner salutacion thys shuld angel sayd vnto feare mary thou hast founde grace god esay beholde thou alt conceaue thy wombe shalte brynge forth sonne math c luc c thou shalte call hys name iesvs shalbe great shall called sonne moost hyghest lord god shal geue hym seate dauid hys father esay b shall raygne euer house iacob dani mech b hebr b ther shalbe ende hys raygne mary sayd vnto angel shall thys seynge know man ye angell answeryng sayd vnto holy goost shall come fro aboue ye power moost highest shal ouershadowe therfore ye holy shalbe borne shalbe called sonne god beholde elizabeth thy cosin also hath conceaued sonne hir olde age thys syxte moneth called baren marci c luce c euery thyng shal impossible wt god mary sayd behold ye hand mayden lorde vnto yu hast sayd angel departed fro mary rysynge dayes went mountaynes wyth haist cytie iewry entred ye house zachary saluted elizabeth befel elizabeth herde salutacion mary ye chylde lept hir wobe fylled holy goost cryed wt loude voyce sayd blessed art yu amoge wemen blessed frute thy wobe whence cometh vnto mother lord shuld come vnto beholde voyce thy salutacion happened myne eares babe lepte ioye wombe happy arte thou hast beleued ye thynges shall fulfylled whych tolde lorde mary sayd esay b soule magnifyeth lorde mysprete reioyceth god saue oure hath beholde ye lowe degre hys handemayden beholde hence forth shall generacios cal blessed mighty hath done great thynges vnto holy name mercy endureth progeny progeny vpon feare hym hath wrought strengthe hys arme hath scattered proude imaginacion theyr harte reg eccli c hath set downe myghty ye seate hath exalted lowe degre hath fylled hongry wyth good thynges left rych empty hath taken vp israel hys seruaunte beynge remembred hys mercy euen hath sayde vnto father gen c abraham hys sede euer mary remayned thre monethes returned agayne hyr house elizabethes tyme brynge forth fulfylled brought forth sonne hyr neghboures kynsfolkes herde god dyd magnifye hys mercy wyth reioyced wyth fortuned vpon eyght daye came gen b leui ato circucyse chylde called hym ye name hys father zachary hys mother answerynge sayd shalbe called ihon sayd vnto ther noman thy kynred called name made sygnes vnto hys father howe wolde haue hym called axynge wrytynge table wrote sayenge ihon hys name dyd maruayle hys mouth forthwyth opened hys tunge spake blessynge god ther happened feare vpon theyr neyghboures vpon hyll contryes iewry wordes noysed herde layed vp theyr harte sayenge trowe ye wyll thys chylde ye hande lorde wyth hym zachary hys father fylled holy goost prophecyed sayeng blessed ye lord god israel hath visited made redepcion hys people hath set vp vnto v psal horne saluacio ye house dauid hys seruaute hath spoken ye mouth hys prophetes whych sence world began namely saluacion fro enemyes hande al yt hated v mercy father thynke vpon hys holy gene conuenaunte othe dyd sweare vnto father abraha geue v esay hebre c delyuered hade enemy may serue hym wythout feare holynesse ryghteousnesse hym dayes thou chylde shalt called prophete moost hyghest yu shalt go face lorde prepare hys waye geue ye knowlege saluacio vnto people ye remissio theyr sinnes thorow ye tender mercy god yt whych ye daye sprynge fro hygh hath visited v lyghten yt syt darkenesse ye shadow death gyde fete ye waye peace ye chylde grewe strengthed sprete ye wyldernesse tyl ye tyme shewynge israel p ii chap befell dayes ther wente co maundement augustus emperoure whole worlde shulde taxed thys taxynge fyrst made vnder cyrinus debite syria wente taxed euery one hys cytie ioseph also wente vp galile cytie nazareth iewry citie dauid reg b whych called bethlee house lynage dauid myghte taxed wyth mary hys spoused wyfe beynge wyth chylde math fortuned whyle dayes shulde brynge forth fulfilled brought forth hyr fyrst begotten sonne wrapped hym clothes layd hym maunger ther rowme inne ther shepeherdes ye region watchynge kepyng nyghtwatches ouer theyr flocke beholde tim b angell lord stode ye bryghtnesse god dyd shyne rounde aboute abashed great feare angell sayd feare beholde brynge glad tydynges greate ioye whych shalbe vnto people vnto thys daye borne saueoure cytie dauid whych christe lorde thys shalbe toke vnto ye shall fynde babe wounde clothes layed maunger sodenly wyth angell multitude heauenly hoost praysynge god sayenge glory vnto god moost hyghest earth peace vnto men good wyll fortuned angel wente heauen shepherdes spake eche let v go ouer vnto bethleem let v se ye thynge happened whych ye lorde hath done hath shewed vnto v cam wyth haist founde mary ioseph chylde layed maunger seynge remebred ye thynge tolde thys chylde herde maruayled thynges tolde shepeherdes mary kepte sayenges ponderyng hyr harte shepeherdes returned glorifienge praysynge god herde sene tolde gene b whan eyghte dayes come chylde shulde circu cised hys name called iesus luce cthe whych called angel coceaued ye wobe whan dayes theyr purifienge fulfylled le b ye law moses brought hym ierusalem myght presente hym vnto lorde written lawe lorde exodi num c euery manchylde ye fyrst borne shalbe called halowed vnto ye lorde myght geue offerynge wrytten lawe lorde pare turtel doues two yonge pygeons beholde ther ierusalem whose name simeon thys man ryghteous fearynge god longyng consolacion israel holy goost wyth hym receaued answere ye holy goost yt shulde se death wythout fyrste sene anoynted lorde came temple sprete whan hys elder brought chylde iesus shulde hym costume l uit b lawe toke hym also hys armes blessed god sayd lord lettest thou thy seruaut departe peace accordynge thy worde myne eyen haue sene thy sauynge health yu hast prepared face people esay b actu lyghte lyghtenynge ye heithen prayse thy people israel hys father mother maruaylynge thynges sayd hym simeon blessed sayd vnto mary hys mother beholde thys chylde set fall rysynge agayne many israel sygne whych shalbe spoke agaynst swearde shal pearse thorow thyne owne soule thoughtes many harte may opened ther prophetisse anna ye doughter phanuel tribe aser well aged lyued seue yeare fro hir virginite wt hyr husbande ye wedowe vntyl fourescore foure yeare whych departed fro temple seruynge god nyght day fastinges praiers ye cam forth houre praised ye lorde spake hym vnto wayted redeption israel whan perfourmed al thynges accordynge lawe ye lorde dyd returne agayn galile theyr cytie nazareth chylde grewe waxed stronge sprete full wysdom grace god wyth hym hys elder went euery yeare ierusalem feaste daye easter wha twolue year olde wente vp ierusale exod b c leui costume feaste whan dayes finyshed returned agayne ye chylde iesus remayned ierusale hys elder knew thynkyng hym copany came back one dayes iournye sought hym amonge kynsfolkes acquayntauces fyndynge hym went agayn ierusale sekyng hym fortuned thre dayes fande hym temple syttynge ye myddest doctores hearynge apposyng math c marci b luce herde hym astonyed wysdome answer seynge hym maruayled hys mother sayd vnto hym sonne haste thou done vnto v behold thy father sorowyng sought sayd vnto ioha ye sought knewe ye must thynges father luce c vnderstode ye sayenge spake vnto wente downe wyth came nazareth obedient vnto gene b hys mother kepte sayenges hyr harte reg iesus increased wysedome age grace wyth god men iii chapter fyfteneth yeare ye empyre tiberius emperoure pontius pilate beynge lewtenaunte iewry luc herode one foure prince galile philippe hys brother one four prince ituria region trachonitis lysanias one foure prince abiline vnder anna caiphas chefe prestes dyd worde lorde happen vpon ihon sonne zachary wyldernesse math marci ioh b came coastes iordane preachynge baptyme penauce remission synnes wrytten ye boke sayenges esaye prophete sayeng esay voyce cryer deserte prepare waye lorde make hys pathes strayghte euery valley shalbe fylled euery mountayne hyll shalbe brought lowe ye croked shalbe made strayght rough shalbe turned smooth wayes flesh shall se sauynge health god math therfore sayde vnto people wente baptysed hym ye generation viper shewed flye ye wrath come worke therfore frute worthy penaunce begynne saye haue abraham father saye vnto god able stone rayse vp chyldren vnto abraham euen axe layde roote tre math b euery tre therfore bryngynge forth good frute shalbe hewen downe cast fyre people axed hym sayenge actu shall answeryng sayd vnto hath two coates let hym geue vnto hym hath none hath meate let lykewyse publican came also myght baptysed sayde vnto hym mayster shall sayde vnto nomore appoynted souldyours axed hym also sayenge shall sayde vnto violence vnto noman wronge content wyth wage people surmysynge thynkynge euery one theyr harte ihon whether happely christ dyd ihon answere sayenge vnto math b marc ioha c verely baptyse wyth water shall one come stronger tha whose shue lachet ame worthy lowse ez ch e shall baptyse holy goostand fyre mat b whose fanne hys hande shall pourge hys floure shall gather wheate hys barne chafe shall burne wyth vnque cheable fyre many thynges whych sone malalehel whych sonne cainan whych sonne enos whych sonne seth whych sonne adam whych sonne god iiii chapter iesus full holy goost dyd come agayne fro iordane math marci b dryuen sprete deserte forty dayes tempted deuel exod reg band dyd eate nothynge dayes whan finyshed hungred afterwarde ye deuell sayde vnto hym yf thou sonne god commaunde thys stone breade iesus answered hym wrytten deut b man lyueth bread euery word god deuell brought hym hygh mountayne shewed hym ye kyngdomes earthes compasse twynklynge eye sayde vnto hym wyl geue thys power glory therof geuen vnto geue vnto whome wyll yf thou therfore fallynge downe wylt worshyppe shal al thyn iesus answerynge sayde vnto hym wrytten deut c thou shalt worshyp thy lord god hym shalt thou serue brought hym ierusalem set hym vpon pinnacle temple sayde vnto hym yf thou art sonne god cast thyselfe downe wrytte psa b hath geuen hys angel charge kepe shall beare vp theyr handes lest happely thou dash thy foote agaynst stone iesus answeryng sayde vnto hym sayde deut c thou shalt tempte thy lorde god temptation beynge finyshed deuel departed hym tyme math b marc b iesus went forth galile power sprete fame hym wente thorowe al region taught theyr synagoges magnifyed euery man math marc came nazareth noryshed entred synagoge vpon sabbat hys maner rose read esdr b boke prophet esaye taken turned ouer boke fande place wrytten esay b sprete lorde vpon wherfore hath anoynted preach glad tydynges vnto ye poore hath sente heale broken harted preach delyuerauce presoners syght vnto blynde set liberte brused preach acceptable year ye lorde daye rewarde whan closed boke toke agayne vnto ministre set hym downe eye synagoge fastened vpon hym beganne saye vnto thys daye thys scrypture fulfylled youre eares math mac euery man gaue hym wytnesse wondered wordes grace whiche proceded hys mouth sayde ioh sonne ioseph sayde vnto ye shall dede saye thys prouerbe vnto phisician heale theselfe greate thynges haue herde done capernaum also thy contry verely say math g marc ioh e verely say vnto prophete accepte hys contry saye vnto truth reg iaco c ther many wedowes israel ye dayes elia whan heauen shut thre yeare syxe monethes whan ther great derth vpon al earth none elia sente saue vnto woma wedowe sa epta sidonians ther many leper israel tyme heliseus prophete none clensed saue naama syrian al ye synagoge hearing filled wrath rose thrust hym cytie led vnto toppe hyll whereon theyr citie buylt myght cast hym headlynges passynge wente thorowe myddeste math b mar b ioh b came downe capernaum cytie galile taught sabbates astonnyed hys doctrine math c luce gfor preachyng power mar cand ye synagoge ther hauynge foule deuel cryed wyth loude voyce sayenge let alone vnto v iesu nazareth arte thou come destroye v knowe thou arte holy one god iesus rebuked hym sayenge holde thy peace go forth hym whan deuell throwen hym myddes wente hym hurte ther came feare ouer al spake ech saieng thynge thys authoryte power commaunde foule spretes departe fame hym noysed thorow euery place region math b marci c iesus rysynge synagoge entred house simon simon mother lawe taken wyth great feuers besought hym standyng ouer commaunded feuer lefte rysynge forthwyth mynistred vnto hym math b marc c whan sonne gone downe sycke diuerse disease brought hym layeng hys handes vppon euery one healed marci b deuels wente many cryenge sayenge thou arte sonne god rebukyng suffered speake knewe hym christe whan become daye beynge gone forth went deserte place people soughte hym came vntyl hym helde hym le shulde go vnto whome sayde muste preache gospell kyngdome vnto cyties also thereto sente preachynge synagoges galile v chapter math c marci came passe whan ye people preassed vpon myght heare worde god stode lake genesareth sawe two shippes standynge lake fyshers gone downe dyd washe theyr nettes goynge vp one shippes whych simos prayed hym thrust lytle lande syttynge taughte people lytle shippe lefte speakynge sayd vnto simon launch oute depe let slyppe youre nettes make draught simon answerynge sayd vnto hym mayster labourynge al ye nyght haue caught nothynge vpon thy worde wyll lowse nette whan done inclosed great multitude fyshes theyr net dyd breake made sygnes theyr fellowes ye shippe yt shuld come helpe came fylled lytle shippes insomuch sanke nearehande whych whan simon peter saw fell downe iesus knyes sayenge go fro lorde synfull man astonnyed wyth hym draughte fyshes toke lykewyse also iames ihon chyldren zebede simon fellowes iesus sayde vnto simon feare henceforth shalte thou takynge men shippes beynge broughte lande math thynges beyng left followed math marci fortuned one cyties beholde man full leprosy seynge iesus fallynge downe vpon hys face besought hym sayenge lorde yf thou wylte thou canst clense stretchynge hys hande touched hym saynge wyll clensed immediatly leprosy departed hym comauded hym shulde tel vnto noma go shewe thyselfe vnto prestes offer thy clensynge leuit moses hath commaunded wytnesse vnto noyse hym wente farther abrode ther came much people myght heare hym healed theyr disease wente asyde wyldernesse prayed math marci befell vpon daye sat teachyng ther pharises doctours lawe syttyng come euerye towne galile iewry ierusalem power lorde vpon hym heale beholde certayne men bryngynge bed man palsye sought brynge hym laye hym fyndynge whych waye myght bryng people clymmed vp vpo thacke thorow ye tylynges let hym downe wyth bedde myddes iesus whose fayth dyd se sayd man thy synnes forgeuen ye scribe pharises began thynke sayenge thys speaketh blasphemy e forgeue synnes saue god wha iesus knewe theyr thoughtes answerynge sayd vnto thynke ye harte easyer say thy synnes forgeue saye ryse vp walke math marc luce yt ye may knowe sonne hath power earth forgeue synnes sayd vnto sycke palsye saye vnto aryse take vp thy bed go thy house strayghte waye rysynge afore toke vp hys bedde wherein laye wente hys house praysynge god astonnyed praysed god fylled wyth feare sayenge haue sene maruaylous thynges daye math marc b luc thys wete forth sawe publicane name leui syttynge receate custome sayd vnto hym followe thynges beynge lefte rysynge followed hym leui made hym great feast hys house ther great multytude publicanes wyth table theyr scrybes pharises murmured saynge hys disciple luce ye eate drynke wyth ye publicanes synners iesus answerynge say e vnto whole nede phisician yt sycke timo c come call ryghteous synners repentaunce math b marc b sayde vnto hym wherfo e disciple ihon fast ofte praye disciple pharises lykewyse thyne eate drynke vnto whome sayde ye make chyldren brydegrome fast lon e bryde ome wyth daye shal come wha brydegrome shalbe take fro tha shal fast dayes sayde also similitude vnto noma putteth pece new garmente olde garment el breaketh new pece new agreeth wyth ye olde noman putteth new wyne olde bottels el shal new wyne burst bottels shall runne bottels shall perysh new wyne must put new bottels saued noman drynkyng olde wyl strayght waye haue new sayeth olde better vi chapter fortuned vpon principall sabbatmath marc wha wente thorowe ye corne felde hys disciple plucked vp eares corne dyd eate rubbynge wyth theyr handes pharises sayd vnto ye lawfull sabbates iesus answerynge sayd vnto haue ye red reg b dauid dyd wha anhugered wyth hym howe entred house god toke exod c shewebreades dyd eat gaue vnto yt wyth hym whych lawfull eate saue prestes sayd vnto sonne man lorde also ye sabbat math b marci fortuned vpon another sabbat daye entred synagoge taught ther man hys ryghthad wythered ye scrybese pharyses watched whethe wold heale hym sabbat yt myght fynde wherof accuse hym knew theyr thoughtes sayd vnto man wythered hande aryse stande myddes rysyng stode vp iesus sayd vnto axe lawfull good vpo sabbat euell saue lyfe destroye loked vpo rounde sayd vnto stretch thyne hande stretched reg b hys hade restored fylled wyth madnesse spake vnto ech myght vnto iesu math c marci c fortuned dayes yt wente vp mountayne praye abydyng al nyght prayer god math marci b luce ac u b whan waxen daye called hys disciple dyd chose twelfe called apostels simon whome surnamed peter andrew hys brother iames ihon philippe bartholomew mathew thomas iames ye sone alpheus simon whyche called zelotes iude sonne iames iudas iscariot traytoure comynge downe wyth stode vpon playne felded place copany hys disciple math c mar great multitude people al iewry ierusalem see coast tyre sidon whych come myght heare hym myght healed theyr disease vexed vncleane spr te healed al people sought touche hym ther wente power hym healed math hys eye lyfted vpon hys disciple sayd blessed ye poore youres kyngdome god blessed ye hunger ye shalbe satisfyed blessed ye wepe ye shall laugh blessed shall ye wha men shal hate whan shall separate reuyle cast awaye name euell sonne man sake reioyce ye glad lo reward plenteous heauen thys wyse dyd theyr father vnto prophetes amos neuertheles wo vnto rych whyche haue consolacion wo vnto yt ful ye shall hunger wo vnto yt laughe ye shall wayle wepe wo vnto whan men blesse thys wyse dyd theyr father vnto false prophetes saye vnto heare loue enemyes well vnto hate blesse curse praye wrongfully trouble smyteth one cheke offer hym also math hym taketh awaye thy garment forbyd coate also vnto euery one axeth geue yt taketh away ye thynges thyne axe hym agayne tobi c eccli b math ye wyl men vnto ye vnto lykewyse mat yf ye loue ye loue thanke haue ye synners loue theyr louers also yf ye shall good vnto good thanke haue ye synners also yf ye lende vnto whome ye hope receaue agayn thanke haue ye synners lede vnto synners yt may receaue somuch agayne neuerthelesse loue ye youre enemyes well lende hopynge nothnge agayne rewarde shall greate ye shalbe chyldren moost hyghest kynde vpon vnthakful euel math c ye therfore mercyfull youre father also mercyfull math iudge ye shall iudged codemne ye shall condemned forgeue ye shalbe forgeuen pro c geue shalbe geuen good measure preassed shaken together ouerflowynge shall geue youre bosome math marc c measure ye shall meete shall measured agayne math b sayde similitude vnto blynde leade blynde fall ye dych math c ioh b discipell aboue mayster euery one shalbe perfecte yf mayster math seyst thou moat thy brother eye cosyderest beame thyn owne eye cast thou say vnto thy brother brother let alone shall caste moate thine eye thou thy selfe seyst beame thyn owne eye thou ypocryte cast fyrste beame oute thyne owne eye shalt thou se pul moate thy brother eye math b good tre bryngeth forth euell frutes nother euel tre bryngeth forth good frute euery tre knowen hys frute men gather fygges thornes nother gather grape bush good man good treasure hys harte bryngeth forth whych good euel man euell treasure bryngeth forth euell math abundaunce harte doth mouth speake mal math b call ye lord lorde thynges saye math c iacob c euer cometh vnto heareth wordes doeth shall shewe lyke lyke vnto buyldynge house whych dygged depe layed fundacyo vpo rocke water beynge rysen ye floude bet vpon house could moue buylded vpon rocke heareth doth lyke vnto man buyldynge hys house vpon groude wythout fundacions agaynste whych floude bet fell anone fall house became great vii chapter whan ended hys wordes people earesmath ioh entred capernaum certaine ce turions seruaunte whome loued beynge sycke dyenge whan herde iesu sent vnto hym elder iewes prayenge hym yt wold come saue hys seruaut whan come page missing vnto ary reg c reg c actu f b dead sat vp began speake toke hym hys mother ther came feare vpon magnifyed god sayenge ioha c ba great prophete rysyn vp amonge v god hath visited hys people thys sayenge hym wente thorow iewry region aboute disciple ihon shewed vnto hym thynges math aand ihon called hym two disciple sente vnto iesus sayenge arte thou whych art come shall lo another whan men come vnto hym sayde ihon baptyst sente v vnto sayenge arte thou shall come shall loke another houre healed many theyr syckenesses plage wycked spretes gaue syght many blynde answerynge sayd vnto ye goynge shewe iho ye haue herde se ne esay blynde se halte go leper clensed deafe heare dead aryse esay gospell preached vnto poore blessed offe ded math whan messau gers ihon departed began saye vnto people ihon ye gone forth wyldernesse se rede shaken wyth ye wynde ye gone forth se man clothed wyth softe raymente beholde precious raymente pleasure kynges house ye gone forth se prophete yee saye vnto prophete thys whome wrytten mala mar beholde sende myne angell thy face whyche shall prepare thy waye saye vnto greater prophete ihon baptyste ther amonge wemens chyldren ye lesser kyngdome god greater people hearynge publicanes iustifyed god beynge baptysed wyth baptyme ihon pharises lawers despysed counsel god agaynst themselues beynge baptised hym lorde sayd math c vnto shall saye men thys generacion lyke lyke lyke chyldren syttynge ye market speakyng ech sayeng haue pyped vnto ye haue daused haue mourned ye wepte ihon baptyste math cam nother eating bread drynkynge wyne ye saye hath ye deuell sonne man come eatynge drynkynge ye say behold gluttonous man wyne bybber frende publican synners wysedome iustifyed hyr chyldren math mar one pharises desyred hym wold eate wyth hym beynge gone pharises house sat downe meate behold ther woman cytie whych synner knewe iesus sat meate pharises house brought alabaster boxe oyntemente standynge behynde hys fete beganne wette hys fete wyth teares wyth heeres hyr heade drye kyssed hys fete anoynted wyth oyntmente luce pharise hadde bydden hym seynge spake wythin hymselfe sayde yf thys prophete shulde surely knowe woma thys whych toucheth hym synner iesus answerynge sayd vnto hym simon haue somwhat saye vnto sayde mayster saye certayne lender hadde two detters one dyd owe hym fyue hundreth pen fyfty hauynge wherewyth geue agayne forgaue vnto wyll therfore loue hym moost simon answerynge sayde suppose forgaue sayde thou hast iudged ryghte beynge turned woman sayde vnto simon seyste thou thys woman entred thy house thou gaueste fete water hath wetted fete wyth teares dryed wyth hyr heeres thou haste geuen kysse sence came ceassed kysse fete thou hast anoynted heade wyth oyle hath anoynted fete wyth oyntmente wherfore saye vnto many synnes forgeuen loued much whome soeuer lesse forgeue loueth lesse sayd vnto thy synnes forgeuen sa wt hym ord began saye wythin themselues thys forgeueth synnes also sayd vnto woman thy fayth hath made safe go thy waye peace viii chapter fortuned afterward wente thorow cyties townes preachynge shewynge kyngedome god twelfe wyth hym luc wome whych healed wycked spretes disease luce mary called magdalene whych cast seue deuels ioana wyfe chusa herodes stewarde susanna many whyche ministred vnto hym theyr substaunce math marci whan muche people came together haisted vnto hym cyties spake similitude ther wente oute soweth sowe hys sede whyle soweth fel way syde trode byrdes ayre dyd eate fell vpon stone beyng growen vp wythered moystnesse fell amoge thornes thornes beynge growen vp wyth choked fel vpon good grounde beynge growen vp gaue frute hundreth folde sayenge thys cryed hath eares heare let hym heare math b marci hys disciple axed similitude whome sayd vnto geuen knowe mystery kyngdome god vnto ye parable esaie b seynge se hearynge vnderstande thys ye parable sede ye word god yt ye way syde yt hear afterward cometh deuel taketh awaye ye worde theyr hart lest beleuynge saued vpon ye stone whych whan haue herde receaue worde wyth ioye haue rootes beleue tyme tyme temtacion go backe fel amonge thornes haue herde goynge choked care ryches pleasure thys lyfe brynge frute fell good grounde good best harte hearynge worde kepe brynge forth frute pacience math b marci b luce c noman lyghtynge candle couereth wyth vessell putteth vnder table setteth vpon candelsticke commers maye se lyght math marci ther nothynge hyd shal manifest nother secrete shall knowen come openly take hede therfore ye heare math b c marci c luce c hath vnto hym shalbe geue hath also thynketh haue shalbe take fro hym ther came vnto hym hys mother brethre coulde come ye people shewed hym thy mother thy brother stande wythout wyllynge se whych answeryng sayd vnto mother brother whyche heare worde math c marci fortuned one dayes hys disciple went vp lytle shippe sayd vnto let v go ouer lake wente vp sayled slepte ther came downe storme wynde ye lake fylled wyth water ieopardy co myng neare waked hym vp sayeng mayster perysh rysyng vp rebuked wynde tempest water ceassed waxed calme sayd vnto fayth whyche beynge afrayed maruayled sayenge ech trowe ye thys commaundeth wyndes see obey hym math marc cand sayled vnto region gerasenites whych ouer agaynst galile whan gone shippe vpo lade ther met hym man whyche deuell longe tyme clothed wyth ony rayment nother taryed house graues whan sawe iesus fell downe hym cryenge wyth loude voyce sayd vnto thou iesu sone moost hyghest beseke tormente commau ded foule sprete shuld go dyd catch hym many tymes bounde wyth cheynes kepte wyth fetter bondes beyng burst sunder dryuen deserte iesus axed hym sayenge thy name sayd legio ther many deuels entred hym prayed hym wolde commaude shulde go depe math mar ther heerd many swyne fedyng moutayne prayed hym wolde permytte entre gaue leue departed deuels man entred swyne rush wente heerde headlynges lake drowned whyche whan fedde sawe done fled shewed cytie village wente se done came iesus faude man deuels departed syttyng clothed hys fete hys ryght mynde feared sene tolde also made whole legion multitude contry gera enites besoughte hym wolde departe taken wyth great feare marci goynge vp shippe turned agayne man whome ye deuels departed prayed myght wyth hym iesus lefte hym sayenge go agayn thy house shewe great thynges god hath done vnto wente thorow whole cytie preachynge great thynges iesus done vnto hym math marc c fortuned wha iesus came agayne ye people receaued al waited hym behold ther man whose name iairus prynce synagoge fell iesus fete prayenge hym wolde entre hys house doughter nearehande twelfe yeare age laye adyenge fortuned wente thronged people woma bloudye yssue twelfe yeares whych spente hyr substaunce vpon phisicians nother coulde healed ony man came behynd touched hemme hys garmente strayght waye stauched yssue hyr bloude iesus sayd touched whan euery denyed dyd peter saye mayster people thronge trouble sayest thou touched iesus sayd bodye hathe touched perceaue power gone fro woma seynge hyd came tremblynge fell downe hys fete shewed al people cause touched hym continently healed sayd vnto doughter thy fayth hath made whole go thy waye peace math c marci da yet speakyng ther cam one feo prince sinagoge sayenge vnto hym thy doughter dead trouble hym worde beynge herde iesus answered vnto father damsel feare beleue shal safe whan came house suffred ony entr saue peter iames iho father mother damsell wepte bewayled sayd wepe damsell dead ioha b slepeth laughed hym scorne knowynge well dead holdynge hyr hande cryed sayenge damsell aryse hyr sprete came againe rose continently bad geue eate hyr elder astonnyed vnto commaunded shulde tell vnto noma done ix chapter math mar b luce b twelf apostle beyn called together iesus gaue power authorite ouer al deuels shulde heale disease sente preach kyngdome god heale sycke said vnto mar b luce ye shall take nothynge wyth waye nother staffe nother wallet nother bread nother mony nother haue ye two coates soeuer house ye entre remayne go fro thence math b marci b actu receaueth ye goynge cytie shake euen dust fete wytnesse ouer goynge forth wente townes preachynge healyng euery math marc b herode one foure prince herde thynges done hym douted sayde ihon rysen deade elia appeared one olde prophetes rysen herode sayde ihon haue beheaded thys heare thynges sought se hym math b marc ha apostle beynge come agayne shewed hym whatsoeuer done taken wyth hym wente asyde deserte place cytie bethsaida whych whan people knew followed hym receaued spake vnto ye kyngdome god hadde nede cure healed ye day begonne wende awaye twelfe commynge neare sayde vnto hym let go people goynge townes village may lodge fynde meates wyldernesse sayd vnto geue ye eate sayd haue nomore fyue loaues two fyshes wythout shall go bye meates people ther neare hande fyue thousande men sayde vnto hys disciple cause syt downe fyftyes company dyd set fyue loaues beynge taken two fyshes loked vp vnto heauen blessed brake gaue vnto hys disciple shulde set ye people dyd eate satisfyed ther take vp remayned twelfe baskettes broken peces math marc fortuned whan alone prayenge hys disciple also wyth hym axed sayeng people saye answered said ihon baptiste elia saye one ye olde prophetes rysen sayd vnto whome ye saye simon peter answeryng sayd oh g christ god rebukynge charged shulde tell vnto noman sayenge math c b mat luce sonne man must suffre many thynges reproued elder hygh prestes scrybes put death ryse agayne thyrde daye sayde vnto marc c wyll come let hym denye hymselfe take vp hys crosse dayly follow luce dfor wyll saue hys lyfe shall lose shall lose hys lyfe sake shall saue doeth profyte man yf dydde wynne ye whole worlde lose hym selfe runne damage hymselfe math marci luce ashamed wordes shall sonne man ashamed whan shall come hys maieste father holy angel math marci c truely saye vnto ther standynge whych shall tayst death tyl se ye kyngdo god math marci happened neare hande eyght dayes wordes toke hym peter iames ihon wet vp mou tayne pray prayed pet ye fashion hys coutenauce chau ged apparel whyte shyninge beholde two spake wt hym moses elia whych wer sene maiesty told hys departynge whych shulde fulfyll ierusalem peter wyth hym heuy slepe awakyng saw hys maiesty two men yt stode wyth hym math marc fortuned whan departed fro hym peter sayde iesu mayster good v let v make thre tabernacle one one moses one elia knowynge sayd speakynge thys ther came cloude ouershadowed entred cloud feared ther happened voyce cloude sayenge thys welbeloued sonne deut heare hym wha voyce happened iesus foud alone held theyr peace sayd nothynge ony man dayes thynges yt sene math b mar b chaunched nexte daye came downe fro mount great people met hym beholde man company ryed sayeng mayster beseke loke vpon sone myn sonne beholde sprete taketh hym sodenly cryeth knocketh teareth hym wt fome tearynge hym doth scarcely departe prayed thy disciple cast hym could iesus answerynge sayd vnfaythfull croked generacion howe longe shall wyth suffre brynge hether thy sonne whan came neare deuell dyd rente teare hym iesus rebuked foule sprete healed chylde toke hym hys father agayn mar c luce al astonyed ye greatnesse god whyle al maruayled al thinges yt dyd sayd vnto hys disciple laye ye vp wordes harte math c b mar luce g sone shalbe betraied ye handes perceaued thys sayenge hyd fro shuld vnderstade feared axe saynge math mar luc b ther entred thought amonge whych shulde greater iesus seynge thought theyr harte toke chylde set hym hymselfe sayd vnto math mat luc b ioha c whoso receaueth thys chylde name receaueth shall receaue receaueth hym sente math mar e luce b leest amonge greatest ihon answerynge sayde mayster saw one castyng deuels thy name forbad hym followeth wyth v iesus sayd vnto forbyd hym agaynst wyth fortuned whan dayes hys takynge vp fulfylled hadde fyxed hys face go ierusalem sente messaungers hys syghte goynge entred towne samaritanes shuld prepare lodgynge vnto hym receaued hym hys face one goynge ierusalem whan hys disciple iames ihon sawe sayde lorde wylt thou comaude fyre come downe heauen consume beynge turned rebuked sayenge ye knowe whose sprete ye sonne man cam destroye soules saue wente another towne math c chaunced walkyng way one sayd vnto wyll followe euer thou shalte go iesus sayd vnto hym fox haue hole byrdes ayre nestes sonne hath laye hys head math cand sayd vnto another followe sayd lorde suffre fyrst go bury father iesus sayde vnto hym leui b let dead bury theyr dead go thou preach ye kyngdom god another sayd lord wyl follow reg suffre fyrste byd farewell yt home iesus sayd vnto pet noma layenge hys hade ye plough lokynge backe mete kyngdome god x chapter thys appoynted lord two seuenty also sent two two hym euery cytie place hymselfe comynge sayd vnto marci b haruest verely great labourer fewe pray therfore lorde haruest sende labourer hys haruest math b go way behold sende labes amoge wolues math marci luc bear wal et scrippe shewes reg dsalute noma ye way euer house ye entre fyrst say peace vnto house yf ye chylde peace peace shal st vpon hym yf shall returne vnto agayne tary ye house eatynge drynkynge haue labourer worthy hys rewarde go house house soeuer cytie ye shall entre receaue ate suche thynges set afore heale sycke therin saye vnto kyngdome god come nye vpon math b marci b luce actu soeuer cytie ye shall entre shall receaue ye goynge cytie saye euen dust cytie clyueth vnto v wepe agaynst neuerthelesse sure thys kyngdome god come nye saye vnto shalbe easyer sodome ye daye tha vnto ye cytie math dwo vnto ye chorozaim wo vnto ye bethsaida yf ye miracle ben done tyre sidon yt haue bene done amonge done penauce loge ago syttyng sackcloth ash neuerthelesse shalbe easyer tyre sido ye iudgemet vnto ye capernaum beynge exalted vntyl heaue vntyl hell shalt yt thrust downe math marc ioha yt heareth heareth yt despyseth despyseth despyseth despyseth hym yt sente lxxii came agayne wt ioye sayenge lord deuels also subdued vnto v thy name sayd vnto esay apoc saw sata fal fro heaue lyke lyghtenyng beholde marc c actu haue geuen power treade vpon serpentes scorpion vpon al power enemy nothynge shall hurt neuerthelesse reioyce yt spretes subdued vnto reioyce yt phili apoc b name wrytte heaues mat e ye houre reioyced iesus ye holy goost said prayse father lord heaue earth thou hast hyd thynges wyse prudent hast opened vnto lytle one euen father pleased math c ioha aall thynges geuen father mat ioh c b b noma knoweth ye sone saue ye father ye father saue sone sone wyl shewe mat c beynge turned vnto hys disciple sayde blessed eyen whych se ye se saye vnto many prophetes kynges wold haue sene thynges ye se haue sen heare ye heare haue herde math marc c beholde ther rose lawer temptynge hym sayenge mayster wyth doynge shall possesse lyfe euerlastynge sayd vnto hym wrytten lawe doest thou reade answerynge sayd deu b thou shalt loue lorde thy god wyth thy harte wyth thy soule wyth thy strengthe wyth thy mynde leuit e rom b thy neghboure thy selfe sayd vnto hym thou hast answered ryght thou shalte lyue wyllynge iustifye hymselfe sayde vnto iesus neghboure iesus lokynge vp sayde certayne man wente downe ierusalem hierico fell amonge murtherers also spoiled layed strypes hym wente awaye hym beyng lefte halfe dead chaunced prest wente downe waye seynge hym wente lykewyse also leuite whan place sawe hym wente samaritane nyenge came hym seynge hym moued pytie comyng neare boude vp hys wou de pourynge oyle wyne layenge hym vpon hys beast brought hym ynne prouyded hym nexte daye toke two pen gaue vnto hoost sayde take hede hym euer thou layest whan come agayne shal restore whych thre thynkest thou haue bene neghboure vnto hym fell amonge murtherers sayd shewed mercy hym iesus sayd vnto hym go thy waye thou lykewyse fortuned wente entred certain towne certayne woma martha name receaued hyr house syster name mary whyche also deut syttynge lordes fete herde worde martha busyed selfe greatly aboute muche seruyng stode sayde lorde carest thou syster letteth serue alone tell therfore helpe lorde answerynge sayd vnto martha martha thou arte carefull co bred many thynges psal one thynge nedefull mary hath chosen best part whych shal taken xi chapter fortuned place prayenge lefte one hys disciple sayd vnto hym lorde teache v praye ihon taught hys disciple sayd vnto math whan ye praye saye father hallowed thy name thy kyngdome come thy wyl done geue v thys daye dayly bread forgeue v oure synnes also forgeue vnto euery one oweth v leade v tentacion sayde vnto whych shall haue frede shall go vnto mydnyght shall saye vnto hym frende lende thre loaues frende myne come vnto oute waye haue may set hym wythin answerynge saye trouble dore shut childre wyth chamber ryse geue yf continue knockynge saye vnto though rysynge geue hym hys frende yet shall ryse hys vnshamefastnesse shall geue hym many hath nede pro b math ioha b b c saye vnto axe shalbe geuen seke ye shal fynde knock vnto shalbe opened euery one axeth receaueth seketh fyndeth vnto hym ye knocketh shalbe opened yf axe hys father bread wyll geue hym stone yf shall axe fysh wyll steade fysh geue hym serpente yf shall axe egge wyll reach hym scorpion yf ye whan ye euell geue good gyftes vnto chyldren howe muche shall father heaue geue good sprete vnto axe hym math c castynge deuell domme whan cast deuell dome dyd speake people maruayled marc bbut sayd beelzebub prince deuels doth cast deuels tempting hym requyred toke heauen wha sawe ye thoughtes theyr harte sayd vnto euery kyngdome diuided selfe shalbe desolate house shall fall vpo house yf satan diuided hymselfe shall hys kingdome stande seynge ye saye cast deuels beelzebub yf dryue deuels beelzebub chyldren cast therfore shal iudges moreouer yf cast deuels ye fynger god tha verely ye kyngdome god come vpo marc c wha stroge beyng harnessed kepeth hys house thynges yt possesseth rest collo b yf one stroger tha fallynge vpon ouercome shal take away al weapes whych trusted shal distribute hys spoyles wyth agaynst gathereth wyth scattereth abrode math c whan vncleane sprete gone walketh thorowe drye place sekynge rest fyndynge sayeth wyll returne agayne house whence wente whan cometh fyndeth swept garnyshed goeth taketh wyth hym seuen spretes worse hymselfe beynge entred dwell last thynges man become worse fyrst fortuned whan sayd certayne woman ye people lyftynge vp hyr voyce sayde vnto hym blessed wombe hath borne brestes gaue suck sayd yee blessed heare ye worde god kepe people runnynge together began saye math marci b thys generacio wycked generacion seketh token ther shall token geuen hym saue ye token prophete ionas io b lyke ionas token vnto niniuites euen shall also ye sonne man vnto thys generacion reg pa quene south shall ryse iudgement wyth ye men thys generacyon shall condemne came endes earth heare wysedome salomo beholde one salomon niniue shal ryse iudgement wyth thys generacion co demne dyd penauce preachynge ionas beholde one tha ionas math b marc b luce bnoman lyghteth candle setteth ye darke nother vnder bushell vpon candelsticke come maye se lyght math c lyght thy body thyne eye yf thyne eye syngle al thy body shal shynynge yf wycked thy body shalbe darke beware therfore lyght yt darkenesse yf thy body tha al full lyght hauynge parte darkenesse shall shynynge shall lyghten lyke lyghte lyghtenynge whan dyd speake certayne pharise besought hym wold dyne hym iesus beynge gone sat borde wyth hym pharise began thynkynge hymselfe saye washen dyner lorde sayd vnto hym math c ye pharises clese outsyde platter cuppe insyde full robbery wyckednesse ye fooles hath made wythin made also wythout esaie b neuerthelesse ouer geue almesse behold al thynges cleane vnto math cbut wo vnto pharises whych tyth mynte rue maner herbes passe ouer iudgemet loue god oughte haue ben done leaue behynde math marc luc wo vnto pharises ye loue fyrst seates synagoges salutacios market wo vnto scrybes pharises ye hypocrite ye graues appeare men walkynge ouer know one ye lawers answering sayd vnto hym mayster sayenge thys thou puttest v rebuke also sayde math wo vnto lawers ye charge wyth burthen whych bear ye touche burthen wt one fynger math wo vnto buylde tombes prophetes youre father haue slayne doutlesse ye beare wytnesse ye consente vnto workes father verely haue slayne ye buylde theyr tombes math e therfore said wysedome god shall sende vnto prophetes apostle shall slaye persecute thys generacion may requyred bloude al prophetes hath ben shed constitucion worlde gen b bloude abell vntyll par bloude zachary whych peryshed betwene altare temple verely saye vnto shalbe requyred thys generacion math b wo vnto lawers whyche haue taken awaye keye knowlege ye youre selues entred dyd entre haue ye forbydden whan sayd thys vnto pharises lawers beganne earnestly lye vpon hym stoppe hys mouthe wyth many thynges layenge wayte sekynge catche somwhat oute hys mouth myght accuse hym xii chapter mvch people runnynge together insomuche yt trode one another began saye vnto hys disciple math marci b beware leuen pharises whych hypocrisy sap b math marci b luce b ther nothyng hyd shal disclosed nother secrete yt shal knowen ye haue spoken darkensse shalbe sayd lyght ye haue spoken eare chabres shalbe preached vpon thackes math pac c saye vnto frendes afrayed slaye bodye haue nomore maye shall shewe whome ye shall feare feare hym whych hath slayne hath power sende hell yee saye vnto feare hym math fyue sparowes solde two farthynges yet one forgotten god yee heeres youre heade nombred feare ye therfore ye worth many sparowes saye vnto math marci c luce c apoc shall knowlege men sonne man shall also knowlege hym ye angel god denyeth shalbe denyed angel god math c marc c euery one speaketh worde agaynst sonne man shalbe forgeuen hym vnto hym blasphemeth agaynst holy goost shal forgeuen math c marci b luce b whan shall bryng synagoges vnto ruler power careful ye shall answere ye shall saye holy goost shal houre teach ye ought say one ye people said vnto hym mayster byd brother dyuide heretage wyth sayd vnto hym man hath set iudge parter heretage ouer sayd vnto take hede beware maner couetousnesse lyfe ony man consysteth abundaunce possesseth tolde similitude sayeng certayne rych ma felde brought forth pleteous frutes thought hymselfe sayeng shal haue wherin may gather frutes sayd thys wyll wyl breake downe barnes make greater therein wyll gather thynges growen vnto goodes shall saye vnto soule eccli c soule thou hast much goodes layed vp stoare many yeares take thy reste eate drynke fare delicatly god sayd vnto hym iere b thou foole thys nyght requyre thy soule fro thynges thou hast prepared psal whose shal one gathereth treasure vnto hymself rych god said vnto hys disciple therfore saye vnto psal c math c pet carefull lyfe ye shall eate body ye shal put lyfe meate body rayment consyder ye rauens sowe nother reape whych haue nother celler barne yet doth god fede howe muche better ye math dwhych takynge thoughte put one cubyte hys stature yf ye therfore able leest ye carefull rest cosyder ye lyly growe labour nother spynne saye vnto nother salomon clothed hys maieste one yf god doth clothe ye grasse yt day felde morow put ouen much ye lytle fayth axe ye ye shal eate ye shal drynke lyfted hygh thynges al ye heythen ye worlde seke yee heauely father knoweth yt ye haue nede thynges reg b seke ye fyrst kyngdome god hys ryghteousnesse al thynges shalbe ministred vnto deut c feare ye lytle flocke father wyl geue kyngdome sell ye haue geue almesse math c c make bagges waxe olde euen treasure fayleth ye heaues thefe cometh neare nother moat doth corruppe treasure shal also harte ephes b pet c let loynes gyrded lyghtes burnynge handes ye lyke men waytynge theyr lorde whan shal returne fro weddyng whan shall come knocke maye strayghte waye open vnto hym happye seruauntes whyche whan lorde shall come shall fynde wakynge verely saye vnto luce b shal gyrde hymselfe aboute shal cause syt downe borde walkynge shall minister vnto yf come seconde watch yf come thyrde watch fynde happye seruauntes math mar sure thys yf goodman house dydde knowe houre thefe wolde come wold surely watch wolde suffre house dygged thorow math aand ye also ready houre ye thynke shall sone man come peter sayd vnto hym lorde doest thou tel thys similitude vnto v vnto lorde sayde thynke ye math b faythfull wyse steward whome hys lorde setteth ouer hys husholde maye geue measure wheat due season apoc c happy seruaunte whome whan hys lord shall come shall fynde doynge verely saye vnto shall sette hym ouer possesseth yf seruaunt saye hys harte math lorde maketh longe come shall begyn smyte seruauntes maydens eat drynke dronken lord seruaut shal come daye thynketh houre knoweth shall diuide hym set hys parte wyth infidel iacobi b seruaunte knewe wyll hys lorde dyd prepare hymselfe dyd hys wyl shalbe beaten wyth many strypes knew dyd thynges worthy strypes shalbe beaten wyth fewe vnto euery one much geuen much shalbe requyred hym vnto whome haue commytted much shal requyre hym come sende fyre earth wold saue yt kyndled muste math baptysed wyth baptyme payned vntyll fulended math suppose ye come sende peace earth tell naye diuision henceforth shall fyue diuided one house thre agaynst two two agaynst thre mich shalbe diuided father agaynst sonne ye sone agaynst hys father mother agaynst doughter ye doughter hyr mother mother lawe agaynste doughter lawe doughter lawe agaynst hyr mother lawe sayd vnto ye people math wha ye shal se cloude rysynge west anone ye saye ther cometh shower happeneth whan southwynde bloweth ye saye shalbe whote happeneth ye hypocrite ye discerne vtter appearauce ye sky earth discern tyme iudge ye youre selues ryght prou b eccli math c wha thou goest ye way wyth thyne aduersary vnto ye prince geue diligence delyuered hym lest delyuer yt vnto ye iudge iudge deliuer iaylar iaylar sende preson tell thou shalte go thence vntyll thou shalte haue geuen euen vtmoost myte xiii chapter ther present tyme shewynge hym ac galilean whose bloude pilate dyd mixe wt theyr sacrifice answerynge sayd vnto thynke ye yt galilean synners galilean suffred thynges tell naye excepte ye haue repentauce ye shall perysh lykewyse eyghtene vppon whome tower siloe fel kylled suppose ye also better al men dwellyng ierusalem tell yf ye haue repentaunce ye shal dye lykewyse sayd also thys similitude math b acertayne man hadde fygge tre planted hys vyneyarde came sekynge frute theron founde none sayde vnto dresser vyneyarde lo thre yeare ago sence come sekyng frute thys fygge tre fynde none hew downe therfore doth also combre groude answerynge sayd vnto hym syr let alone also thys yeare tyll dygge aboute douge yf happely wyll brynge frute yf thou shalt hewe downe afterwarde teachynge theyr synagoge vpon sabbattes beholde woman whych sprete sycknesse eyghtene yeare roked nother coulde loke vp ony thynge whome whan iesus sene called vnto sayd vnto woman thou art ryd thy sycknesse layed hys handes vpon forthwyth made strayght glorifyed god ruler synagoge takynge indignacion iesus healed sabbat answerynge sayd vnto people ther syxe dayes wherin man muste worke therfore come healed sabbat daye ye lorde answerynge sayd vnto hym ye hypocrite deut luc doth euery one lowse hys oxe asse maunger leadeth water ought thys doughter abraham whome beholde satan bounde eyghtene yeares lowsed thys bonde sabbatdaye whan sayde thys hys aduersaryes ashamed al people reioyced thynges yt gloriously done hym math marci c sayd therfore wherevnto ye kyngdome god lyke vnto shal lyken lyke vnto mustarde sede whych beynge taken man caste hys garden grewe became great tre byrdes ayre rested hys braunches math e agayne sayd wherevnto shall suppose ye kyngdo god lyke lyke leue gene ye take woma hideth thre peckes meele tyl leuended math marc went thorow townes cyties teachynge yourneynge towarde ierusale one sayd vnto hym lord ther fewe shalbe saued sayd vnto math b stryue entre thorowe narow gate tell many shall seke entre shall able whan good man house shalbe entred shall haue shut dore ye shall begynne stande wythout knocke ye dore sayenge math lorde open vnto v answerynge shall say vnto knowe whence ye shall ye begynne saye haue eaten dronke thou hast taught stretes shall saye vnto knowe whence ye psal b math b depart fro ye worker wyckednesse shalbe wepynge gnasshynge teth whan ye shall se abraham isaac iacob ye prophetes kyngdome god dryuen math b shall come easte west north south shall sytte downe borde kyngdome god h b marci c beholde last fyrst fyrst last vpon daye ther came certayne ye pharises sayeng vnto go forth get hence herode wyll slaye sayd vnto go tell foxe beholde cast deuels heale daye morowe thyrde daye fynyshe neuerthelesse must walke day morow nexte prophete dye wythout ierusalem math ierusalem ierusalem whych slayest prophetes stonest sente vnto oft wold haue gathered thy chyldren byrde gathereth hyr nest vnder hir fethers thou woldest beholde house shalbe lefte voyde vnto saye vnto ye shall se tyll come passe ye saye psal c luce c blessed commeth name lorde xiiii chapter happened whan iesus com ye house one chefe pharises vpo sabbat day eate bread watched beholde ther man yt dropsy hym iesus answerynge sayd vnto lawers pharises sayenge math b marc lu b lawfull heale vpon sabbat helde theyr peace hym beynge take healed hym let hym go answering said vnto whose oxe asse shall fal pytte shall strayght waye exodi deut b drawe hym oute sabbat daye coulde answere hym thys sayd similitude vnto ydden markynge chose fyrst rowmes sayenge vnto whan thou arte bydden weddynge syt downe ye fyrst rowme leste happely honorable man thou bydden hym commynge hath bydden hym saye vnto geue thys rowme thou begynne wt shame occupy ye lowest rowme whan thou shalt bydden go page duplicate page duplicate thy waye syt downe lowest rowme whan hath bydden shal come maye saye vnto pro frende go vp hygher tha shalte thou haue prayse syt borde wyth math b luce b euery one exalteth hymselfe shalbe made lowe hubleth selfe shalbe exalted sayd also vnto hym bydden hym whan thou makest dyner supper call thy frendes thy brother thy kynsfolkes nother thy neghboures ryche leste byd agayne recompence made vnto tobi c whan thou makest feast call poore feble crepell blynde happy shalte thou haue recopece shalbe recope ced ye resurreccion ryghteous whan one sat borde herd said vnto hym happy shal eate breade kyngdome god sayd vnto hym math apoc c certayne made great supper called many sente hys seruaunt houre supper saye vnto bydden yt thy shulde come thynges ready al began alyke make excuse fyrst sayd vnto hym haue bought farme must nedes go forth se pray haue excused sayde haue boughte fyue yocke ox go proue pray haue excused thyrde sayd haue maryed wyfe therfore come ye seruaute beynge returned shewed thys vnto hys lorde good man ye house beynge angrye sayde vnto hys seruaunte go quyckely ye stretes quarter cytie brynge nedy crepell blynde halte seruaunt sayd lorde done thou hast commaunded ther yet rowme ye lorde said vnto seruaunt go hygh wayes hedge gene luce c copell come house may fylled saye vnto none men bydden shal tayst supper ther wet much people wyth hym beynge turned sayd vnto deut math dwho commeth vnto doth hate hys father mother wyfe chyldren brother systers yee hys owne lyfe also disciple beareth hys crosse commeth disciple whych wyllyng buyld tower syttynge downe rekeneth fyrst costes necessary whether haue sufficient perfourme left haue layde fundament able perfourm se begyn mocke hym sayenge thys man hath begon buylde able perfourme kynge shall go make battayll agaynste another kynge syttynge downe casteth fyrst hys mynde whether wyth ten thousande able mete hym cometh agaynst hym wt twenty thousande el whyle yet farre sendynge embassage doth requyre thynges beloge peace euen therfore euery one doth renounce yt possesseth disciple math b mar salt good yf salt vnsauery wherin shall seasoned nother profytable vpo ye lande vpon dounge hyll shal cast awaye hath eares heare let hym heare xv chapter ther math b marci b luce approchynge vnto hym publicanes synners myght heare hym scribe pharises murmured sayeng luce thys man receaueth sinner eateth wyth tolde parable vnto sayenge math b man amonge hath hundreth shepe yf lose one doth leaue nyne nynty wyldernesse goeth lost vntyll fynde whan hath foude layeth vpon hys shulders reioycynge commynge home calleth together hys frendes neghboures sayeng vnto reioyce wyth haue foude shepe lost saye vnto lyke ioye shalbe heauen ouer one synner doynge penaunce ouer nyne nynty ryghteous luce nede penaunce woman hauynge ten grotes yf lese one grote doth lyght candle swepeth ye house seketh diligetly tyll haue foude whan hath founde calleth together hyr frendes neghbouresses sayeng reioyce haue founde grote lost euen saye vnto shall ther ioye angel god vpon one synner doynge penaunce sayd certayne man two sonnes yonger sayd vnto hys father father geue porcion goodes belongeth vnto diuided substaunce vnto longe thereafter thynges beynge gathered together yonger sonne wente forth farre contry waysted hys goodes wyth lyuynge ryotously spente ther happened greate derth region beganne wante wente ioyned hymselfe vnto one cytesins contrye sent hym hys farme shuld fede swyne coueted fyll hys belly wyth coddes swyne dyd eate noman gaue hym beynge come hymselfe sayde many hyred seruauntes father house haue plentye breades peryshe honger wyll ryse go father shall saye vnto hym father haue synned heauen nowe worthy called thy sonne make one thy hyred seruauntes rysynge vp came hys father psal iob b whan yet farre hys father sawe hym moued wyth pytie runnyng hym fell aboute hys necke kyssed hym sonne sayde vnto hym father haue synned heauen nowe worthy called thy sonne father sayd vnto hys seruautes brynge forth quyckely best garment put vpon geue hym rynge vpon hys hade shues hys fete brynge hether fed calfe kyll let v eate let v merye thys sonne dead reuiued loste founde began mery hys elder sonne ye felde whan dyd come approched house herde ye minstrelsye daunsynge called one seruauntes axed thynges said vnto thy brother ome thy father hath slayne fed calfe hath receaued hym safe wroth
