eche yf ye seke ony thynge maye dispatched lawfull congregacion also stande ieoparde accused dayes vproure seyng ther noman gylty whome maye geue counte thys vproure whan sayde thynges let congregacion go xx chapter bvt vproure ceassed paule disciple beyng called exhorted farewell went hys waye timo go macedonia whan walked thorowe party exhorted wyth many wordes cam grekelade ben thre monethes wayte layde iewes wyllynge sayle syria counselled shulde returne macedony ther accompanyed hym sosipater pyrrhus sonne berrhea thessalonica aristarchus secundus gaius derbeus timotheus asia tychicus actu tim c trophimus whan gone afore taryed v troas sayled fro philippos dayes swete breade came vnto troas fyue dayes dyd abyde seuen dayes vpon ye fyrst daye sabbattes whan come together breake breade paule ready go morowe disputed wyth continued preachynge vntyll mydnyghte ther lyghtes plenty parloure gathered certayne yonge man name eutichus syttynge wyndowe wha ouercome wyth heuy slepe paule reasoned longe beynge ouertaken wyth slepe fell thyrde lofte downe take vp deade vnto whome whan paule come downe reg c reg leaned vpon hym claspynge hym aboute said ye troubled soule wythin hym goynge vp actu e cor bbreakyng breade eatynge speakynge ynoughe vntyll lyght wente hys waye brought chylde lyuyng lytle comforted goynge vp ye shippe sayled vnto asson wyllynge thence take paule intended hymselfe wyllynge yourney lande whan come together asson hym beynge taken came mitylene saylynge thence came daye followynge agaynst chius ye next daye aryued samos daye followynge came miletus paule purposed sayle ephesus lest ony taryenge shuld happe vnto hym asia actu haisted yf ben possible haue kept hys feast wytsontyde ierusale sendyng fro miletus ephesus called ye elder ye cogregacio whyche whan come hym together sayde vnto ye knowe howe haue ben wyth tyme sence fyrst daye actu entred asia seruynge lorde humblynesse teares teptacions haue happened vnto layenges wayte iewes howe haue wythdrawe nothyng profitable vnto shulde haue shewed taught openly house house testifyenge vnto iewes gentyles luce repentaunce godwarde fayth oure lorde iesus christ beholde constrayned sprete go ierusalem knowynge thynges shall happen vnto saue actu b holy goost wytnesseth vnto openly euery cytie sayenge bandes tribulacions abyde ierusalem tim feare none thynges nother coute lyfe worth myselfe farre maye fulfyll course seruice worde haue receaued lorde iesus namely testifye glad tydynges grace god beholde know ye shall se face nomore whome haue gone preachynge kyngdome god wherfore take recorde thys daye ame regu fvngylty bloude men haue drawen backe shulde shewe counsell god take hede vnto youre selues al flocke amonge whych holy goost hath set byshops rule cogregacio god whyche hath purchased wyth hys bloude knowe tim pet departyng shal rauenous wolues entre amonge sparynge flocke ioha c ioha c fro amoge yourselues shall men ryse speakynge ouerthwart thynges may drawe disciple whych cause watche ye hauynge mynde haue ceassed ye space thre yeare nyght daye admonyshynge euery one wyth teares commende vnto god vnto worde hys grace whych myghty edify geue inheritauce amoge al yt sanctifyed cori b b haue desyred syluer golde cloth noma ye knowe thynges yt nedeful vnto yt wt gene cori b tessa haue handes holpen haue shewed thynges labourynge ought receaue weake remebre worde lorde iesu sayd blessed geue take wha sayd thynges hys knee bowed actu prayed wyth ther happened great wepynge fallynge vpo paules necke kyssed hym beynge greatlye greued worde sayde shulde se hys face nomore broughte hym shyppe xxi chapter wha happened sayled beynge drawen awaye came ye strayghte course cous nexte daye rhodus fro thence patara wha founde shippe saylynge ouer vnto phenice goynge vp sayled whan cypers syght leauynge lefte hande sayled siria came tyre shulde shippe vnlade disciple beyng foude abode seuen dayes actu sayd vnto paule sprete yt shuld go vp ierusale dayes beyng fulfylled beyng departed wente wayes bryngynge v wt theyr wyues chyldre vntyll forth cytie knee bowed actu c prayed shore wha bydde ech fare wel wet vp ye ship went agayne vnto theyrs saylynge fro tyre beynge fynished came downe ptolomais brother beynge saluted abode one daye wyth beynge gone forth next daye came cesarea entrynge house actu philippe euangeliste one seuen dyd abyde wyth hym seuen doughters virgin ioel prophecied wha dyd abyde certayne dayes ther cam certayn prophete iewry name actu c agabus whan come vnto v toke paul gyrdel byndyng hym hys fete hades sayd thys sayth ye holy goost actu whose girdel shal ye iews bind thus ierusale shall delyuer ye ha de ye heythe wha herde yt place prayed wold go vp ierusale answered paule sayd ye wepynge puttynge harte distresse actu ci onely ready boude ierusale name ye lord iesus also dye whan coulde persuade hym ceassed sayenge math b lordes wyll done beynge ready dayes wente vp ierusalem disciple cesarea came wyth v bryngynge wyth one mnason cypers olde disciple wyth whome myght lodge whan came ierusalem brethre receaued v gladly nexte daye wente paule wyth v vnto iames elder assembled whyche wha saluted shewed order thynges god done amonge heythen hys ministracion whan herde magnifyed god sayd vnto hym brother thou seyst many thousandes amonge iewes haue beleued al zelous ouer lawe haue herde thou doest teach iewes departynge moses amonge heythen sayenge theyr chyldren nedynge circumcised nother walke accordynge costume therfore multitude verely muste come together shall heare come thys therfore saye vnto haue foure men hauynge num b actu b vowe vpo beynge take sanctifye thyselfe wyth cost vpon shaue theyr heades euery man shal knowe yt thinges yt haue herde yt false thou also walkest kepyng ye law vnto heythen haue beleued haue actu wrytten geuynge sentence absteyne themselues offered vnto idol bloude stranguled fornicacion actu b paule taken hym beynge purifyed nexte daye entred wyth temple shewynge fulfyllynge dayes vntyll ther offered oblacion euery one whan seuen dayes fulfylled whan iewes asia sawe hym temple moued people layde handes hym cryenge ye men israel helpe thys whych teachynge men euery agaynste thys people lawe place hath also moreouer brought heythen temple defyled thys holy place hadde sene actu tim trophimus ephesian wt hym cytie whome supposed paule brought temple al cytie moued ther made runnynge together people takynge paule drue hym oute temple strayghtwaye dores shut whan sought kyll hym shewed vnto captayne company al ierusale moued forthwyth souldyers taken wyth hym captaynes ouer hundreth ranne downe whych whan sene captayne souldyours ceassed beat paule captayne comynge neare toke hym commauded hym accu b bounde wyth two cheynes axed done cryed one thynge another thynge amonge people whan coulde knowe certaynte vproure commau ded hym led castell whan come steppe fortuned borne vp souldyours violence people multytude people followed cryenge luce bhaue hym awaye whan beganne broughte castell paule sayd vnto ye captayne maye speake somethynge vnto sayd vnto hym canst thou greke arte thou egipcian afore dayes haste raysed vproure hast brought ye wyldernesse foure thousande pryue murtherers paule sayde vnto hym verely iewe fre cytesin actu b tharsus cilicia cytie vnknowen praye let speake vnto people wha permytted hym paule standynge vpon steppe beckened wyth hande vnto people whan ther made great silence spake hebrue tuge sayenge xxii chapter ye men brother father hear myne answere make vnto wha herde spake vnto hebrue tunge kepte silence sayde actu b c iewe borne tharsus cilicia noryshed thys cytie taught truth ye lawe ye father ye fete actu e gamaliel feruent louer lawe ye thys daye actu b cori c gala b whych haue persecuted thys lawe vntyll death byndynge delyuerynge towardes men weme chefe preste doth beare recorde auncient men whome also receauynge letter went damascus vnto ye brother shuld brynge thence bounde vnto ierusalem myghte punyshed fortuned wente approched vnto damascus mydde day sodely dyd great lyght shyne rounde aboute heauen fallynge downe grounde herde voyce sayenge vnto saule saule doest thou persecute answered arte thou lorde sayde vnto iesus nazareth whome thou persecutest dani b wyth sawe lyghte dede ye voyce hym spake wyth dyd heare sayde shall lorde lorde sayde vnto arysynge go damascus shall tolde behoueth whan sawe bryghtnesse lyghte beynge ledde hade companion came damascus actu b one ananias deuoute man hauynge good reporte ye lawe al iewes dwell wyth hym commynge standynge sayd vnto brother saule loke vp loked vpon hym houre sayde god father hath ordyned afore thou shuldest knowe hys wyll shuldest se ryghteous shuldest heare voyce hys mouth thou shalte hys wytnesse vnto al thynges thou hast sene herde nowe doest thou tary aryse baptysed wash away thy synnes rom b name beyng called vpon happened vnto returnynge ierusale prayenge temple become trauce se hym sayenge vnto make hayst math b actu go quyckely ierusalem shall receaue thy wytnesse said lorde knowe shuttyng vp preson beatynge thorowe synagoges dyd beleue actu g whan bloude steue thy wytnesse shed stode consented kepte clothes slewe hym sayde vnto go thy waye actu gala c ephesi shall sende amonge nacions farre herde hym vntyl thys word lyfte vp theyr voyce sayenge haue away earth one becommeth hym lyue whan cryed cast theyr clothes dyd throwe dust ye ayre captayne comaunded hym brought castell beaten wyth scourge racke hym myght knowe cause dyd crye hym whan bounde hym wyth thonges paule sayd vnto centurio stode hym lawful scourge romane co demned whyche beynge herde centurio wente captayne shewed hym sayeng wylt thou thys man cytesin rome captayne comynge hym sayd arte thou romane sayd yee captayne answered haue wyth great sume mony optayned thys fredome paule sayde also borne romane therfore departed strayght waye fro hym shulde haue racked hym captayne also feared knew cytesin rome bounde hym nexte daye wyllynge knowe diligently cause accused iewes dyd lowse hym comaunded prestes come together councell act dbryngynge forth paule set amonge xxiii chapter paule beholdynge cou cell sayd ye men brethre actu haue ben conuersaunt god wyth good conscience vntyll thys daye hygh preste ananias commaunded stode hym iere ioh smyte hym mouth tha said paule vnto hym god shall smyte thou whyted wall deut syttynge iudgest thou lawe comau dest smytten contrary ye lawe stode sayde doest thou curse hygh preste god paule sayd knewe brother hygh preste wrytten exodi thou shalt curse ruler thy people paule knowynge one part saduces pharises cryed councell ye men brother pharise sonne pharise actu c philip hope resurreccion ye dead iudged whan sayd thynges ther arose dissencio amonge pharises saduces multitude broken vp math c marc b luce dfor saduces saye ther resurreccion deade nother angell sprete pharises graunte ther happened great crye pharises rysynge vp dyd stryue sayenge fynde euell thys man actu yf sprete angell hath spoken vnto hym whan ther rysen great discencion captayne fearynge lest paule torne comaunded souldyours go downe take hym myddes brynge hym castell actu b lorde standynge hym ye next nyght sayd constaunte thou haste testifyed ierusalem ephe tim b must thou estify rome also wha become day ye iewes gathered themselues together boude themselues wyth vowe sayenge shulde nother eate drynke vntyl slayne paul forty men made thys conspiracion whych wente vnto hygh preste elder sayd haue boude selues wt vowe eat nothynge tyl haue kylled paule therfore ye wyth coucell geue knowlege vnto ye captayne brynge hym forthe vnto though ye wolde knowe certaynte hym ready kyll hym afore come neare vnto whan paules systers sone herde layenge wayte came entred castell shewed paule paule callynge one centurios vnto hym sayd brynge thys yonge man vnto ye captayne hath thynge shewe hym truly takynge hym brought hym captayne sayd presoner paule callynge dyd praye bryng thys yoge man vnto hauynge somethynge saye vnto captayne takynge hys honde wente asyde wyth hym waye axed hym thou hast shewe sayde iewes agreed desyre thou brynge forth paule morow councell thoughe wolde knowe certaynte hym thou beleue fortye men laye wayte hym whyche haue bounde themselues wyth vowe nother eat drynke vntyll slaye hym eue ready waytynge thy promyse captayne therfore let yonge man go comaudyng hym shulde tell vnto noman shewed thynges two centurios beynge called said vnto make readye two hundreth souldyours maye go vntyll cesarea thre score ten horseman two hundreth speare men thyrde houre ye nyght make ready beastes settynge paule thereon myght bryng hym safe vnto felix debite dyd feare lest happely iewes shulde take hym away kyl hym afterwarde shulde blamed though shulde take mony wrytyng hym letter conteynyng wordes claudius lysias sendeth gretynge vnto ryght good debite felix actu thys man beynge taken iewes begynnynge slayne haue comynge vpo wt army rescued knowynge romane wyllynge knowe cause dyd laye agaynst hym actu c brought hym theyr councell whome dyd fynde accused question theyr lawe hauynge faute worthy death bandes wha shewed layeng wayte layde hym haue sente hym vnto commaundynge ye accuser also saye fare well souldyours commaunded takynge paule brought hym nyght antipatras nexte daye leauynge ye horseman shuld go wyth hym returned castell whych whan came cesarea taken letter vnto debite set paule also hym wha red hadde axed prouince knowynge cilicia sayd deut wyll heare whan thyne accuser come commaunded hym kepte herodes iudgement house xxiiii chapter fyue dayes cam downe actu ananias ye hygh prest wyth elder one tertullus oratour whych went vnto debite agaynst paule paule beynge called tertullus begane accuse sayenge seynge lyue greate rest many thynges redressed thy wysedome alowe alwaye euery ryghte good felix wyth thankesgeuyng lest tary longe praye thy goodnesse brefly heare v haue foude thys pestiferous man raysynge vp sedicion vnto iewes thorow al world author sedicion nazarees secte whych also actu hath vndertaken defyle temple whome beynge taken wold haue iudged hym lawe lysias captayne commynge vpon v wyth great violence toke hym oure handes commaundynge hys accuser come vnto tryeng thou thyselfe mayest haue knowlege thynges wherof accuse hym iewes dyd also affirme saye thynges paule debite beckenyng vnto hym speake answered knowynge haue bene iudge vnto people many yeares sence shall wyth good corage answere myselfe thou mayest knowe ther nomore saue twelfe dayes past vnto sence came vp praye ierusalem actu nother dyd fynde disputynge temple makyng ony gatheryng people nother synagoges cytie nother proue thynges vnto wherof accuse thys math marc c luce c cofesse vnto accordynge ye secte whyche call heresye serue father god beleuynge thynges wrytten lawe prophetes hauynge hope godwarde exod math c resurreccion ye dead whych themselues also loke iuste vniuste actu therfore myne endeuoure also alwaye haue conscience wythout offendynge towarde god rom cori many yeares came almesse vpon peoyle offerynges vowes actu cwherein dyd fynde beynge purifyed teple great copany wt rumoure toke cryenge sayeng auoyde enemye iewes asia behoued preset wt accuse yf ought agaynst let theselues speake yf haue foude ony wyckednesse seyng stad ye coucel wtout one voyce wt ye cryed stadyng amoge actu thys day iudged ye resurreccio ye dead felix differred knowyng certaynly thys waye sayeng whan lysias captayne shalbe come downe shall heare iere c actu comauded ceturion kepe hym haue reste nother forbyd ony hys minister vnto hym certayne dayes felix comynge wt drusilla hys wyfe whych iewysh called paule herde hym fayth iesus christ reasoned ryghteousnesse chastite iudgement come felix beynge afea ed answered thys tyme go thy waye conueniente tyme wyll call hopynge also mony shulde haue ben geue hym paule ye cause also callynge hym ofte communed wt hym two yeares beynge fynyshed felix gat successor porcius festus felix wyllynge iewes pleasure act clefte paule bounde xxv chapter whan festus therfore come ye prouince thre dayes went vp ierusale fro cesarea ye hygh prestes principall ye iewes wet agaynst paule besought hym desyrynge fauoure agaynst yt wold comaude hi brought ierusale layeng wayt yt myght kyl ye way festus answered paule kept cesarea hiselfe shuld spedelyer go way whoso therfor amoge sayeth able commyng together accuse hym yf ther ony faute ye man hauyng taryed amoge nomore saue viii ten dayes wente downe cesarea nexte daye dyd syt vppon iudgement seate commaunded paule broughte hym wha brought iewes ierusalem stode hym layeng agaynst hym many greuous cause whyche coulde proue paule geuynge answere actu b c haue synned nought nother agaynst lawe ye iewes temple emperoure festus wyllynge iewes pleasure answeryng vnto paule sayd wylt thou go vp ierusalem iudged thynges paul sayd stande emperours iudgement seate muste iudged haue hurt ye iewes yu knowest best yf haue done hurte ought worthy death refuse dye yf ther none whereof accuse man geue vnto appeale vnto emperoure festus hauynge spoken wyth ye cou sell answered thou hast appealed vnto emperoure vnto emperoure shalte thou go whan certayne dayes paste kynge agrippa bernice came downe cesarea welcome festus whan dyd abyde many dayes festus dydde shewe kynge paule sayeng actu c ther man lefte bounde felix actu whome hygh prestes elder iewes came vnto desyrynge sentence agaynste hym vnto whome made answer deut athat romanes vse co dene man yt accused haue hys accuser presente receaue place defedyng cleare hymselfe fautes layde agaynste hym whan therfore come together wythoute ony delaye syttynge vpon iudgemente seate nexte daye commaunded man broughte forthe actu whome whan accuser stode broughte cause dyd mysdeme ony euell certayne question theyr supersticion agaynst hym one iesus deade paule dyd affirme lyue doutynge question sayd whether wolde go ierusalem iudged thynges paule appealyng myght kepte vnto ye emperours knowlege haue commaunded kepte vntyll sende hym vnto emperoure agrippa sayd vnto festus also wolde haue herd man tomorowe sayde shalt thou heare hym nexte daye whan agrippa bernice come wyth great pompe entred commune hall wyth captaynes principall men cytie whan festus dyd commaunde paule broughte forth festus said kynge agrippa al ye men v ye se thys man whome al multitude iewes haue intreated ierusalem desyrynge cryenge ought lyue longer fande actu b c haue done nothynge worthy death appealynge emperoure haue iudged sende hym whome haue certaynte maye wryte vnto lorde wherfore brought hym vnto chefly vnto kynge agrippa examinacion maye haue wryte semeth vnto wythout reason sende presoner shew hys cause xxvi chapter bvt agrippa sayde vnto paule permytted vnto speake thy selfe paule ye hade stretched beganne speake counte myselfe happy kynge agrippa seynge shall defende daye thynges whyche accused iewes specially thou knowest costume question amonge iewes wherfore beseke thou wylt heare paciently truly lyfe fro youth yt whych begynnynge amonge nacion ierusalem iewes knowe knowynge begynnynge yf wyll testifye moost sureste secte oure religion lyued pharise ac u philip stande subiecte iudgemente hope gene c c deut c psal bpromyse made god father vnto whych xii tribe hope come seruyng god daye nyght hope kynge accused iewes iudged incredible wt ioha cthat god rayseth deade verely dyd thynke behoued many thynges agaynst name iesus nazareth actu wych dyd also ierusale shut many sayntes preson hauyng receaued authorite hygh prestes wha put death brought ye sentence punyshynge ofte thorow synagoges copelled blaspheme beynge mad agaynst persued vntyl straunge cyties aboute ye whych went damascus wt authorite lycece hygh prestes mydde day kynge sawe waye lyghte heauen haue shyned aboute together wyth passynge bryghtnesse sonne whan al fallen downe groude herde voyce speakynge vnto hebrue tunge saule saule persecutest thou hard kycke agaynst pricke sayde art thou lorde lorde sayde iesus whome thou persecutest ryse vp stande vpo thy fete thereto haue appeared vnto maye orden minister wytnesse thynges thou hast sene thynges shall appeare vnto delyuerynge people nacions amonge whych nowe sende ye open theyr eye yt turne darknesse vnto esa lyght fro deuels power vnto god receaue forgeuenesse synnes enheritaunce amonge sayntes thorow fayth wherfore kynge agrippa vnbeleuynge vnto heauenly vision fyrst vnto damascus ierusalem region iewry heythen dyd shewe shulde actu c e repent turned vnto god doynge workes worthy repentaunce thys cause iewes hauynge taken whan temple wente aboute kyll beynge holpen ye ayde god stande vntyll thys daye testifyenge vnto leeste moost sayeng nothinge besyde prophetes haue spoken comynge moses christe shulde suffre fyrste resurreccion dead lyght shalbe shewed vnto ye people heythen spake thynges layd hymselfe festus sayd wyth loude voyce thou arte madde paule much learnynge turneth yt madnesse paule sayd madde good festus speake wordes truth sobernesse kynge knoweth vnto whome speake boldly thynke none thynges vnknowe vnto hym ioha c none thynges done corner doest yu kynge agrippa beleue ye prophetes knowe thou beleuest agrippa sayd vnto paule thou persuadest lytle become christia paule sayd wolde god lytle great also heare thys daye become also except bandes kynge rose vp debite bernice yt sat whan gone asyde spake eche sayenge actu b thys man hath done thynge worthy death bandes agrippa sayde vnto festus thys man myghte haue ben letten lowse appealed vnto emperoure xxvii chapter bvt whan iudged yt shulde sayle italy paule wyth presoners shulde taken vnto centurion ye emperours company name iulius goynge vp shippe adramittis begynnynge sayle coastes asia launched co l aristarchus macedonian thessalia continuynge v ye next daye came sidon iulius intreatynge paule courteouslye actu c bsuffred hym go vnto hys frendes refr sh hymselfe whan launched thence sayled neare cypers ye windes contrary saylynge ouer see cilicia pamphilia came lystra whych cytie lycia ceturio fyndynge shippe alexandria saylynge italye set v ouer therein whan sayled slowly many dayes scarce come agaynst gnidus wynde forbyddynge v sayled candy nye vnto salmo scarcely saylynge came vnto place called goodhauen nye vnto cytie thalassa whan muche tyme spente saylynge yeopardous fastynge past paule comforted sayenge vnto ye men se thys saylynge begynneth wyth dauger greate damage ladynge shippe also lyues centurio gaue credence vnto gouernoure mayster shippe thynges spoke paule whan hauen conuenient wynter many counselled sayle thence yf myght commynge phenice wynter whych haue candy towarde ye southwest northwest wynde wha ye south wynde blewe thynkynge haue optained theyr purpose wha lowsed fro asson sayled candy longe rose tepesteous winde called northeast wha ye shippe caught coulde wythstande wynde shyppe beynge comytted wynde dyd dryue ru nyng certayn ile called clauda coulde scarce get bote whyche beynge taken vp vsed helpe byndynge shyppe fearyng lest shuld fall ye sirtes parlous sa dy place see aboute coastes africa sirtes vessell let downe caryed ben tossed wt great tempest made cast nexte daye thyrde day thrue away tacklynges shippe wt theyr owne handes whan nother sone starres appeared many dayes small tempest laye vpon v hope oure sauegarde taken awaye whan ther ben longe fastynge dyd paule standynge myddest saye ye ought ye men hearynge haue lowsed candy get thys harme losse exhorte good chere ther shalbe losse ony man lyfe v saue shippe angell god whose whome serue stode thys nyghte sayenge feare paule actu b thou muste brought act b emperoure beholde god hath geuen yt sayle wyth wherfore ye men good chere trust god shal sayde vnto actu must come certayne ile fourtenth nyghte come sayled adria aboute mydnyght dyd shypme deme region appeare vnto whych also castynge ou leade fande twety feddos gone lytle fro thece fande fyfty feddos fearynge lest shulde fal rough place casting foure ankers ye sterne wyshed become daye wha shypme sought flye shyppe letten downe bote see vnder ye pretece yf wolde caste ankers foreparte shyppe paule sayd vnto centurio souldyours wythout abyde shyppe ye saued cut souldyours rope bote insu der let fall whan began become lyght paule prayed take breade sayenge thys daye fourtenth daye yt ye waytynge abyde fastynge takyng nothynge wherfore praye take meate youre health math luce none youre heade shall one heere perysh whan sayd thys marc c ioh tim atakynge breade thanked god presence whan broken beganne eate beynge good chere began also take breade al soules shyppe two hundreth thre score syxtene beyng satisfyed wyth meate lyghtened shyppe castynge wheat see wha day knew lande spyed haue hauynge banke whych thought thrust shyppe yf coulde whan taken vp ankers commytted themselues see lowsynge rudderbandes mayne sayle hussed vp wynde drue lande whan fallen place hauynge see sydes thrust shyppe therein foreparte dede abode vnmoueable sterne lowsed violence see souldyours counsell kyll presoners lest whan ony suymmed shuld escape ceturio wyllynge saue paule forbad done commaunded coulde swymme cast theselues fyrst escape go lande caryed vpon table vpon thynges shyp thus came passe al soules escaped lande xxviii chapter wha escaped dyd knowe ye ile actu c called melite romanes called al nacios barbarous romanes grekes barbarous people shewed v small kyndnesse fyre kyndled refreshed v rayne laye vppon v colde whan paule gathered lytle bodel styckes layed vpon fyre whan vyper came heate lepte vpon hande whan barbarous people sawe beaste hangynge hys hande sayd ech surely thys man slayer whome though haue escaped see vengeaunce suffreth lyue truely shakynge beaste fyre luce suffered harme thought shulde haue swollen sodenly fallen dyed waytynge longe seynge euell happen hym turnynge themselues actu sayde hym god quarter landes ruler ile name publius whyche lodgyng v intreated v curteously thre dayes fortuned ye father publius lye diseased math b feuers bloudy fluxe vnto paule went whan hadde prayed layde hys handes vpo hym healed hym beynge done ile disease came hym healed whych also endued v wyth greate honoure laded v saylynge wyth thynges necessary thre monethes sailed shippe alexandria whych wyntred ile whose badge castor pollux whan ca syracusa abode thre dayes thence saylynge aboute came rhegium one daye southwynde blowynge came puteolis ye secode daye brother beyng foude prayed abyde wyth seuen dayes came rome whan brother thence herde v actu met v vntyll forum appii thre tauerns whych whan paule sene thankynge god gat corage whan came rome centurio toke presoners vnto ye chefe captayne hoost actu c graunted vnto paule abyde hymselfe wt souldyour kepynge hym thyrde daye dyd paule call chefe iewes whan come sayde vnto ye men brother actu b b doynge nothynge agaynst people costume ye father actu c delyuered bounde ierusalem ye handes romanes whan examined wolde haue let go ther cause death ye iewes gaynsayenge compelled appeale vnto emperoure hauynge ought accuse people thys cause therfore desyred se speake wyth actu hope israel ame bounde aboute wyth thys cheyne sayd vnto hym haue nother receaued letter iewry nother dyd ony brother commynge shewe speake ony euell praye heare thyselfe thou thynkest knowe thys secte euery luce gaynsayde whan appoynted hym daye ther came many hym hys lodgynge vnto whome wytnessynge expouned kyngdome god persuadynge iesu gene moses ye prophetes fro ye mornynge vntyll euenynge actu beleued thynges spoken beleued whan agreynge together stroue paule sayeng one worde holy gooste hath well spoken prophete esaye vnto oure father sayenge go vnto thys people saye esay b mat b marc luce b ioha e rom wyth eare shall ye heare ye shall vnderstande seynge shall ye se perceaue thys people harte waxe grosse wyth theyr eares haue herde hardely theyr eye haue closed lest happely se theyr eyen heare wyth theyr eares vnderstande wyth harte turned heale therfore knowen vnto vnto heythen thys saluacion god sente shall heare wha sayd thynges iewes wente hym questeonynge much amoge themselues abode two whole yeare hys hyred lodgynge receaued al came hym preachynge kyngdome god teachynge thynges ye lorde iesus christ wyth al boldnesse wythout forbyddynge pthe ende actes apostle epistle apostle paule romaynes fyrst chapter paule seruaute iesus christe called apostle actu put aparte ye gospel god deut c actu promysed befor hys prophetes ye holy scripture hys sonne whych becam vnto hym math tim sede dauid ye flesh whych declared sone god power ye sprete hallowynge fro resurreccio ye deade iesu christ lorde actu c haue receaued grace apostleshippe obediet vnto fayth amog al nacios hys name ye also called iesu christ al yt beloued god rome called sayntes cori gala grace vnto peace god ye father lord iesu christ fyrst al truly geue thankes god thorow iesus christ al fayth publyshed al worlde god ioh c tim serue sprete ye gospel sonne wytnesse vnto yt wythout ceassynge make mecion alway prayer philip collos iere besechynge yf ony meanes may somtyme ye laste haue prosperous yourney philip collos iere wyl god act c come vnto loge se yt may bestowe vpon spirituall grace cofirme haue consolacion together ye fayth myne whych amonge v wyll ye ignoraut brother ye oftymes haue purposed come vnto actu let therto yt myghte haue frute lyke heythen also detter grekes ye barbarous wyse ye vnwyse yt ther readynesse preach ye gospell vnto also whych rome eccli c tim b ashamed gospell cori c power god saluacion euery beleuer ye iewe first ye greke ye ryghteousnesse god declared fayth fayth wrytten bac gala heb ryghteous shall lyue fayth wrath god declared fro heaue vpo al vngodlynesse vnryghteousnesse men wtholde ye truth god vnryghteousnesse ye thynge god whych knowe manifest actu cfor god hath shewed heb ye inuisible thinges hym yt vnderstod psal aare beholden creature ye world thynges made yee euen hys euerlastynge power godheade yt excused whan knewe god glorifyed hym god gaue tha kes became vayne theyr thoughtes deut c theyr foolysh hart darkened sayenge themselues wyse became foolysh psal c iere chauged also ye glory ye vncorruptible god similitude ymage corruptible man fethred foules fourefooted beastes bel serpentes reg ezech wherfore god gaue ouer lustes theyr hart euen vnclenesse myght shame theyr bodyes theselues altered ye truth god lesynge worshipped serued ye creature rather tha maker whych blessed euer ame therfore god gaue ouer shameful lustes leui cfor theyr weme chauged ye vse nature ye vse agaynst nature lykewyse also ye ye naturall vse ye weme beyng left burned lustes amog themselues vpo workyng fylthynesse receauyng theselues yt due rewarde theyr erroure prou c actu e regarded haue god knowlege god gaue ouer lewde mynde yt myght thynges whyche coueniet beyng fylled wt iniquite malyce fornicacion couetousnesse wyckednesse ful enuye slaughter cotecion gyle frowardnesse preuy accuser bakbyters hat ful vnto god doer wroge proud hye mynded bryngers vp euell thynges obediet father mother vnwyse vnmanerly wtout loue wtout conuenaut without mercy wha knowe ryghteousnes god vnderstode yt whych thynges worthy death onely yt also o c cosent ye doer ii chapter wherfore yu art excused yu man whosoeuer yu yt math iudgest yt reg b yu iudgest another yu condemnest thy selfe thou thyselfe iudgest doest euen ye thynges knowe ye iudgemet god accordynge truth agaynst suche thynges thynkest thou thys thou euery man iudgest whych thynges doest ye thyselfe yt yu shalt escape ye iudgement god dispysest yu rich goodnes pacience longe sufferynge esa c actu knowest yu yt louyng kyndnesse god leadeth repentauce yu thy stubburnesse impenitent hart hordest vp wrath vnto thyselfe ye daye wrath declarynge ye ryghteous iudgement god psal b whych shall rewarde euery man accordynge hys workes eue glorye honoure incorrupcion truely accordynge pacience good doynge seke euerlastynge lyfe vnto contecion tessa b agre vnto truth beleue vnryghteousnesse shal come wrath indignacio trouble anguysh agaynst euery soule man doynge euell iewe fyrst greke glory honoure peace vnto euery one doynge good iewe fyrst ye greke actu ephe gala ther accepting persones wt god whosoeuer haue synned wtout lawe shal perysh wtout lawe soeuer haue sinned ye law shalbe iudged ye law math c luce iacob ye hearer ye law righteous wt god ye doer ye lawe shalbe made ryghteous wha heythe yt haue lawe naturally thynges yt belonge lawe hauynge lawe law vnto theselues declare worke ye law wrytten theyr harte theyr coscience bearyng wytnesse vnto thoughtes accusynge excusynge amonge selues daye mat c whan god shall iudge secretes men iesus christ accordynge gospell yf ioha c yu named iew restest lawe makest thy boast god knowest hys wyll beynge instructe lawe alowest thynges profitable beleuest thyselfe leader blynde lyght darknesse instructour vnwyse mayster yonge babe hauynge ensample knowlege truth lawe thou therfore ye teachest another teachest thyself math thou preachest steale stealest thy selfe thou sayest shulde breake wedlocke breadest wedlocke thyselfe thou abhorrest idol comittest sacrilege thou makest boast ye lawe transgression lawe dishonourest god thorowe name god blasphemed amog heythen esa ezech wrytten circumcision truly auayleth yf thou obserue lawe yf thou trasgressoure lawe thy circumcision become vncircucision yf vncircumcision therfore kepe ryghteousnesses lawe shal hys vncircumcision reputed circumcision nature vncircumcision perfourmynge ye lawe shal iudge thorow lettre circumcision arte transgressour lawe iewe whych outwarde nother circumcision outwardly flesh ioha rom iew whych secrete coll b circu cision harte sprete ye letter whose prayse god iii chapter tha hath ye iew profyte circumcision much euery waye fyrst truly rom speches god commytted vnto tim yf beleued hath theyr vnbelefe made promyse god voyde god forbyd ioh god true psal euery man lyar wrytten psal yu mayest made ryghteous thy wordes ouercome whan thou art iudged yf iniquite prayse ryghteousnesse god shal saye god vnryghteous yt sendeth wrath speake maner man god forbyd el shall god iudge thys worlde yf truth god hath lye ben plenteous hys glory yet also iudged sinner blasphemed reporte shulde saye let v euell good maye come whose damnacion iuste excell haue proued iewes grekes vnder synne wrytten psal ther one ryghteous ther one vnderstandynge ther one sekynge god gone asyde together become vnprofytable ther one doth good ther muche one psal dtheyr throte ope sepulchre wyth theyr tunges haue dealte deceatfully poyson psal adder vnder theyr lyppes psal whose mouth full cursynge bytternesse prou theyr fete swyfte shedde bloude esa sorowe vnhappynesse theyr wayes waye peace haue knowen psal feare god theyr eye know thynges euer lawe doth speake speaketh vnto lawe euery mouthe may stopped worlde maye subdued vnto god gala dedes lawe euery flesh shall iustifyed hym heb lawe knowlege synne wythout lawe ryghteousnesse god declared hauynge wytnesse lawe prophetes ryghteousnesse god co meth throughe faythe iesus christe vpon beleue hym ther difference haue synned lacke glorye god esay c iustifyed frely hys grace thorow redempcion christ iesu whome god hath set forth hebr optayner mercy fayth hys bloude declarynge hys ryghteousnesse remission synnes goynge sufferynge god declarynge hys ryghteousnesse thys tyme may ryghteous iustifyer hym whych ye fayth iesus christ thy reioycyng excluded law dedes ye lawe fayth gala c holde man iustifyed fayth wythout workes ye lawe god god iewes also god ye heythen yet ye heythen also certainly one god iustifyeth circuncisio fayth vncircumcision fayth therfore destroye lawe fayth god forbyd maynteyne lawe iiii chapter shall shall say tha abraha esa oure father foude flesh yf abraha iustifyed workes lawe hath glory wyth god sayeth scripture gene b gala iaco c abraham beleued god counted vnto hym ryghteousnesse vnto hym yt worketh ye rewarde rekened fauoure deuty howbeit vnto hym ye worketh beleueth hym iustifyeth vngodly hys fayth counted vnto ryghteousnesse accordynge purpose grace god dauid also sayeth blessednesse ye man god imputeth ryghteousnesse wythout workes psal blessed whose iniquity geue whose synnes couered blessed man vnto lorde hath imputed synne doth thys blessednesse therfore remayne ye circucisio vncircumcision also saye fayth counted vnto abraham ryghteousnesse counted circumcision vncircumcision gene b circumcision vncircumcisio gene dhe receaued also token circu cision seale ryghteousnes fayth whych vncircumcision shulde father al beleuers thorow vncircucision vnto also myght counted ryghteousnesse myght father circucision vnto whych circumcision vnto followe footesteppes faythe whyche vncircumcision father abraham law promyse made vnto abraham hys sede shuld heyre worlde ye ryghteousnes fayth gala yf lawe e heyres fayth vayne promyse wyped lawe worketh wrath law ther trasgression therfore promyse made fayth ye accordyng vnto grace myght sure vnto al ye sede vnto ye law also vnto hym ye fayth abraham esay luce b ioha c gala whych father v wrytten gen haue made father many nacions god thou haste beleued quickeneth deade calleth thynges euen whych contrarye hope beleued vpon hope shulde father many nacions accordynge vnto sayde vnto hym gene euen shal thy sede starres heauen sonde see faynte fayth nother cosydered hys owne body dead already wha almoost hundreth yeare olde deade wombe sara moreouer douted promyse god thorowe vnbelefe strengthed thorow fayth geuyng glory vnto god knowynge mooste perfectly psal thynges soeuer god hath promysed able also perfourme therfore counted vnto hym also ryghteousnesse rom neuertheles written hym counted vnto hym ryghteousnesse also v vnto whome shalbe reputed beleuynge hym raysed vp iesus christ lorde fro dead tim gala whych delyuered oure synnes rose vp agayne oure iustifyenge v chapter therfore beynge esay iustifyed thorowe fayth maye haue ioh peace towarde god thorow lorde iesus christe whome haue intrauce fayth grace stande hebre reioyce hope glorye chyldren god reioyce also trouble knowynge iaco trouble worketh pacience pacience experience experience hope esay bhope confoundeth loue god shed abrode oure harte holy goost whyche geue vnto v ephes coll b nd b dyed christ vngodly whan yet weake accordynge tyme scace doth ony man dye ryghteous peraduenture good durst one dye ioha c petri c ioha b hebr god setteth forth hys loue v yf christe dyed v whan yet synners accordynge tyme much therfore beynge iustifyed hys bloude shalbe safe wrath hym yf wha enemyes reconcyled vnto god death hys sone much beynge reconciled shalbe safe lyfe reioyce also god lorde iesus christe haue receaued attonement gene wherfor lyke one synne entred thys worlde death synne euen also wente death thorowe men haue synned vntyll lawe synne worlde synne imputed wha ther lawe neuerthelesse death reygned fro ada vntyl moses yee euen ye synned ye similitude ye trasgression ada whych ymage come ye gyft also ye trespasse yf many dead thorow ye trespase one much hath grace gyft god ben plenteous many fauoure one iesus christ ioha gyfte also one synne iudgemet cam one condemnacion grace came iustificacion fro many trespass yf trespasse one death reygned one muche receauynge aboundauce grace pardon ryghteousnesse shal reygne lyfe one iesus christ lykewyse therfore ye trespasse one men condemnacion euen also ryghteousnesse one men iustifyenge lyfe lyke disobedience one many made synners euen also obedience one many shalbe made ryghteous gala c lawe entred ye synne shulde increace luce c synne abounded grace also plenteous lyke synne raygned death euen grace also myghte raygne thorowe ryghteousnesse euerlastynge lyfe iesus christ lord vi chapter shal say therfore shal remayne synne grace maye plenteous god forbyd shal dead fro synne lyue yet gala collo b petri c knowe ye brother euer baptysed christe iesu baptysed hys death buryed together wyth hym thorowe baptyme death lyke christe rose deade thorowe glory father ephes c collo hebre c euen also shulde walke newnesse lyfe yf grafted vnto similitude hys death shal belonge ye resurreccion also knowyng thys moreouer yt olde crucifyed yt bodye synne maye destroyed yt fro heceforth shuld serue syn pet afor yt deade made ryghteous fro synne petri b yf deade wt christ beleue yt shall also lyue together wt hym knowyng apoc yt christ rysyng agayne fro ye dead dyeth death shall haue dominion ouer hym ony touchynge dyed dyed synne touchynge lyueth lyueth vnto god eue ye also thynke selues drade synne lyuynge vnto god christ iesu let synne therfore reygne mortall body yt ye shuld obey vnto ye lustes nother geue ye ouer youre membres weapens iniquite vnto synne geue ouer selues vnto god deade lyuynge membres weapens ryghteousnesse vnto god synne shal haue dominio ye vnder law vnder grace shal synne vnder lawe vnder grace ioh c petri knowe ye whome ye geue ouer selues seruautes obeye hys seruautes ye ye obeye whether synne vnto death obediece vnto ryghteousnesse god thanked ye seruautes synne haue harte obeyed vnto fashion doctrine wherein ye ye beynge delyuered synne become seruauntes ryghteousnes speake maner ye infirmite fleshe lyke ye haue geuen ouer membres serue vnclennes iniquite iniquite eue nowe geue ouer mebres ryghteousnesse hallowynge whan ye seruauntes synne ye voyde ryghteousnesse frute therfore ye thynges wherein ye ashamed ende death ye beyng delyuered synne become seruauntes vnto god haue frute hallowynge ende euerlastynge lyfe gene c rom b death ye wage sinne euerlastynge lyfe grace god christ iesu lorde vii chapter knowe ye brother speake know lawe ye lawe hath dominion loge lyueth cori woman whych vnder husbande bounde vnto lawe husbande lyuynge yf hyr husbande dye lowsed lawe husbande therfore whyle man lyueth shalbe called wedlocke breaker math dyf wyth another husbande yf hir husbande dye delyuered lawe husband wedlockbreaker yf wyth another husbande brother ye also dead vnto lawe body christ yt ye shulde another man whych rysen agayne dead ye maye brynge forth frute vnto god whan ye flesh lustes synnes whych lawe wrought membres shulde brynge forth frute vnto death lowsed lawe death wherein holde yt shuld serue ye newnesse sprete ye oldnesse letter shal saye therfore law synne god forbyd neuerthelesse knewe synne lawe knewe lust yf law sayd exo c deut c thou shalte lust whan occasion taken commaundement synne wroughte concupiscence wythout lawe synne deade lyued wythoute lawe sometyme neuerthelesse whan commaundemente come synne reuyued ame deade commaundemente whych vnto lyfe founde vnto vnto death synne occasion take commaundement deceaued dyd kyll esay tim b lawe therfore dede holy ye commaundement holy iust good therfore whych good become death vnto god forbyd synne myghte appeare synne hath wrought death good synne myghte measure synfull commaundement knowe lawe spirituall carnall esa solde vnder synne vnderstande good whych wyl euell whych hate yf whyche wyll consente vnto lawe good neuerthelesse nowe synne dwelleth knowe ther dwelleth good gen fleshe wyll lyeth vpon fulfyll good fynde good wyll euell wyll yf wyl synne dwelleth fynde therfore lawe ther cleueth euel vnto euen vnto wyllynge good haue delyte vnto lawe god inwarde man membres se another lawe repugnaunt vnto lawe mynde holdynge captyue lawe synne whych membres vnhappy man shall delyuer bodye thys death grace god thorowe iesus christ lord therfore myselfe mynde serue ye law god flesh lawe synne viii chapter therfore ther da nacion vnto ar christe iesu whyche walke flesh lawe sprete lyfe christ iesu hath delyuered ioh c gala fro lawe synne death heb c vnpossible vnto ye lawe made weake thorowe fleshe god sendynge hys sonne symilitude ye fleshe synne cori c synne also hath damned synne flesh ryghteousnesse lawe myght fulfylled v whyche walke fleshe sprete fleshe mynde thynges ye flesh sprete mynde thynges sprete prudence fleshe death ye prudence ye sprete lyfe peace wysedo flesh enemy vnto god esa cfor subdued vnto ye lawe god flesh please god neuerthelesse ye ye flesh sprete yf yet yt sprete god dwell yf ony man haue sprete christ ye hys yf christ bodye truely deade synne sprete lyueth ryghteousnesse sake yf ye sprete hym whych raysed vp iesus fro ye deade dwel euen raysed vp iesus christ deade shall also quycken youre mortall bodyes hys sprete dwellyng therfore brother detters vnto fleshe shulde lyue fleshe yf ye lyue flesh ye shal dye yf ye mortifye dedes flesh thorow sprete ye shal lyue yt led ye sprete god thesame chyldren god gala tim ye haue receaued ye sprete bondage agayne feare ye haue receaued sprete adopcio chyldren god crye abba father cori c ephe b spret beareth record vnto sprete yt ye chyldre god yf ye chyldre heyres also heyres truly god heyres together wt christ yf yet yt suffre together yt maye also glorifyed together math cori b ioha suppose sufferynges thys tyme worthy vnto ye glory come whych shalbe shewed v cori longynge creature loketh open declarynge chyldren god creature subdued vnto v nite wyllynge hys sake hath subdued hope creature also shall delyuered fro ye bodage corrupcio lyberte ye glory chyldren god know euery creature groneth ioh c trauaileth hetherto also selues hauing ye fyrst frutes ye sprete grone also wythin selues ye adopcion ye chyldren god lokynge ye redepcion body saued hope hebre hope sene hope hopeth man yt whych seyeth yf hope ye whyche se abyde paciece lykewyse also sprete helpeth infirmite wote shuld praye oughte esa c sprete selfe maketh intercession v wyth gronynges vnoutspeakeable iere bhe searcheth harte knoweth sprete desyreth maketh intercession sayntes accordyng peasure god knowe vnto whych loue god thynges worke together vnto goood purpose called sayntes whome knewe hath also predestinate made lyke ymage hys sonne hymselfe myghte fyrste begotten amonge many brother whome hathe predestynate hathe called also whome hathe called hath also iustifyed hath iustifyed hath also magnifyed shall saye therfore vnto thynges esay b yf god syde agaynst v gene esay whyche also hath spared hys owne sonne hath geuen hym ouer v hath also geuen v thynges wyth hym wyll brynge ony accusacion agaynst chosen god god iustifyeth co demne christ iesus dyed ye euen rose whych also ryght hande god whyche lykewyse maketh intercession v shall therfore separate v fro loue eccli b tim c hath potter power claye make lompe vessell truly vnto honoure dishonoure yf god wyllynge shewe wrath declare hys power suffred much pacience vessel wrath mete destruccion myght declare shalbe safe fynishynge shortenynge worde ryghteousnesse shortened worde shall lord brynge passe vpon earth esaye sayde e b excepte lorde sabaoth lefte v sede hadde ben made sodoma shulde haue bene lyke gomorra shall saye therfore ye heythen whych followed ryghteousnesse haue ouertaken ryghteousnes ryghteousnesse whyche fayth israel followynge lawe ryghteousnesse attayned vnto law ryghteousnesse fayth workes haue stombled vpon stomblyng stone wrytten esa beholde laye sion stone stomblynge rocke offendynge euery one beleueth hym shall confounded x chapter brethre harte desyre truly prayer vnto god vnto saluacio beare recorde rom gala b haue dede zele god accordynge knowlege knowynge ryghteousnesse god sekynge set vp theyr owne ar subdued vnto god ryghteousnes math b ende lawe christe vnto saluacio euery beleuer moses hath wrytten leui gala b man whych doth ye ryghteousnesse lawe shall lyue ryghteousnesse whyche fayth sayeth thus deut c thou saye thyne harte shall go vp heauen brynge downe christ shal go downe ye depth call vp christe agayne deade sayeth ye scripture worde nye thy mouth thy harte thys worde fayth preache yf thou knowlege ye lord iesus thy mouthe beleuest thy harte god hath raysed hym vp deade thou shalt safe wyth harte beleued vnto ryghteousnesse wyth mouth knowleged vnto saluacion ye scripture sayeth esay c euery one ye beleueth hym shall confouded ther differece ye iewe greke one lord ryche vnto ye call vpon hym ioel f actu b b euery one whosoeuer calleth ye name ye lord shalbe safe therfore shall cal hym haue beleued howe shall beleue hym whome haue herde howe shall heare wyth preacher shal peach except sent wrytten esa bhow bewtyful ye fete ye preach peace preach good thynges al obey ye gospel esaye sayeth esa ioh c lorde hath beleued oure hearynge fayth therfore cometh hearynge hearynge cometh ye worde christe saye haue herde psal theyr soude truly went also euery cotry theyr wordes coastes copasse earth saye hath israel knowe fyrst moses sayeth deut c wyl bryng gelousy agaynst yt people wyl sende wrath agaynst foolysh people esay bolde sayeth esay c foude sought haue opely appeared vnto axed vnto israel sayeth esa daye longe haue holden handes people beleuyng speakyng agaynst xi chapter saye therfore iere f hath god thrust oute hys people farre also israelite ye sede abraham trybe ben iamin god hath thrust hys people whome knewe wote ye ye scripture sayeth elia maketh intercession vnto god agaynst israel reg c lorde haue slayne thy prophetes haue dygged downe thyne altares lefte alone seke lyfe sayeth ye answere god vnto hym reg haue reserued vnto seuen thousande men haue bowed ye knee baal eue therfore thys tyme also remnaunt saued eleccion ye grace god deut yf grace workes el grace grace therfore israel hath attayned vnto whych soughte election hath optayned blynded wrytten esai b tu g god hath geuen sprete vnquietnesse eye shuld se are shulde heare vntyll thys daye dauid sayeth psal let theyr table snare takynge occasion fallynge rewarde let theyr eye darkened yt se bowe thou downe theyr backe alwaye saye therfore haue stombled shulde fall farre theyr fal health happened vnto ye heythen maye followe yf theyr synne ryches worlde theyr mynishynge ryches heythe much theyr fulnesse saye vnto heythen longe truly rom tim tim apostle heythen shal prayse seruice yf ony meanes may prouoke flesh zele saue yf theyr losse reconciliacion worlde receauynge saue ye lyfe deade yf layenge leuen good lompe also esa yf roote holy braunches also yf braunches broken thou whan thou werest wylde olyue tre arte grafte among become partener roote fatnesse ye iere olyue tre auaunce thyselfe agaynst ye braunches yf thou doest boast thou bearest roote roote thou sayest therfor braunches broken maye grafted well broken vnbelefe thou sta dest fayth eccles hygh wyse feare yf god hath spared naturall braunches leste spare also beholde therfore goodnesse rygoure god truly falle rygoure goodnesse god yf thou shalt abyde goodnesse el shalte yu fall awaye cori c also yf shal remayne vnbelefe shalbe grafted god able graft agayn yf thou also arte fallen away naturall wylde olyue tre cotrary nature art grafted good olyue tre much shal nature grafted theyr olyue tre wolde haue ignoraut brethre thys mystery ye wyse selues ye blyndnesse partly happened israel luce c vntyl ye fulnesse heythen shuld come israel shulde saued wrytten psal esa c shall come sion draweth turneth waye wyckednesse iacob thys shalbe testamente vnto whan shall haue take awaye theyr synnes gospel truly enemyes sake eleccion moost beloued father sake gyftes callynge god wythout repentynge ye also sometyme dyd beleue god haue optayned mercy theyr vnbelefe euen haue also beleued youre mercy maye optayne mercy god inclosed vp thynges vnbelefe maye haue mercy depenesse ryches wysedom knowlege god sapi incomprehensible hys iudgemetes hys wayes vnsearcheable sapi b esay b cor b hath knowe lordes minde hath ben hys counseller hath geuen hym fyrst shalbe geuen hym agayne esa c hym hym hym thynges rom c vnto hym prayse euer euer amen xii chapter beseke therfore bre hren mercy god ye geue ouer bodyes phili c sacrifice lyuynge holy acceptable vnto god whych reasonable seruice lyke fashioned thys worlde refourmed newnesse wytte ye proue ephes b te whyche ye good wel pleasynge perfecte wyll god saye vnto al amonge grace geuen eccli c nomore wyse behoueth wyse rom cori wyse vnto sobernes vnto euery one god hath geuen measure fayth cor b ephes b lyke haue many membres one body mebres haue one maner operacion euen ar many one body vnto christ euery one membres hauynge gyftes differrynge accordynge grace geuen v whether cor prophecye accordynge stente fayth whether petri b seruyce mynistrynge whether teacheth doctrine exhorteth exhortynge actu geueth synglenesse eccli beareth rule carefulnesse deut b amos b sheweth mercy chearefulnesse let loue vnfayned hatynge euel clyuynge good louynge together loue brotherheade petri b preuentynge ech wyth honoure eccli cnot slouthfull carynge feruente sprete seruynge lorde reioycynge hope beynge pacient tribulacion continuynge prayer distributynge vnto nede sayntes heb followyng vpo harbarowyng blesse pursue blesse curse reioyce wyth ye reioycynge wepe wyth wepynge philip abe lyke mynded amonge yourselues pro esay c beynge hygh wyse beynge wyse wyth ye lower sorte wyse ourselues pro c petri b rendrynge vnto noman euell euell cor c prouydyng good thynges god also men hebr c yf maye muche lyeth hauynge peace wyth al men defendynge youre selues dearly beloued geue rowme vnto wrath wrytten deut e vnto vengeaunce shal rewarde sayeth lorde pro yf thyne enemy doth hoger geue hym meate yf thyrste geue hym drynke doynge thys thou shalt gather cole fyre vpon hys heade ouer come euell ouercome euell good xiii chapter let euery soule submytted vnto ye hygher power pet b sap ther power god ordined god therfore resysteth ye power resysteth ordinaunce god resyste get themselues da nacion ruler feared good worke euel wylt thou fear power good thou shalt haue prayse mynister god vnto good yf thou doest euell feare beareth swearde nought ye mynister god aueger ye wrath vnto hym doth euell therfore submytted vnto necessite wrath also conscience sake therfore ye also geue tribute god minister seruynge math c geue therfore vnto euery one due vnto trybute trybute vnto whome costume costume vnto feare feare vnto whome honoure honoure owe noman oughte saue ye loue ech gala timo b whoso loueth hys neghboure hath fulfylled lawe exod c deut c thou shalte commytte aduoutrye thou shalt kyl thou shalte steale thou shalt beare false wytnesse thou shalte lust euer commau dement ther el restored thys worde leui mat thou shalte loue thy neghboure thy selfe cor loue neghboure worketh euell fulfyllyng ye lawe loue knowynge thys tyme tessa houre v ryse ye slepe oure health nearer wha dyd beleue night past daye come neare collo let v therfore cast away workes darknesse let v put armour lyght may walke honestlye daye luce banckettinges dronkennesses cor b ephe chambrynges vnclenesses iacob c stryuynge enuyenge put iesus christ gala c pet c bestowe care fleshe pleasure xiiii chapter take vnto hym weake fayth stryfes opinion one beleueth may eate thynges let hym ye weake eat herbes eateth let hym despyse hym eateth eateth let hym iudge hym eateth god hath receaued hym iacob b art thou iudgest another man seruaunte standeth falleth vnto hys lorde shall stande god able make hym stade one iudgeth betwene daye daye another iudgeth euery daye lyke collos c let euery man ful hys meanynge regardeth ye daye regardeth vnto lorde eateth eateth vnto lorde geueth thankes vnto god eateth eateth vnto lorde geueth thakes vnto god none v lyueth vnto hymselfe noman dyeth vnto hymselfe whether lyue therfore lyue vnto lorde whether dye dye vnto lorde therfore whether lyue whether dye lordes christ dyed therto rose agayne may actu phili lorde ouer quick deade iudgest thou thy brother despysest thou thy brother gala shall stande iudgemente seate christe wrytten esay phil lyue sayeth lorde knee shalbe bowed vnto al tunge shall knowlege vnto god math cori btherfore shal euery one v geue accopte hymself vnto god let v therfore iudge eche iudge thys rather ye laye stomblynge blocke vnto brother offendicle cor ame sure truste lorde iesus ther nothynge commune selfe saue vnto hym iudgeth commune vnto commune yf thy brother made sorowfull meates sake doest thou walke charite destroye thou hym wyth thy meate whome christe dyed let therfore oure good euell spoken kyngdome god meate drynke ryghteousnesse peace ioye holy goost whoso serueth christ pleaseth god approued men let v therfore followe vpon thynges belonge vnto peace let v kepe thynges together belonge vnto edifyeng destroye worke god cause meate tit thynges truely clene euell vnto man eateth wych offendicle corin better eate fleshe drynke wyne wherin thy brother stombleth offended made weake fayth thou hast thyselfe haue god happy iudgeth hymselfe alloweth putteth difference yf shal eate damned fayth titu c fayth synne xv chapter bvt gala stronge ought sustayne ye weakenesse stronge stande oure owne conceate let euery one please hys neghboure vnto good edifyenge christe pleased hymselfe wrytten psal b rebuke rebukynge dyd fall vpon rom thynges euer wrytten wrytten oure doctrine pacience mac b consolacion scripture maye haue hope god pacience consolacion geue vnderstande one thyng one towardes another iesus christe ye one mynded maye prayse god one mouth father oure lorde iesus christe wherfore receaue ye eche christe also hath receaued honour god saye iesus christus haue bene mynister circumcision truthe god confirme promyses father heythen prayse god vpon mercye wrytten reg g psal c therfore shall prayse amonge heythen lorde shall synge vnto thy name agayne sayeth deut f reioyce ye heythe hys people agayne psal ye heythen prayse lorde ye people magnifye hym agayne sayeth esaias esay b ther shalbe roote iesse shall ryse rule gentyles hym shall heythen truste god hope fyll wyth ioye peace beleuynge ye maye ouerflowe hope power holy goost myselfe also ame sure brother also full loue fylled wyth al knowlege much ye able admonyshe ech haue wrytten boldely vnto brother partly bryngynge mynde grace geuen god shulde minister christ iesu amonge heythen hallowynge gospell god ther offerynge heythen acceptable sanctifyed holy gooste haue therfore prayse vnto god christe iesu darre speake oughte thynges god actu pet hath done obedience heythen wyth word dedes power token wonder power holye goost muche ierusalem rounde aboute vntyll illyricum haue fylled wyth gospell christ haue preached thys gospell christe named lest shulde buylde vppon another man fundamente wrytten esay c vnto shewed hym shall se haue herde hym shall vnderstande whyche cause also greatly let come vnto forbydden hetherto nowe hauynge nomore rowme quarter hauynge desyre many yeares nowe paste come vnto whan shall begynne yournye spayne truste goynge shal se brought thyther yf shall haue fyrst partly enioyed nowe therfore go ierusalem ministre vnto saintes macedonia achia haue alowed make actu c cori cor handreachynge vnto poore sayntes ierusalem hath pleased theyr detters cor gala yf heythen become partaker theyr spirituall thynges oughte also ministre vnto carnall thynges whan therfore shal haue fynyshed thys shal haue sealed thys frute shall yourney spayne knowe commynge vnto shall come wyth abundaunce blesse gospell christe praye therfore brother thorow lorde iesus christe thorowe loue holy goost ye helpe prayer vnto god maye delyuered vnfaythfull iewrye offerynge wyllynge seruyce maye become accepacceptable vnto sayntes ierusalem wyth ioye maye come vnto wyll god maye refreshed wyth god cor peace wyth amen xvi chapter comende vnto phebe syster whyche minister congregacion cenchrea ye receaue lorde becometh sayntes ye assyste euer busynesse shall nede also hath holpen many myselfe salute actu tim c prisca aquila helper christe iesu whyche haue layde downe theyr neckes lyfe vnto whome geue thankes congregacions heythen also theyr housholde congregacyon grete epenetus beloued vnto whych fyrstlynge christe iesu congregacion asia grete mary hathe laboured muche amonge v grete andronicus iunia cosyns fellowpresoners whych renowmed amonge apostle whyche also christe salute ampliatus mooste beloued lorde salute vrbane oure helper christe iesu stachys beloued salute apelles approued christe salute aristobolus household grete herodio cosin grete yt narciscus housholde whyche lord salut triphena triphosa whych laboure lorde salute perside ye beloued whych hath laboured much lord salute rufus ye myscary harte innocent youre obedience publyshed euery place reioyce therfore math b wyll haue wyse good thynge symple euell ye god peace treade satan quyckely vnder youre fete grace lord iesus christ apostle paule corinthian fyrst chapter paule called apostle iesus christ wyll god brother actu sosthenes vnto congregacio corinthus ioh c hebr cbeynge sanctifyed christe iesu called sayntes wyth al cal vpon name lorde iesus christe euery place theyrs oures cori grace vnto peace god father lorde iesus christe thanke god alwaye ye grace god geuen christ iesu al thynges ye made rych hym euery worde euery knowlege wytnesse christe stablyshed nothynge wante vnto ony grace waytynge appearynge oure lorde iesus christe whych also shal stablysh wythout faute vntyll ende daye commynge lorde iesus christe num c cor b tessa c god faythfull whome ye called vnto fellowshippe hys sonne iesus christe oure lorde beseke brethre name oure lorde iesus christe rom cthat ye speake one thynge ther diuisions ye perfecte one meanynge one sentence shewed brother chloes householde ther stryfes amonge speake euery one sayeth truely ame paule actu c cor b apollo cephas christe christe diuided paule crucifyed ye baptysed name paule thanke god haue baptysed none saue actu acrispus ro c gaius lest ony saye ye baptysed name haue baptysed also house cor cstephana el wote whether haue baptysed ony christe sente baptyse preache wysedome wordes crosse christe voyded worde crosse truely vnto peryshe foolyshnesse rom b vnto saued vnto v power god wrytten esay c wyll destroye wysedom wyse vnderstandynge prudente shall refuse esay wyse scribe disputer thys worlde hath god made wysedome thys worlde foolysh worlde ye wysedome god dyd knowe god hath pleased god saue beleuynge foolyshnesse collos wysedome god foolysh god wyser men weake god stonger men ye brother loke vpon callyng iohan many wyse fleshe many myghtye many noble thynges worlde foolyshe hath god chosen maye confounde wyse weake thynges ye worlde hath god chosen maye confounde stronge vyle despysed thynges worlde hath god chosen osee c thynges worth shulde destroye thynges worth fleshe reioyce hys syghte ye christe iesu whyche become vnto v ephes c wysedome iere b ryghteousnesse ioh c hallowynge redempcion wrytten esay c iere cori reioyceth let hym reioyce lorde ii chapter whan come vnto brethre came shewynge vnto ye wytnesse christ ye heyght wordes wysedome haue iudged knowe oughte amonge saue iesus christ ye crucifyed also wyth weakenesse feare greate tremblynge tessa word preachynge persuadynge wordes man wysedome declarynge sprete power fayth wysedome men ye power god speake wysedome amonge perfecte wysedome thys world ye ruler thys worlde whych cori c go nought speake wysedome god mystery whych hyd whych god hathe predestinate vnto oure prayse worlde whyche math none ruler thys worlde hath knowen ioha c actu c yf knowen shulde neuer haue crucifyed lorde glorye wrytten esay eye hath sene eare hath herde yet gone vp harte thynges god hath prepared vnto loue hym vnto v hath god shewed hys sprete rom b spret searcheth al thynges euen depenesses god also men knoweth belonge vnto man saue ye spret man hym euen also thynges beloge vnto god hath noman knowe saue ye sprete god haue receaued ye sprete thys worlde sprete god maye knowe thynges geuen v god whych thynges also speake connynge wordes man wysedome doctrine ye spret comparynge spirituall thynges spirituall naturall perceaueth thynges belonge sprete god foolyshnesse vnto hym vnderstande examined spiritually pro ye spiritual iudgeth thynges hymselfe iudged noman wrytten sap b e b rom hath knowen mynde lorde hath instruct hym haue mynde christe iii chapter brother coulde speake vnto spirituall carnall heb gaue mylke drinke vnto babe christ meate ye coulde yet nother truely ye ye yet carnall gala seyng ther amonge enuyenge stryfe ye carnall walke man whan ony man sayeth cor b truly paule another apollo ye apollo therfore paule hys minister whome ye haue beleued vnto euery one god hath geuen haue planted apollo hath watered ioha g actu god hath geuen ye increace therfore nother planteth oughte ye watereth god geueth increace planteth watereth one euery one shall receaue hys owne rewarde accordynge hys worke god helper ye god husbadry ephes c ye god buyldynge accordynge grace god geuen haue lyke wyse buylder layde hey stubble euery man worke shall manyfest esa c daye lorde shall declare shal disclosed fyre euery man worke shall petri b fyre declare yf ony man worke yt hath buylded vpon abyde shall receaue rewarde yf ony man worke shall burne shal suffre harme shalbe safe neuerthelesse thorowe fyre cor c cori c hebre knowe ye ye teple god ye sprete god dwelleth yf ony defyle teple god god shal destroye hym teple god holy whyche ye proue c let noman myscary yf ony man amonge semeth wyse let hym become foole thys worlde maye wyse rom c wysedome thys worlde foolyshnesse wyth god wrytten iob b wyl take wyse theyr sutteltye agayne psa b lorde knoweth thoughtes wyse vayne let noman therfore reioyce men thynges whether paule whether apollo whether cephas whether worlde wheher lyfe whether death whether thynges presente thynges come al thynges truly ye christes christ god iiii chapter let man esteme v cori aministers christ disposers deut secretes god nowe requyred amonge disposers ony foude iere luce pet faythful coute ye leest thynge iudged man daye nother iudge myselfe know selfe gylty nothynge iohan iustifyed iudgeth lord iudge therfore tyme vntyll ye lorde come whych also shall lyghten ye hyd thynges darkenesse shall make manyfest cousels ye harte tha shal euery one haue prayse god thynges brethre haue described apollo sake v ye may learne aboue yt wrytte one puft vp agaynst another another man sundereth iacob hast thou yt thou hast receaued yf thou hast receaued doest thou boaste though yu haddest receaued ye satisfyed nowe ye made ryche ye raygne wythout v wolde god ye dyd raygne also myghte raygne suppose god hath declared v last apostle psal c rom e appoynted death become gasynge stocke vnto worlde angel men fooles christes sake ye wyse christe weake ye stronge ye reputacion reputacion vntyll thys houre honger thyrste naked buffetted vnsatled actu c laboure workynge wyth oure hades cursed rom b blesse persecuted suffre ar euel spoken pray become outswypynges worlde euery man scourynge hetherto wryte thys maye shame admonyshe moost beloued chyldren thoughe ye haue ten thousande maysters christe yet many father haue ga iacob b begotten christe iesu gospel praye therfore ye cori philip c follower christe therfore haue sent timothe vnto whych beloued sone faythfull lorde whyche shall put remebraunce wayes christ iesu teache euery euery congregacio pufte vp though commynge vnto wyll come shortly pro iere iacob b yf god wyll wyll know worde puft vp power ye kyngdome god worde power wyll ye shall come vnto wyth rod wyth loue sprete mekenesse v chapter ther wholy herde amog fornication fornicacio amog heythen leuit one haue hys father wyfe ye pufte vp haue rather sorowe taken awaye fro myddest hath done ye dede collo truely beynge absent body reioycynge good gala knowe ye lytle leuen sowreth whole lompe dowe pourge therfore olde leuen ye may newe dowe ye vnleueded breade christ esay b ioha c easterlabe offered let v therfore exo mery olde leuen leue maliciousnesse wyckednesse vnleuended breades sincerenesse truth wrote vnto letter eccl ye shulde medle wyth whoremonger truly whoremonger thys worlde couetous extorcioners seruers idol wythoute ye iudge wythin wythout shall god iudge deut haue awaye euell amonge yourselues vi chapter darre ony hauynge busynesse agaynst another iudged wycked sayntes math know ye saintes shall iudge ye worlde yf worlde shalbe iudged ye vnworthye ye iudged leest knowe ye shall iudge angel muche worldly matter yf ye shall haue therfore worldlye iudgementes vyler congregacio ordyne iudge say shame ther wyse man amog yt able iudge betwene hys brother ye brother stryueth wyth hys brother iudgement vnbeleuynge truely ther wholy faute among ye haue iudgementes amonge math e ye rather suffre wronge ye wronge begyle vnto brother knowe ye wycked shall possesse kyngdome god erre gala c ephes nother whoremonger worshipper idol aduouterous weaklynges abuser themselues wyth mankynde theues couetous vnto body rom god hath raysed lorde hys power shall rayse v also knowe ye bodyes member christe shall takynge awaye mebers christe make member harlotte farre knowe ye cleueth vnto harlotte becommeth one body gene sayeth shalbe two one fleshe cleueth vnto lorde one sprete flye fornicacion synne soeuer man doth wythout bodye commytteth whoredome synneth hys bodye cori b cor c knowe ye youre member euery one haue hys wyfe let euery one haue hyr husbande let man rendre vnto wyfe due lykewyse also wyfe vnto man woman hath power hyr body man lykewyse also hath man power hys body woman tob ioel c wythdrawe yourselues ech wythout happely consente tyme ye maye geue prayer returne agayne lest satan tempte incotinency thys saye accordynge fauoure comaundemet actu cfor wolde haue euery one hath hys gift god ye one truly thus ye saye vnto maryed wedowes good vnto yf shall abyde also tim b yf absteyne themselues let mary better mary burne vnto ioyned mariage commaunde lorde math woma go awaye man yf go awaye abyde vnmaried reconciled vnto hyr husbande let man leaue hys wyfe vnto rest saye lorde yf ony brother haue vnfaythfull wyfe agreeth dwell wyth hym let hym leaue yf ony woman haue vnfaithfull man consenteth dwell wyth let leaue man vnfaythfull man sactifyed thorowe faythfull woma vnfaythfull woman sanctifyed thorowe faythfull man el chyldren vnclene nowe holy yf vnfaythfull goeth awaye let hym go awaye brother syster bounde case god hath called v peace pet whence knowest thou woma whether thou shalt saue man whence knowest thou whether thou shalte saue woman saue lord hath distributed vnto euery man ephe god hath called euery man let hym walke teache congregacions ony man called circumcised let hym bryng foreskynne vpon hym ony called foreskynne let hym circumcised circumcision nothynge foreskynne nothynge kepynge commaundementes god let euery man callynge called continue timo arte thou called seruaunt care yf thou mayest fre vse rather whoso called seruaute lorde fre man ye lorde lykewyse called beynge fre seruaut christ cor c pet c ye ar bought deare pryce become seruauntes men euery one therfore brother called let hym abyde wyth god vir gines haue commaundemente lorde neuerthelesse geue counsell hauynge optayned mercy lorde faythfull suppose good presente necessite good man arte thou bounde wyfe seke lowsynge arte thou lowse wyfe seke wyfe yf thou take wyfe thou haste synned yf virgyne mary hath synned neuerthelesse suche shall haue trouble fleshe fauoure thys saye therfore brother psal petri tyme shorte remayneth also haue wyues hauynge wepe wepynge reioyce reioycynge bye possessynge vse thys worlde thoughe vsed esa ioh c fashion thys worlde passeth awaye mat c luce c wolde haue wythoute carefulnesse tim wythoute wyfe carefull thynges lordes maye please god wyth wyfe carefull thynges worlde howe maye please hys wyfe diuided woman vnmaryed virgine careth ye thynges lordes holy bodye sprete maryed careth thynges worlde howe maye please hyr husbande ouer thys saye youre profyte shuld cast snare honeste maye geue lyberte praye ye lorde wythout impediment yf ony man thynke hym estymed blameable virgin ouergrowen muste done let wyll synneth yf mary beynge sure harte hath purposed hauynge nede hauynge power hys wyll haue determyned hys harte namely kepe virgin doth wel therfore coupleth hys virgyne mariage doth well ioyneth doth better rom woman bounde lawe longe hir husbade lyueth yf hyr husbande slepe fre let marye whome wyll lorde shalbe happyer counsell yf shall continue suppose haue sprete god also viii chapter bvt thynges actu offred vp vnto idol rom b knowe ye haue al knowlege knowlege puffeth vp loue edifyeth yt thinketh know ought hath yet knowe behoueth hym knowe leueth god knowen hym meates yt offered vp vnto idol know cori c idol nothynge worlde deut f b esay b ye ther god saue one thoughe ther yt estimed god ether heauen psal earth ther many god many lordes yet haue ephes one god father rom thynges hym one lord iesus christ whome thynges thorowe hym ther knowlege euery one cor ye coscience idoll hetherto eate thynge offered vnto idoll theyr conscience weake defyled meate doth forther v vnto god nother shall haue abundaunce yf eate nother shall wante yf eate beware leste happely thys youre lyberte become stomblynge blocke vnto weake yf man shall se hym hath knowlege syt eatynge idol meate shall hys conscience whan weake stablyshed eate idol offerynges weake brother whome christe dyed shall peryshe thy conscience ye synnynge agaynst brother smytynge theyr weake conscience ye synne agaynst christ wherfore rom c yf meate offende brother wyl neuer eate fleshe lest offede brother ix chapter actu fre apostle cor b haue sene iesus christe oure lorde ye workemanshippe lord though apostle vnto yet vnto ye ye seale myne apostleship ye lorde defence axe thys haue power eate drynke haue power leade aboute woman phili syster also apostle brother lorde math b luc cephas haue barnabas power doth euer warrefare vpon hys owne wage doth plate vyne eateth hys frute fedeth flock eateth mylke flocke saye thynges man sayeth law thynges also wrytten moses lawe deu timo c thou shalte mosell mouth vnto oxe treadynge corne doth god care ye ox doth verely saye oure sake wrytten sake ye eareth muste eare vpon hope yt treadeth corne vpon hope optayne frute rom gala yf haue sowe vnto spirituall thynges greate thynge yf reape carnall thynges yf partaker power rather cor haue vsed power suffre thynges leste geue ony hynderauce vnto gospell christ knowe ye yt serue temple eate thynges temple serue altare partaker altare math euen hath ye lorde ordyned vnto yt serue gospell lyue gospell actu c tessa b tessa haue vsed none thynges neuerthelesse haue wrytte thynges done rather better dye ony man shulde make reioycynge voyde though shall preach prayse nede lyeth vpon wo vnto yf shall preach yf wyllyng haue rewarde yf agaynst wyll disposynge commytted vnto rewarde namely preachynge gospell vtter gospell frely mysuse power gospell actu c whan fre thynges haue made seruaunte myghte wynne actu b c b become vnto iewes iewe myghte wynne iewes vnto vnder law though vnder lawe wha yet vnder ye lawe myght wynne vnder lawe gala avnto wythout law thoughe wythout lawe wha yet wythout ye lawe god christes lawe myghte wynne yt wythout lawe become weake vnto weak myght wynne weake cori become al fashion vnto euery one yt myght saue al thynges gospell may partaker knowe ye yt runne course truely runne one receaueth ye reward runne ye ye maye optayne euery one proueth maystry abstayneth thynges truely maye receaue corruptible crowne tim b petr aan vncorrupped therfore runne vncertayne thynge fyght beatynge ayre chastyse body brynge subieccion lest whan haue thousande nother let v tempte christ num aa tempted peryshed serpentes nother ye murmure num dyd murmure peryshed destroyer happened vnto fygure wrytten warnynge vpon whome endes worlde come therfor let hym yt supposeth stande beware lest fal let teptacion take holde vppon saue followeth nature man cor tessa cbut god faythful pet b whych shal suffre tempted aboue ye able shal euen temptacio make idoll ought heythen offre offre vnto deuels vnto god wyll haue become partaker deuels ye drynke cuppe lorde cup deuels ye partaker table lord ye table deuels wyl prouoke ye lord stronger tha eccli cor c al thynges leaful vnto thynges expedient al thynges leafull vnto thynges edifye cori let noma seke hys yt another ma al thynge solde shamble ye eate axynge ye conscience psal lordes earth hys fulnesse yf ony ye infydels byddeth supper ye wyl go al set afore eate axynge consciece yf ony man shall saye offered vp vnto idol eate ye cause hath shewed conscience speake cori b conscience thyne iewes gentyles congregacion god cori euen also please men al thynges sekyng profytable vnto profitable vnto many maye saued xi chapter cori ye follower also christe prayse brother thynges ye remembre kepe commaundementes haue delyuered vnto wyll haue knowe euery man heade christ ephe c heade woma man heade christe god euery man prayenge prophecyenge heade beynge couered doth shame hys heade euery woman prayeng prophecyeng heade beynge couered shameth hyr heade one though shauen yf woman couered let hyr heer cut deut cori c yf vncomly woma haue heere cut shauen let couer hyr head man truely ought couer hys heade ephes c ymage glory god woman glory man gen man woman woma man man created woman woman man therfore ought woman haue couerynge vppon hyr heade angel neuerthelesse nother ye wythout woman woma without man lorde woman man euen also man woman thynges god iudge ye selues becometh woman praye god beynge couered doth nature teache man truely yf let hys heere grow shame vnto hym yf woman let hyr heere growe prayse vnto ye heeres geue coueryng tim c yf ony semeth contencious haue suche costume nother congregacion god thys commaunde praysyng ye come together better worse fyrst heare ye come together congregacion ther diuisions beleue partely math ioha cfor ther must also sectes among yt proued become manyfest amoge wha ye therfore come together eate lordes supper euery one taketh owne supper afore eate one truely hath honger dronke haue ye house eate drynke despyse ye congregacion god shame haue shal saye vnto thys prayse haue receaued lord whyche haue also delyuered vnto math c marc c luce b ye lord iesus nyght betrayed toke ye breade geuyng thankes brake sayd take ye eate thys body esay yt shalbe delyuered thys remembraunce lykewyse also ye cup yt supped sayeng thys cup ye new testamet bloude thys oft ye shal drynke remembraunce oft ye shal eate thys breade drynke cuppe p tr b ye shal shewe ye death lord vntyll actu b come therfore whosoeuer shall eate fleshe drynke bloude lord vnworthely shalbe gylty body bloude lorde cori b let man examine hymselfe let hym eate breade drynke cuppe eateth drynketh vnworthely eateth drynketh iudgemente vnto selfe makynge difference bodye lorde therfore ther many weake feble amonge many slepe eccli yf dyd examine oureselues verelye shulde iudged whan iudged chastened lorde iohan c daned wyth thys world therfore brethre wha ye come together eate tarye one another yf ony doth honger let eate home ye come together vnto iudgement thynges shall set order wha shall come xii chapter bvt wyl haue ignoraunte brother spirituall thynges ye know whan ye gentyles ye goynge dome idol ye led therfore shewe marc noman speakynge sprete god doth defye iesus noman saye lorde iesus saue holy goost rom ther verely diuersities gyftes one sprete ther diuersities office one lorde ther diuersities operacions ioh b one god worketh al thynges ephes vnto euery declaryng ye sprete geuen profyte vnto one truely geuen sprete ye vtterauce wysedome vnto another sprete geuen vtteraunce knowlege vnto another fayth ye sprete vnto another grace healynges sprete vnto another ye workynge miracle vnto another prophecy vnto another ioh discernynge spretes vnto another diuersities tunges vnto another interpretacion speches doth one sprete worke diuidyng vnto euery one wyll rom body oneephe b hath many bres member body though ar many yet one body euen christ also one sprete baptysed one body whether iewes gentyls whether bondman fre esay ioha haue al dronke one sprete body also one mebre many yf foote shall saye hande body therfore body yf eare shall saye eye body therfore ye body yf ye body eye hearynge yf al hearyng smellyng hath god set ye mebres body euery one hath pleased hym yf al ye membres
