fyre geuynge vengeauce vnto whyche haue knowen god rom obeye gospell lorde iesus christe sapi shall suffre euerlastynge punishmente death esay bfrom ye face ye lord glory power wha shal come glorifyed hys saintes made wonderfull al yt haue beleued yt wytnesse vpo beleued yt daye whyche thynge also coll praye alwaye yt god wyll wyte safe hys callynge yt fulfyll wyl hys goodnesse worke fayth power name lorde iesus christ praysed amonge accordynge grace oure god lord iesus christ ii chapter beseke brother commynge oure lorde iesus christe oure congregacion thesame ye quyckely moued youre meanynge afrayed nother sprete worde nother epistle sent v petri thoughe daye lorde hande let noman deceaue ony meanes lorde commeth excepte dan tim departynge come fyrste synfull man disclosed chylde perdicion whyche luc c wythstandeth exalted aboue god worshipped insomuch syt c r b c temple god dan shewynge hym though god ye remembre ye wha yet wt tolde thynges ye knowe doth wytholde may disclosed hys tyme ioh c mysterye iniquite doth worke already holdeth let hym holde vntyll taken awaye shall yt wycked disclosed iob esa dan whome lord iesus shall slaye wyth breth hys mouth shall destroye wyth appearaunce hys commynge hym whose commynge ioh workyng satanas deut mat b al power token lyenge wonder deceatfulnesse wyckednesse vnto perysh haue receaued ye loue truth yt maye saued acha rom therfore shall god sende workynge erroure maye beleue lye al may iudged haue beleued truth ose haue agreed vnto wickednesse ought geue god thakes alwaye brother beloued god god hath chosen fyrst frutes vnto saluacion ye sanctificacion sprete fayth truth vnto whyche hath chosen also thorow oure gospell vnto purchasynge glory lord iesus christ therfore brother stande ye fast kepe tradicios ye haue learned ether oure preachynge oure epistle iesus christ oure lorde oure god father whyche hath loued v hath geuen v euerlastyng coforte good hope grace exhorte youre harte stablyshe euery good worke worde iii chapter farthermore brethre math ephes c coll pray v worde god may procede glorifyed wyth maye delyuered importune euel men ioh fayth euery man lord faythfull whych shall stablyshe shall kepe euell trust lorde brother soeuer comaude ye shal lord deut b iere b gyde harte loue god pacience christe cor brethre warne ye name lord iesus christ ye wythdraw yourselues fro euery brother walkyng inordinatly accordyng ordinauce whych haue receaued v cor ye yourselues knowe howe ye ought followe v restlesse amoge nother dyd eate breade ony man nought act e cor te labouryng nyght day weerynesse lest shulde charge ony though power yt shulde geue oure selues ensaples vnto followe v whan wt also warned wyl worke let eat nother herde walkyng amonge inordinatly workynge nothyng vsyng curiosite te bbut yt comaude beseke lord iesu yt labourynge eate theyr owne bread brother gal ioh b ye faynte doynge well yf ther ony yt doth obey word shewe v ye letter haue conuersacion wyth hym may ashamed counte hym enemy warne hym brother god peace geue euerlastynge peace euery place lord wyth coll b salutacion wyth myne owne hande paule whych token euery epistle wryte philip c te c grace oure lorde iesus christe wyth amen pthe ende secode epistle paule apostle thessalonian fyrst epistle paule apostle timothe fyrst chapter paule apostle iesus christe accordynge act b comau dement god oure saueour christ iesu te hope act vnto timothe beloued sonne fayth cori galat grace mercy peace god father christ iesu lord dyd pray yu shuldest remayne ephesus act wha went macedonia yt thou shuldeste warne shulde preache none otherwyse tim c nother shulde geue hede vnto fable genealogy endelesse whych rather moue questionstit b edifyenge godwarde whych fayth rom b galat ende fayth charite act b pure harte good co science fayth vnfayned ye whyche errynge turned vnto vayne ianglinge wyllinge teacher law vnderstandynge nother thynges spoke wherof affirme rom b knowe gal c lawe good yf ony man vse lawfully knowynge thys lawe ordyned ryghteous vnto vnryghteous disobedient vngodly synners synfull vncleane slayer father mother maslayers whoremogers rom misusynge themselues wyth mankynde menstealers lyars swearer soeuer thynge el doth wythstande wholsome doctrine whych accordynge ye gospell glory blessed god whyche commytted vnto thanke hym hath comforted christ iesu oure lord hath counted faythfull settynge office whyche fyrste blasphemer act gal persecuter doer iniurye haue optayned mercy god dyd ignorauntly mysbelefe grace oure lorde plenteous wyth fayth loue whych christe iesu thys sayenge true al meanes worthy accepted math b ioh c christe iesu dydde come thys world saue synners wherof chefe haue optayned mercy therfore namely christe iesus shulde shewe pacience informacio shall beleue hym vnto lyfe euerlastynge vnto euerlastynge kynge immortall coll b inuisible onely god honoure glorye euer euer amen commaundemente commytte vnto sonne timothe accordynge prophecyes tymes past thou fyghte good fyght hauynge fayth good conscience whych puttyng awaye haue suffred shipwrake concernynge fayth whyche tim bhymeneus tim b alexander cor whych haue delyuered vnto satanas yt learne blaspheme ii chapter desyre therfore instautly al thynges earnest desire praiers requestes thankesgeuynges made men iere b baruc c kynges ordyned hygh degre yt may lyue quyete peaceable lyfe al godlynesse chastite yt good acceptable ye syght oure saueour god whych wyl haue become safe come vnto ye knowlege truth ioh ther one god gal c hebre c one mediator god men namely man christ iesus whych hath geuen hymselfe redempcion men whose wytnesse cofirmed hys tymes wherein rom ame ordyned preacher apostle tell truth tim b lye teacher heythe fayth truth wyll men therfore praye ioh c euery place psa lyftynge vp esa b pure handes wythoute wrath disputynge tit petri lykewyse also wemen arayenge theselues comly apparel wyth shame fastnesse sobernesse brayded heeres gold pearles precious cloth ye becometh weme promysynge godlynesse thorowe good workes cor clet weme learne silece wt subiection permytte woman teache gene c ephesi vse authorite ouer ye man styll adam made fyrst ye eua ada begyled ye woma begyled ye trasgression shalbe saued engendrynge chyldre yf remayne fayth loue sanctificacion wyth sobrenesse iii chapter thys faythful worde yf ony man desyreth byshopryke desyreth good worke bishop must vnrebukeable leuit b eze tit b ye husbande one wyfe sobre wyse manerlye chaste harberous tim c teacher dro karde fyghter styll stryuer couetous ruler hys house well hauynge chyldren obediente wyth chastite yf ony rule hys owne house howe shall diligente congregacion god newe scolar leste beynge heaued vp pryde fall iudgement deuell muste also haue good reporte wythout fall rebuke deuels snare act minister muste lykewyse chaste dubble tunged geuen muche wyne followynge fylthy lucre hauynge mystery fayth pure conscience let also proued fyrst let ministre hauynge blame weme lykewyse chaste backbytynge sobre faythfull thynges let minister husbades one wyfe whych gouerne theyr chyldren wel theyr house mat b b c shall ministre well shall get themselues good degre much boldenesse ye fayth whych christe iesu thynges wryte vnto sonne timothe hopynge come vnto shortely yf shall tary longe thou mayest knowe thou must couersaut house god whych ye congregacion lyuynge god staye math c stablyshmente truthe wythout naye greate mystery godlynesse ioh b whych shewed fleshe iustifyed ye sprete luce b ephe b dyd appeare vnto angel preached vnto gentyls beleued worlde philip ai taken vp glory iiii chapter bvt sprete sayeth euidentlye tim petri iude c laste dayes shall te b departe fayth geuynge hede vnto spretes errour doctrine ye deuels speakyng lye hypocrisy hauyng theyr cosciece marked wyth whote yro forbyddynge mary abstayne meates whych god hath created gen taken beleuynge wyth mat act tha kesgeuynge haue knowen truth gene eccli f act b euery creature god good nothynge refused receaued wt thankesgeuynge hallowed thorowe worde god prayer puttynge forth thys vnto brother thou shalte good minister christe iesus tim beynge noryshed wyth wordes fayth good doctrine whych thou haste attained vnto tim tim eschue vncomly olde wyuysh fable exercyse thy selfe vnto godlynesse coll c bodely exercyse profitable vnto lytle godlynesse profytable thynges hauynge promyse leuit ye lyfe come thys faythfull sayenge worworthy receauynge therfore laboure cursed hope lyuynge god whych saueoure men specially beleuynge co maunde teache thynges titum blet noma despyse thy youth titu pet ensample beleuynge worde conuersacion loue fayth chastite geue hede vnto readynge exhortacion doctrine vntyl come despyse grace whyche geue vnto act tim prophecy layeng handes ye elder thinke vpon thynges diligente thynges thy profyte maye manifest vnto take hede vnto thyselfe vnto teachynge diligent doyng thys thou shalte saue thyselfe heare v chapter rebuke elder praye fatherleuit g yonger men brother elder wemen mother yonger wemen systers chastite honour wedowes wedowes truly yf ony wedowe hath chyldren chyldes chyldren let learne fyrste rule theyr house eccli b recompence vnto theyr parentes acceptable god luce f cori truely wedowe forsaken let hope god continue prayer supplicacion nyght day hath pleasure lyuynge deade commaunde thys namely vnblameable gal bbut yf ony hath care specially hys householde thesame hath denyed fayth petri worse tha infidele let wedowe chose lesse thre score yeare whych hath ben wyfe one husbande hauynge good reporte good workes yf hath brought vp chyldren petr b yf hath receaued lodgynge yf hath washen sayntes fete yf hath ministred vnto suffre tribulacion yf hath followed vpon euery good worke eschue yonger wedowes wha waxen wanton christe wyll mary hauynge damnacio haue cast away ye fyrst fayth titu beynge also ydle learne go aboute house house beynge ydle also full wordes busy bodyes speakynge thynges nede cor wyll yonger woman mary brynge forth chyldren house wyues geue occasion vnto aduersary speake euell turned backe already satan yf ony faythfull hath wedowes let hym ministre vnto ye congregacion charged yt whych true wedowes may haue ynough elder rule well let counted worthy dubble honoure specially yt laboure worke doctrine scripture sayeth deut cori b thou shalt mosell mouthe vnto oxe treadynge ye corne mat labourer worthy hys wage deut receaue accusacio agaynst elder saue vnder two thre wytnesses synne rebuke presence rest also afrayed testifye god christ iesu hys chosen angel thou kepe thynges wtout fore iudgement doynge nothynge leanynge ye one party tim b laye handes haistely vppon ony man nother partener men synnes kepe thyselfe chaist eccli drynke nomore water vse lytle wyne thy stomake thyne ofte sycknesses men synnes gal manifest goynge afore iudgement synnes followe also lykewyse also good dedes manyfest otherwise hydde vi chapter whatsoeuer cor c ephes petri c seruautes vnder yocke let estyme theyr maysters worthy al honoure left name doctrine lord euel spoke haue faythfull maysters let despyse brethre serue rather faythfull beloued partaker benefytes teach exhorte thynges gal byf ony man teacheth otherwyse agreeth vnto wholsome wordes lorde iesus christe vnto doctrine whych accordyng godlynesse proud knowyng nothyng soude aboute question stryfes wordes tim tit b ye sprynge enuyes contencions blasphemyes euel surmysynges disputynges men corrupt mynded te b robbed truth supposyng godlynesse lucre truely godlynesse pro b hebr c wyth sufficience greate vautage iob c brought nothyng thys worlde doute cary nothynge awaye eccli hauynge foode wherwyth may clothed let v cotent pro mat cfor wyll become ryche fal temptacion snare deuell many vnprofytable hurtefull lustes ye whych drowne man vnto death perdicion roote euel couetousnesse whych lustynge haue erred truth haue tangled themselues many grefes te cbut thou man god flye thynges follow ryghteousnes godlynes faith loue paciece mekenes fyght good fyght fayth laye holde vpo eternal lyfe vnto yu arte called hast knowleged good knowlege many wytnesses commaude god whych reg b act quyckeneth thynges christ iesu wytnessed good wytnesse potius pilate hat thou kepe commaundement without spot vnblameable vntyll commynge lorde iesus christ whome shall shewe hys season blessed myghty apoca c kynge kynges lorde lordes whych hath immortalite dwelleth lyght approcheable ioh b ioh b whome noman dyd euer se nother se vnto whome honoure empyre euerlastynge amen vnto rych world comaunde mynde hyghly nother trust vncertaynte ye ryches well lyuyng god whych geueth v thynges pletyfully enioye become rich good workes geue good wyll distribute mat c gather themselues treasure good fundament tyme come may laye holde vpon ye true lyfe timothe kepe ye whych comytted vnto eschuynge vngoostlye newness wordes opposicions false name knowlege ye whyche promysed fallen awaye co cernynge fayth grace wyth amen pthe ende fyrste epistle apostle paule timothe seconde epistle paule apostle timothe fyrst chapter paule apostle iesus christ wyll god accordyng promise lyfe whych christ iesu vnto timothe moost deare sone cori gal grace mercy peace god father christe iesu oure lorde thanke god act philip serue fro elder rom pure conscience wythout ceassynge make cion prayer desyrynge nyght daye se beynge aduysed thy teares maye fylled wyth ioye callynge mynde fayth whych vnfayned whych dwelte fyrst lois thy graundmother eunice thy mother assured also whyche cause exhorte thou rayse agayne grace god whych ye layeng handes rom b god hath geuen v sprete feare power loue sobernesse rom b therfore ashamed ye wytnesse lord ephe hys presoner laboure wyth gospel accordyng power god whych ephes titum hath delyuered v called wyth holy callynge accordynge oure workes accordynge hys purpose grace geue v christ iesu euerlastynge tymes nowe made manifest lyghtenynge saueour iesus christ1 cor heb c truly hath destroyed death hath lyghtened lyfe vncorrupcion gospell rom tim vnto ordyned preacher apostle teacher heythen whyche cause also suffre thynges ashamed knowe haue beleued sure able kepe haue comytted vnto hym vntyll ye daye tim b haue thou ensample wholsome wordes whyche thou haste herde fayth loue christe iesu kepe good thyng comytted vnto thorow ye holy goost whych dwelleth v thys thou knowest turned fro whych asia whose sorte phygelus hermogenes god geue mercy vnto house tim c onesiphorus hath ofte refreshed ashamed cheine wha come rome mat c sought diligetly dyd fynde lord graut fynd mercy god ye day much hath serued ephesus knowest thou best ii chapter thou therfore stronge sone ye grace whych christ iesu thynges thou haste herde many wytnesses titu ye commytte vnto faythfull men whych shalbe mete also teach laboure good souldyour christe iesu noman warrynge vnto god tangleth hymselfe wyth worldly busyness yt may please hym whych hath alowed hym also stryueth maystrye shall crowned wythout stryue lawfully cor b labourynge husbandman must fyrst receaue ye frutes marke saye god shall geue vnderstandynge al thynges remembre lorde iesus christe rom sede dauid rysen fro deade accordyng gospell whyche laboure vnto bandes doynge euel worde god boude act c ephes coll c therfore suffre thynges chosen sake also optayne saluacion whyche christe iesu wyth heauenly glory thys true sayengerom b yf deade hym shal also lyue wyth hym rom b yf shall haue pacience shal also raygne wyth luc ayf shall denye hym shal also denye v nu c rom yf beleue abydeth faythfull deny hymselfe admonysh thynges testifyeng ye lord stryue wt wordes yt profytable nothynge saue ye subuertynge hearer study shew thyselfe alowable vnto god mat workma beynge ashamed treatynge ye worde god aryght tim tim c vnholy vaine talkynges yu eschue auail much vnto vngodlines theyr word fretteth caker ye whych sorte tim c hymeneus philetus whyche falle awaye fro truth sayeng resurreccion past already haue ouerthrowe ye fayth sure foundamente god doth stade hauyng thys seale ioh b lorde knovveth hys euery one calleth vpon name lorde departeth vvyckednesse rom c great house vessel onely golde syluer also woode earth truely vnto honour vnto dishonoure yf ony therfore shal clense hymselfe fro shalbe vessel vnto honour beynge hallowed mete ye lorde ready vnto euery good worke tim cflye ye lustes youth followe ryghteousnesse faythe hope loue peace wyth yt cal vpon ye lorde wt pure harte tim tim b tit b eschue foolysh question wythout doctrine knowynge engender stryfes seruaunte lorde behoueth stryue gentle toward al tim apte teach paciente gala wyth softnesse rebukyng yt wythstade truth yf god ony tyme wyll geue repentaunce knowe truth repent snare deuell holde captiue vnto wyl iii chapter bvt sure thys yt tim petri iude c ye laste dayes shall perylous dayes hade shalbe louyng theselues couetous hyghmynded proude cursed speaker obeyeng father mother vnkynde wycked wtout affeccion wtout peace accuser lecherous vnmercyfull wtout kyndnesse traytours malepart puft vp louers pleasure god hauynge truly shyne godlynesse denyenge power eschue titum c go thorow house house leade ye woman lade wt synnes captiue whych led wt sudery lustes euer learnynge neuer attaynynge vnto ye knowlege truth exod b iamnes mambres wythstode moses euen also resyste truthe men beynge corrupte mynde lewde cocernyng fayth farther shal profit theyr foly shalbe manyfest vnto theyrs yu hast attayned vnto doctrine fashio purpose saith longe sufferynge loue pacience persecucions sufferynges happened vnto act c cor b antioche iconium lystris maner persecucions haue suffred hath lorde delyuered psal c eccli aand wyll lyue godly christ iesu shal suffre persecucio wycked men miscariers shall waxe worse worse errynge bringynge erroure tim c abyde yu thynges yt thou hast learned comytted vnto knowynge whome thou hast learned thou hast knowen holy scripture fro thy youth whych able instructe vnto saluacion thorow faith christ iesu petri scrypture beynge inspired fro heaue profitable teach rebuke correcke enfourme ryghteousnesse man god perfecte taught vnto euery good worke iiii chapter testifye god iesus christe whych shal iudge ye quycke deade comyng kyngdome preach ye worde earnest seaso seaso reproue beseke rebuke wt al paciece doctrine tyme shall come whan shall suffre wholsome doctrine shall heape maysters vnto accordynge theyr desyres whose eares shall ytch truth truely shall wende theyr hearynge shalbe turned vnto fable watch thou laboure al thynges accoplyshe worke preacher fulfyll thy seruyce sobre petri cfor offred ye tyme myne vnlowsynge hande haue foghten good fyght ioh haue fulfylled course haue kept fayth moreouer ther layed vp cor petri crowne righteousnesse whyche lorde ryghteous iudge shall geue daye vnto also loue hys comynge make hayst come soone vnto coll b philip c demas hath lefte louynge thys worlde gone thessalonica cresces galatia titus dalmatia lucas wt take coll marke brynge hym wt profytable vnto ye seruice tychicus haue sente ephesus cloke yt haue lefte troas wyth carpus comynge brynge wt bokes specially ye parcheme te tim alexader ye coppersmyth hath shewed much euell ye lord shall restore hym accordynge hys workes whome thou also eschue dyd greatly wythstande wordes fyrst answerynge dyd noma assiste forsoke praye layed theyr charge lorde stode comforted preachynge fulfylled al nacions maye heare delyuered lion mouth lorde shall delyuer fro euery euell worke shall make safe hys heauely kyngdome vnto glory euer euer amen grete act rom priscilla aquila ye house onesiphorus rom c erastus dyd remayne corinthus act trophimus haue lefte sycke miletus make haist come wynter eubulus pudens linus claudia brother salute lorde iesus christe thy sprete grace wyth amen pthe ende secode epistle paule apostle timothe epistle apostle paule titus fyrst chapter paule seruaunt god apostle iesus christ accordynge tim b fayth ye electe god knowlege ye truth accordyng godlinesse hope euerlastyng lyfe whych rom god ye doth lye hath promysed ye euerlastynge tymes hath shewed hys season word ye preachynge whych comitted vnto accordynge commaundement god saueour vnto cor c titus deare sone ye comune fayth grace peace fro epes philip god father christ iesu saueoure thynges sake haue lefte ye creta thynges yt lackyng thou shuldest redresse thou ordyne elder thorow cyties also haue appointed yf ony wythout blame husbande one wyfe hauynge faythful chyldre accused ryote subiecte tim byshop must blamelesse mat cor steward god proude angry dronkarde fyghter leuit c ephes desyrous fylthy lucre harberous gentle wyse sobre ryghteous holy teperate e c enbracynge faythfull worde whych accordynge doctrine maye able admonysh wholsome doctrine improue also gaynsaye act cor c ther many disobediente vayne angler deceauers specially circumsion whyche ought haue ben rebuked tim whyche subuerte whole house teachynge thynges oughte fylthy lucre one theyr owne prophetes sayde cretians alwaye lyers euell beastesepimenides slowe bellyes wytnesse true wherfore rebuke sharpely maye sounde ye fayth geuynge hede iewysh fable commaundementes men turnynge fayth math c thynges cleane vnto cleane ro c vnto vncleane vnbeleuynge nothynge cleane theyr mynde conscience defyled confesse knowe god wyth dedes denye hym seynge abhominable vnbeleuynge vnmete vnto euery good worke ii chapter bvt speake thou ye thynges yt become wholsome learnynge elder sobre chast wyse sounde fayth loue pacience tim bthe elder wemen lykewyse yt vse holy apparell tim b accuser geuen much wyne teachynge well maye teache wysedome yonger weme loue theyr husbandes loue theyr chyldren wyse chaste sobre carynge theyr house gentle gen obediente vnto theyr husbandes ye worde god euell spoken exhorte yonge men lykewyse sobre thynges shewe thyselfe tim b petri ensample good workes learnynge vpryghtenesse grauite wholsome worde vnreprouable petri b b yt wythstandeth may ashamed hauynge euel thyng saye v ephes coll c seruautes obediente vnto theyr maysters pleasynge thynges answerynge agayne pyckynge shewynge good faythfulnesse al thinges garnysh doctryne god oure saueoure thynges grace god oure saueoure hath appeared vnto men teachynge v denyenge vngodlynesse ioh c worldly lustes maye lyue soberly ryghteously godly thys world waytyng blessed math c hope commynge ye glory great god oure saueoure iesus christe rom gal bwhich gaue hymselfe v shulde redyme v wyckednesse act b ephes shulde clense vnto hymself acceptable people follower ephes b good workes speake thinges exhorte rebuke wyth earnest tim b let noman despyse iii chapter admonish rom pet c obediente vnto prynces power obeye commaundemente ready vnto euery good worke rom b c speake euell noman stryuers softe shewynge gentlynesse towarde men ourselues also sometyme foolyshe vnbeleuynge goynge astraye seruynge dyuerse desyres pleasure lyuynge malyce enuye hatefull hatynge ech tim b wha kyndnesse gentlynesse oure saueoure god appeared workes ryghteousnesse haue done accordynge hys mercy hath rom c saued v thorowe ioh ephes fountayne newe byrth renewynge ye holy goost hath poured forth vpo v ple tyfully thorow iesus christ saueoure beynge made ryghteous act b ephes hys grace may heyres accordynge hope euerlastynge lyfe faythful worde wolde haue strengthe whych beleue god maye study excel good workes thynges good profytable vnto men tim tim c eschue foolyshe question genealogy contention stryfes wordes vnprofitable vayne math b te rom beschue man geue sectes fyrst seconde admonicion knowyng one peruerted synneth seyng condemned hys owne iudgemente whan shall haue sent artemas vnto ye tychicus make haist come vnto nicopolis haue purposed wynter sende zenas lawer act c cor b b apollo diligently afore nothynge wantynge vnto let learne excell good workes vnto necessarye v frutelesse salute salute loue v fayth grace god wyth amen pthe ende epistle paule apostle titus epistle paule apostle philemon fyrst chapter paule presoner christe iesu brother timothe vnto philemon beloued oure helper vnto apphia moost beloued syster col b archippus oure fellowsouldyour vnto cogregacion thy house cor cor gal grace vnto peace fro god father lord iesus christe thanke god makynge alwaye remembraunce ye prayer hearynge thy loue fayth thou hast lorde iesus vnto al saintes fellowship thy fayth euident knowlege euery good worke christ iesu great ioye consolacio thy loue entrayles sayntes brother dyd reste thorow whyche cause beynge bolde comaunde christ iesu thyng maketh matter loue requyre seynge one namely paule aged also ye presouer iesu christ beseke coll onesimus sone haue begotten bandes somtyme vnprofytable vnto profytable vnto vnto ye haue sent agayne vnto receaue thou hym myn entrayles wold haue kept wyth myght haue ministred vnto bandes gospell steade wold nothynge wythout thy counsell good thou doest copulsion wyth good wyll happely therfore went fro season thou myghtest receaue hym foreuer nowe seruaunt steade seruaunte faythfull brother specially vnto much vnto flesh ye lord yf thou holdest therfore co panio receaue yf hath hurte oweth ought vnto laye charge paule haue wrytten wyth myne owne hande wyll restore saye vnto yt thou doest owe thyselfe also vnto thus brother shall enioye lorde refresh yu myne entrayles christ haue wrytten vnto trustynge thyne obedience knowynge thou wilt aboue say make redy also lodgyng truste restored vnto thorowe youre prayer coll b epaphras fellowpresoner saluteth christ iesu marke aristarchus demas luke helper grace oure lorde iesus christ wyth sprete amen pthe ende epistle apostle paule vnto philemon epistle paule apostle hebrues fyrst chapter god speakynge tymes paste diuersly many wayes vnto father prophetes last hath spoke dayes vnto v hys sone math c whome hath made heyre al thynges also hath made world whych seynge sap cor coll bryghtnesse glory fygure hys substaunce bearynge vp al thynges worde hys power ephes makynge clensynge synnes sytteth ryghthade maieste ye heyght beynge become much better tha angel math c luce philip hath optayned heretage excellente name tha vnto whome ye angel said ony time psal act thou arte sonne thys daye haue begotten agayne reg c shalbe father vnto hym shalbe sonne vnto whan bryngeth fyrst begotte sonne agayne copasse ye worlde sayeth psal let angel god worshippe hym vnto ye angel truly sayeth psal whych maketh hys angel spretes hys minister flame fyre vnto sone psal b thy seat god euer euer rodde thy kyngdome rod ryghteousnes thou hast loued ryghteousnesse hast hated wyckednes therfore hath god euen thy god anoynted wt oyle gladnesse aboue thy companion psal thou lord dyddest create earth begynnynge heauens workes thy handes psal esai b petri b shall perysh thou shalt endure shall waxe olde garmente cloth shalte thou chaunge shalbe chaunged thou arte euen thy yeares shall fayle vnto whome angel sayd ony tyme psal syt thou ryghthande vntyll lay thyne enemyes foote stoole thy fete ministrynge spretes sente ministracion receaue heretage saluacion ii chapter oughte therfore earnestly marke ye thinges haue herde lest happely flowe thorow yf worde gen c c spoken angel became sure euery transgression disobediece dyd receaue due recompence rewarde howe shall escape yf shall despyse greate saluacion marc b began fyrste preached lord herde marci c confyrmed vppon v god bearynge wytnesse act b wt token wonder dyuerse miracle gyftes ye holy goost accordynge hys owne wyll god hath subdued worde come whereof speake vnto angel one testifyeth place sayenge psal man thou arte myndeful hym sone man yu doest visite hym thou haste made hym lytle lesse angel thou hast crowned hym wyth honoure glory hast set hym aboue workes thy ha de thynges hast thou put subieccion vnder hys fete cor c hath put thynges vnder hym hath lefte nothynge yt put vnder hym neuerthelesse yet se thynges put vnder made lytle lesse tha angel namely iesus se pilip crowned wyth glorye honoure reason sufferynge death grace god cor f shuld taiste death men became hym whose sake thynges whome thynges whych brought many chyldre vnto glory author theyr saluacion made perfecte thorow sufferynge sanctifyeth sanctifyed one whyche cause ashamed call brother sayenge psal c shal shewe thy name vnto brother myddes cogregacion wyl prayse agayne psal esai shalbe trustyng hym agayne esay beholde chyldren whyche god hath geuen therfore chyldren haue taken parte wyth flesh bloude pilipi lykewyse hath also take parte wyth osee c cor tim b death myghte destroye hym whych rule death deuell myghte delyuer bondage theyr lyfe tyme reason ye feare death taketh angel vpon hym sede abraham taketh vpon hym wherfore oughte llip lyke vnto brethre thynges myght become mercyful faythful byshoppe god myght fauourable vnto people synnes heb afor thynge wherein suffred proued able helpe also tempted iii chapter wherfore ye holy brother partaker heauenly callynge consydre apostle byshop oure acknowlegynge namely iesus whyche cor faythfull vnto hym hath ordyned hym euen nu moses also hys house thys man counted worthy greater glory moses hath prayse buyldeth house tha house selfe euery house builded body gen abut created thynges god moses truly faithful al house lyke seruaunte deut c wytnesse thynges spoke christe lyke chylde hys owne house cor b c whyche house yf shall kepe stedfast confidence reioycynge rom hope vnto ende wherfore sayeth holy goost psal b day yf ye shal hear hys voyce harden ye youre harte exod prouokynge anger accordyng daye temptacio wyldernesse youre father dyd tepte proued deut sawe workes forty yeare wherfore wroth wyth thys generacio sayd euer erre wyth theyr harte dyd knowe wayes vnto dyd sweare myne anger yt shall entre reste take hede brethre lest ther euel vnbeleuynge harte ony departe lyuynge god exhorte yourselues euery daye loge called hebre b daye none hardened wyth deceatfulnesse synne become partaker christe mat c yf leest kepe sure begynnynge hys substaunce vnto ende vntyl sayde psal b daye yf ye shal hear hys voyce harden harte prouokynge anger herde dyd prouoke anger wente oute egipte moses wyth whome angry fortye yeares wyth dyd synne whose bodyes ouerthrowen deserte num vnto whome dyd sweare entre hys reste saue vnto vnbelyuynge se coulde entre hys reste vnbelefe iiii chapter let v therfore feare leste happely promise entrynge hys reste beynge left ony v supposed wantyng shewed vnto v also vnto esay b rom b worde preachynge dyd auayle beynge myxte wyth fayth herde haue beleued shall entre hys rest hath sayde haue sworen wrath shall entre rest truly yt spake wha ye workes fro creacion ye worlde fynyshed sayde certayne place seueth day wyse gen god rested seuenth daye fro workes place psal b shal entre rest followeth entre therin fyrst shewed dyd entre mysbelefe appoynted agayne certayne daye namely day sayeng dauid loge seaso rehearsed aboue psal b day yf ye shal heare voyce harden harte yf iesus naue geue rest shulde neuer speake another day afterward therfore restynge lefte vnto ye people god yt entred hys rest hath rested fro workes gen god also fro let v therfor make haist entre ye rest yt noma fal thesame ensaple vnbelefe ye worde god quycke myghty goynge thorow tha two edged esa ephe b swearde eccli c reachynge vntyll ye partynge ye soule sprete ioyntes maryes discerner thoughtes intentes harte e cli c ther creature inuisible hys syghte thynges bare open vnto hys eyen vnto whome speake therfore hauynge heb c b great hygh prest whych hath passed thorow heaues euen iesus sone god let v holde fast knowlege hope haue hygh preste yt able haue copassio wt weakenesses yt tepted ouer ensaple esa b rom cor c wythout synne let v therfore wt boldnesse go vnto rom seate grace may optayne mercy fynde grace conueniente helpynge tyme v chapter euery hygh prest take men ordyned thynges yt pertayne vnto god yt leuit b offer vp gyftes sacrifice synnes whych may able haue co passion yt ignoraunt waye yt also clothed wt infirmite therfor ought ye people offer selfe also ye synnes nother dothe ony man take honoure vpo called god exod num lyke aaron also euen dyd christe glorifye hymselfe shulde become hyghe preste spake vnto hym psal thou arte sonne thys daye haue begotte like sayeth also another place psal thou arte preste foreuer order melchisedek luc c ioh whyche offerynge vp prayer supplicacios ye dayes fleshe vnto hym whych able saue hym death wyth greate crye teares herde accordyng hys honoure pilip truely whan god sone learned obedience thynges yt suffred beyng made perfect became vnto al yt obeye ye cause euerlastyng saluacion called god hygh prest ye order melchisedek wherof haue greate matter interpretable speake ye become weake heare cor ye oughte maysters reaso ye tyme ye nede agayne taught ye principle ye begynnyng ye wordes god become haue nede mylke stroge meate euery one yt partaker ye mylke partner ye worde ryghteousnesse babe stroge meate belo geth vnto yt perfect yt reaso ye vse haue exercised wyttes iudgement good euell vi chapter wherfor leauing ye doctrine ye begynnyng christ let v procede vnto perfecte thynges layenge agayne ye fudamet repetauce fro deade workes fayth vnto god baptisynges doctrine laieng also hades resurreccio deade euerlastynge iudgement thys shall act c iacob b yf god shall permytte heb c impossible haue ben lyghtened haue also taysted heauenly gyft become partaker holy gooste haue neuerthelesse petri taysted good worde god power worlde come falle away renewed agayn vnto repentaunce crucifyenge vnto themselues sonne god agayn makynge mocke hym earth drynkynge dew doth fal oft vpo bryngynge forth grasse couenient vnto whome dressed receaueth blessynge god bryngyng forth thornes thystles euel nexte vnto cursynge whose ende vnto burnynge trust better thynges nearer saluacion beloued although speak math dfor god vniust yt forget worke loue whych ye haue shewed hys name whyche haue ministred vnto ye sayntes ministre desyre euery one shewe carefulnesse fulfyllynge ye hope vntyll ende yt ye become slouthfull theyr follower whyche shall enherete promyses fayth pacience god promysynge vnto abraham noman greater whome myght sweare gen c dyd sweare hymselfe sayenge wythout blessynge shall blesse multyenge shall multiplye hauynge pacience longe season gat promyse men sweare one greater selues exod b othe ende confyrme theyr controuersy whych thynge god wyllynge plentyfullyer shew vnto ye heyres promyses ye stablenesse hys cousell put oth betwene two vnmouable thynges vnpossible god lye maye haue moost sure coforte yt flye laye holde hope set afore v whych haue sure stedfast anker oure soule entrynge vntyll inmoost vayle forerunner iesus gone v beyng made high prest euer order melchisedek vii chapter thys melchisedek gen kynge salem prest moost hyghe god whych met abraha beynge returned slaughter kynges blessed hym vnto dyd abraham also deale tythes thynges fyrst truely called kynge ryghteousnesse afterwarde kynge salem whych saye kynge peace wythout father wythout mother wt kynne hauynge nother begynnynge dayes ende lyfe lykened vnto sonne god remayneth prest euer behold great vnto abraham patriarke also gaue tythes ye chefest num par b verely chyldre leui receaue ye presthode haue commaundemente take tythes accordynge lawe theyr brother althoughe also come loynes abraham whose kynred couted amonge toke tythes abraham blessed hym yt ye promyses wythout gaynsayenge bleste better whych lesse truly dye receaue tythes doth wytnesse lyueth maye sayde leui also whych receaueth tythes tythed abraham yet hys father loynes whan melchisedek met hym rom b gal c yf perfeccion therfore presthode leui people receaued lawe vnder nede yet ryse another preste order melchisedek called order aaron mala bfor presthode beynge translated necessary ther also translacion lawe whome thynges spoken trybe whych man serued altare euidente mat b lorde sproge trybe iuda whyche tribe moses hath spoken nothynge prestes yet manifest yf accordynge lykenes melchisedek ryse onother prest whych made lawe carnall commaundemente power vnlowseable lyfe wytnesseth p l thou arte preste foreuer order melchisedek truely disanullynge fyrst commaundemente happened weaknesse vnprofitablenesse rom b gal b c afor lawe brought nothynge perfectnesse introduccion better hope ye whych approche vnto god forsomuch wythout othe truely made prestes wythout othe thesame wyth othe hym whyche sayde vnto hym psal lorde hath sworne shall repente hym thou art prest euer much iesus become stablysher better testament many become prestes death forbydde remayne thesame doth abyde euer hath euerlastynge presthode wherfore euer able saue yt comyng vnto god hym lyuynge alway tim ioh make intercessio v one semed hygh prest vnto v holy innocent vndefyled sundered fro synners beynge made hygher tha heauens whych hath nede dayly leui ba hygh prests offer vp sacrifice fyrst hys synnes people yt hath done offerynge hymselfe heb b ye lawe maketh men prestes hauyng weaknesse ye worde ye othe whyche ye law sonne beynge perfecte euer viii chapter chef ye thynges yt spoke hebre c b haue hygh prest whych set ephes c psal petri c ye righthade ye seat ye greatnes ye heaues minister ye sayntes true tabernacle yt whych god hath pyghte man euery hygh prest ordyned offer vp gyftes sacrifice wherfore necessary also haue yt may offre vp yf therfor vpo earth nother prest seyng ther ye offer vp gyftes accordynge ye law heb serue vnto ye example shadow heauenly thynges answered vnto moses wha fynyshed tabernacle exod act f se sayeth thou thynges accordynge ensample shewed ye vpon mounte hath optayned better office also mediatour better testamet whych ordyned better promyses yf fyrst bene blameable verely ther shulde place secode ben sought settynge noughte sayeth iere beholde dayes shal come sayeth lorde shall fynysh new testamente vpon house israell vpon house iuda accordynge testamet made vnto theyr father ye daye whan toke theyr hande yt myght leade lade egipt act dyd abyde testamente haue regarded sayeth lorde esai b iere f thys ye testament shal ordyne vnto ye house israel dayes sayeth ye lord wyl geue lawes theyr mynde theyr harte wyll wryte zacha b apoc b shalbe god vnto shalbe people vnto euery one shal teach hys neghboure euery one hys brother sayenge knowe lorde shall knowe fro ye leest vnto ye shalbe mercyful vnto theyr wyckednesses shal nowe remembre theyr synnes sayeng ye new weareth yt afore yt worne waxeth old neare ye peryshing ix chapter fyrst verely also iustifyenges worshippe temporall holynesse exod afor fyrst tabernacle made whych candelstickes table leuit b yt shewe breades whyche called holy behynde vayle ye seconde tabernacle whych called moost holy hauynge golden censoure exod b arke conuenaunte ouerlayde euery syde wyth golde wherein exod f golden pot hauyng manna rodde aaro num whych floryshed exod c table testamente aboue thesame cherubins glory ouershadowyng ye mercy seate wherof nowe speak particularly num wha ye thynges thus dressed fyrst tabernacle truely entred alwaye ye prestes fulfyllynge office sacrifice exod b leuit g luce seconde ye hygh prest yeare wythout bloude whych shulde offre hys people ignoraunce holy goost meanynge thys iohan waye holynesses yet vttered fyrst tabernacle hauyng yet hys beynge whyche similitude present tyme accordynge whych gyftes sacrifice offred whyche make perfecte concernynge ye co science seruer meates drynkes sundry washynges ryghteousnesses fleshe set vntyll tyme correccion hebre c christ comynge hygh prest good thynges come gone holy place larger perfecter esaie c cori tabernacle made wyth handes yt thys makynge nother ye bloude goates calues ioha b petri c apoc hys owne bloude hauynge foude eternall redemcion leui b b yf ye bloude goates ox nu b ash cowe sprenkled sanctifyeth vncleane vnto clensynge flesh much hath ye bloude christ ephe coloss b corin c whych thorowe holy goost hath offered hymselfe vnspotted vnto god clensed consciece deade workes rom petr serue lyuynge god therfor gala c tim mediatoure new testament meane death called maye receaue promyse eternall heretage redepcion transgression vnder fyrst testament ther testament necessarye ye death testament maker passe gal testament confyrmed deade el yet value loge yt maketh testament lyueth wherfore nother ye fyrst testament ordyned without bloude wha euery comaundement ye lawe red moses vnto al people takynge ye bloude calues goates wt water purple woll ysope sprekled ye boke ye people sayenge exod b thys ye bloud testamet ye whych god hath comauded vnto tabernacle also ye vessel ye seruice sprenkled wyth bloude lykewyse nearehad al thynges clesed wyth bloude lawe wythout sheddynge bloude ther remyssion therfore necessarye truly ye similitude heauely thynges clesed wt ye heaue ly thynges theselues better sacrifice iesus entred holy place act f made wyth handes ensamples true heauen ioha maye appeare vnto syght god v nother offre hymselfe ofte lyke leuit g hygh prest entreth euery yeare holy place wt straunge bloude orels behoued hym ofte suffr begynnynge world nowe ye fynishynge tymes hath appeared hys owne offerynge vnto puttynge awaye synne ordined men dye shalbe iudgemet rom petri c eue christ offered take awaye synnes many seconde tyme shall appeare wythout synne vnto al yt wayt hym vnto saluacion x chapter lawe colloss c hauynge shadowe good thynges come fashion thynges ca neuer make comer vnto perfecte wyth sacrifice whych offer wythout ceassynge euery yeare orels ceassed offered worshipper clensed shuld haue conscience synne euery yeare made remebraunce synnes leuit c impossible synnes taken away wt bloude ox goates therfore entryng worlde sayeth esaye b psal b sacrifice offerynge woldest thou haue thou hast prepared body vnto burntofferynges synne offerynges pleased sayde lo come begynnynge boke ther wrytten shulde thy wyll god sayenge aboue sacrifice offerynges burntofferinges synne offerynges thou woldest nother thynges pleasynge vnto yt offered ye lawe sayd lo come maye thy wyll god taketh awaye fyrst yt may ordyne ensuynge whych wyll hallowed offerynge body iesus christ euery prest truely ready ministryng dayly offeryng oft offeringes whych take away ye synnes thys offeryng one sacrifice synnes sytteth euer ye right hande god waytynge henceforth psal avntyll hys enemyes set stoole hys fete wyth one offerynge hath made perfecte foreuer sanctifyed ye holy goost beareth recorde wyth v yt sayd iere thys testament shall make wyth dayes saieth lord wyll geue lawes theyr harte theyr myndes wyll wryte wyl nomore remebre theyr synnes wyckednesses seynge remission tha ther nowe nomore offerynge synne hauynge therfore brother ioha rom heb b boldnesse entraunce holy thynges bloude christ ye whych new waye lyuynge hath prepared vnto v thorow vaile hys flesh hygh prest ouer house god let v come neare wyth true harte fulnesse fayth heb c petri hauynge harte sprenkled euell conscience hauynge body washen wyth cleane water let v holde fast knowlegynge fayth wauerynge faythfull hath promysed let v consydre ech prouokynge charite good workes leauynge handreachynge haue costume comfortyng somuch rom b ye shall se daye approchynge nu c hebr vnto v synnynge wyllingly knowlege truth receaued ther lefte nowe sacrifice synnes fearfull waytynge iudgemet heate fyre whych shall consume aduersaryes deut b c yf ony maketh lawe moses voyde dyeth wtoute mercy vnder two thre wytnesses howe muche worse punyshmente suppose ye hym deserue whyche treadeth sonne god vnder foote counteth bloude conuenaunte wherein sanctifyed defyled thynge doth iniury vnto sprete grace know yt sayd deut rom c yelde vnto vengeaunce shal recopence agayne deu e god shall iudge hys people dredefull thynge fall handes lyuynge god call mynde ye dayes past whych beyng lyghtened ye suffred great stryfe sufferynges one parte truely ye become gasynge stocke wyth shame trouble parte ye become companion couersaut math c tim cfor ye haue suffred wyth presoners toke wyth ioye spoylynge goodes knowynge haue better durynge substaunce lose therfore confidence whyche hath great reward hebre paciece nedefull vnto doynge wyll god ye maye receaue promyse abac yet shorte lytle whyle commynge shall come shall tary rom b galat b ryghteous shall lyue fayth yf shall wythdrawe hymselfe shall please vnto soule chyldren wythdrawynge vnto perdicio fayth vnto purchasynge soule xi chapter fayth substaunce thynges hoped euidence thiges ye rom c coloss b appeare ye haue ye elder optayned report fayth vnderstade gene worlde haue ben ordyned ye worde god yt inuisible thynges myght become visible gene fayth dyd abell offre plentyfull sacrifice vnto god cain whych optayned reporte ryghteous gyftes bearynge wytnesse vnto god beynge deade speaketh yet thesame gene c sapi b eccl b cby fayth enoch translated leste shulde se death founde god translated hym translatynge reporte yt pleased god wythout fayth impossible please god yt comynge vnto god must beleue recompeser vnto yt seke hym gen eccli b fayth noe receaued answer fearyng thinges yet sene dressed arke sauegard hys house whych math conde ned world made heyre ye ryghteousnesse fayth gen fayth called abraha obeyed go ye place receaue heretage wente knowynge whether went fayth dwelled lande promyse straunge lande dwellynge tentes wyth isaac iacob heyres wyth hym lyke promyse wayted cytie hauynge fudacios whose workeman buylder god fayth gen sara also herselfe beynge baren receaued strength coceauyng sede yee besyde ye tyme hyr age beleued god faythful whych promysed therfor also one thesame deade sproge many multitude gene starres skye sande see shore innumerable accordynge fayth dyed hauyng receaued promyses ioh c seynge afarre salutynge gen confessynge straungers gestes vpon earth yt saye thynges shewe seke natural contry truly yf ben myndeful yt wet verely leasure ynough returne desyre better yt heauenly exod math therfore god ashamed called theyr god hath prepared cytie vnto fayth dyd gen c eccli c abraham offre vp isaac whan proued offered hys begotte sone receaued promyses vnto sayd isaac shall ye sede called vnto thynkynge yt god able also rayse fro deade whereby also receaued hym ensaple gene dby fayth also dyd isaac blesse iacob esau thynges come gen cby fayth dyd iacob dyenge blesse euery one ye chyldre ioseph worshipped toppe hys rodde gene fayth dyd ioseph dyeng reme bre ye departynge ye chyldren israel comaunded cocernynge hys bone exod faith moses beyng bore hyd elder thre monethes saw hym proper chyld feared ye kynges comau demet exod b fayth dyd moses beyng waxe great deny hym ye sone pharaos doughter chosyng rather punished wt ye people god tha haue ye pleasur teporal synne estymyng ye rebuke christe greater ryches tha ye treasure ye egipcias loked vnto ye reward exod fby fayth left egipte beyng afrayed kynges moode wayted ye inuisible seyng exod bby fayth kept easter effusion bloude lest yt waysted fyrstborne shulde touch exod c fayth passed reed see thorow drye lande whyche egipcians hauyng assayed drowned iosue c fayth dyd ye walles iericho fall copassynge seuen dayes iosue iudic fayth dyd raab harlot perysh wt vnbeleuynge receauyng ye spyes peace shall saye tyme shal fayle treatyng iosue iudic gedeon iudi barach iudi b sampson iudic f hiepte r f dauid ro samuel prophetes whyche thorowe fayth haue ouercome kyngdomes haue wrought ryghteousnesse haue gotten ye promyses dan g haue stopped mouthes lios dan haue queched ye violece ye fyre haue escaped ye edge ye sweard esa b recouered theyr sycknes iudi para become stroge battail pa haue ouerthrowe tetes ye aleautes c reg wemen haue receaued theyr dead agayn fro ye resurreccio iere wer racked acceptyng ye delyuerauce yt myght fynde ye better resurreccion haue proued mockynges stroke besydes thys also bade presonementes reg b stoned hewe asunder tempted slaye ye death swearde reg b math went shepes skynnes gotes skynnes nedynge distresse vexed whereof ye worlde worthy wandryng wyldernesses mountaynes dennes caues earth al beyng alowed ye wytnesse fayth receaued promyse god prouydynge better thyng v shulde made perfecte wythout v xii chapter therfore hauynge greate cloude wytnesses layde vpon v ephe c col petri layenge away weyght synne standeth v let v runne pacience vnto stryfe set afore v lokynge vpon author fynysher fayth iesus philip whyche ioye beynge set afore hym suffered crosse shame despysed hebre b sytteth ryghthande seate god remembre hym suffred suche speakynge agaynst hymselfe synners yt ye weery waxynge faynte myndes ye haue yet resysted vntyl bloude stryuyng agaynst synne haue forgotte ye cosolacion whyche speaketh vnto vnto chyldren sayeng prouer b sone despyse nourtoure ye lord nother faynt whan yu art rebuked hym apoc b ye lord loueth doth chaste scourgeth euery sone receaueth remayne ye chastenyng god offereth hymselfe vnto vnto chyldren chyld father doth chaste yf ye wtout correccion wherof haue al parteners tha ye bastardes chyldre moreouer haue truly father flesh teacher feared shall muche obey ye father sprets lyue truely ye space fewe dayes enfourmed v accordynge theyr wyll thys vnto yt profytable receaue hys holynesse euery chastenyng preset tyme semeth ioye sorowe afterwarde shal geue yt exercysed thesame moost quyet frute ryghteousnesse yt whych cause esa lyfte vp ye slacked hades ye lowsed knee make strayght pathes vnto fete yt noma haltynge go astraye rather healed rom c follow vpon peace wt al men holynesse wtout ye noma shal se god takyng hede yt noma destitute ye grace god lest ony roote bytternesse spryngynge vpwarde let many stayned ther whoremonger vncleane persone esau gen solde byrthryghte one meate sure yt afterwardes also desyryng enheret refused gene f f de place repetauce though sought wt teares ye ar come mou tayne yt handled exod c fyre yt ca approched myste darknesse tempest soude ye trope voyce wordes whych yt dyd heare dyd excuse theselues yt worde shuld happe vnto coulde beare yt spoken exod b yf beast shall touch mou tayne shalbe stoned terrible yt sene moses dyd say afrayed quake ye come vnto ye moute sion ye cytie ye lyuynge god apoc b ye celestial ierusalem multitude many thousad angel ye cogregacio fyrstborne wrytten heauens god iudge spretes iuste perfect iesus mediatour newe testamente petr heb c csprenklynge bloude speakynge better tha gene b abel se ye refuse hym yt speaketh yf escaped refusynge hym yt spake vpon earth much yt refuse hym ye speaketh vnto v fro heauens whose voyce dyd shake earth ye tyme promyseth sayeng agg b yet agayne shal shake earth also heauen sayeth yet declareth chaungynge mouable done thynges vnmouable maye remayne receauynge therfore vnmoueable kyngdo haue grace petri ye may serue pleasing god wt feare reuerence deut god cosumynge fyre xiii chapter let ye loue brotherheade cotinue gene rom b petr b forget hospitalite acceptable receauynge angel lodgynge math c heb dremembre bounde boude wt payne ye yourselues abydyng also ye body let wedlocke honourable al thinges ye bed vndefiled god shal iudge ye whoremogers aduouterers let maners wtout couetousnesse eccli beyng cotent wt thynges yt ye haue already said deut b io e wil leaue forsake yt may boldly say psal lorde helper shal afrayd vnto remembre haue ye ouersyght haue spoken worde god vnto beholdynge ende whose couersacion followe theyr fayth iesus christ yesterdaye hebre b daye abydeth foreuer miscaried sudry strauge doctrine rom c coloss c titum c best staye harte wt grace ioh f wt meates dyd auayle dyd walke haue altare wherof haue power eate yt serue tabernacle exod b leuit c num beastes yt bloud brought ye holy place ye high prest synne bodyes burnt wt tentes whych cause iesus also yt myght hallowe ye people hys bloude ioha b dyd suffre wtout gate let v therfore go forth vnto hym wythout tentes bearyng hys rebuke pilip c haue abydynge cytie seke one come psal let v therfore alwaye offer sacrifice prayse vnto god thorow hym yt ye frute lyppes knowlegynge vnto hys name forget doyng wel cori handreachynge pilip c wyth suche sacrifyces god made fauourable obeye youre ouerseers obediente vnto watche though shal geue accompte may wyth ioye syghynge ye doth become act c ephes c praye v trust haue good conscience wyllynge thynges conuersaut well beseke ye yet yt maye restored vnto ye spedely god peace whyche hath brought lorde iesus christ dead ezec b ioh petri great shepeherd shepe thorowe bloude eternall testamente deut cori pilip b make mete goodnesse ye maye hys wyll workynge amonge maye please syght thorow iesus christ vnto glorye euer euer amen beseke brother ye suffre ye worde solace haue wrytten vnto wyth wordes know brother timothe lette go wyth whome yf shall come spedely wyll se grete al ouer seer sayntes brother italy salute grace wyth amen pthe ende epistle paule apostle hebrues catholyke epistle apostle iames fyrst chapter iames seruaunte god oure lord iesus christ sendeth gretynge vnto twelfe tribe whych actu scattred counte full ioye brother whan ye fall sundry temptacions beyng sure rom prouyng fayth worketh pacience1 petri b zach b let pacience haue perfecte workynge ye maye perfecte sounde faydyng nothynge prouer ioh c yf ony nedeth wysedome let hym requyre god whyche geueth plentyfully vnto euery man vpbraydeth shalbe geuen marc c let requyre fayth doutynge douteth lyke vnto ye wawe ye see whych steared wynde tossed aboute let therfore suppose shall receaue ought ye lorde man doutfull vnstable hys wayes let ye brother lowe degre reioyce hys exaltacion rych hys humblenesse floure grasse shal passe awaye eccli esa petri sonne arose wyth heate dryed ye grasse hys floure fell downe bewty hys syghte peryshed euen shall ryche also fayde hys wayes iob b happy man suffereth tentacion whan shalbe proued shall receaue crowne lyfe whych god hath promysed loue hym let noman whan tempted saye tempted god god te ter euell tempteth noman euery one tempted beynge drawen entysed owne cocupiscence afterwarde whan rom co cupiscence hath conceaued enge dreth synne synne whan fynyshed engedreth death erre therfore moost beloued brother prouer ioh euery best gyfte euery perfecte gyfte aboue comynge downe father lyghtes ther chauge course ouershadowynge ioha cori wyllyngly hath engendred v wyth ye worde truth begynnynge hys creature ye knowe moost beloued brethre prou eccli b let euery swyft heare slowe speake slow wrath wrath man worketh ryghteousnes god rom b coloss castyng awaye therfore vnclennesse abundaunce malyce receaue grafted word getlynesse able saue soules rom b ye doer word hearer deceauynge yourselues luc c yf ony man hearer ye worde doer thesame shall lykened vnto man beholdynge vysage hys byrthe glasse dyd beholde hymselfe went forthwith dyd forget fashio math b yt shal loke law perfecte lyberte shall remayne thesame beynge become forgetfull hearer accomplysher worke thesame shalbe happy dede yf ony man thynketh hym deuoute refraynyng hys petri iacob tunge myscaryenge hys harte thys man deuocion vayne pure vnspotted deuocion god father thys vysyte fatherlesse motherlesse wedowes theyr trouble kepe hymselfe vndefyled thys ioha c worlde ii chapter brother haue fayth lorde glory iesus christe wyth leuit regarde person yf ther entre congregacio man hauynge golden rynge goodly apparell ther shall also entre poore man vyle rayment ye loke vpon hym clothed wyth gaye raymente shall saye vnto hym syt thou well poore ye shall saye stande thou syt downe vnder foote stoole fete ye iudge yourselues become iudges euell thoughtes math aherken moost beloued brethre hath god chosen poore thys worlde rych fayth heyres kyngdome whych god hath promysed loue hym ye haue dishonoured poore ryche oppresse myghte drawe iudgemente blaspheme good name called vpon yf ye leest fulfyl ye royal lawe accordyng scripture leuit c thou shalt loue thy neghboure thyself ye well yf ye regarde persone ye synne beynge rebuked lawe transgressours ezech b euer kepeth whole lawe offendeth one become gylty hath sayde exod cthou shalt commytte aduoutry hath sayde also thou shalte kyl yf yu shalte commyt aduoutry shalt slaye thou arte become transgressoure lawe speake ye begynninge iudged lawe lyberte math iudgemente wythout mercy shalbe vnto hym yt sheweth mercy mercy exalteth iudgemet math doth auayle brother yf ony say hym haue fayth hath workes fayth saue hym ioh c yf brother syster naked nede dayly foode ony saye vnto go peace warmed satisfyed ye shall geue ye thinges necessary body shall auayle euen faythe also yf hath workes deade herselfe body wyl saye thou hast faith haue workes shew thy fayth wythout workes shal shewe faith dedes beleuest thou ther one god thou doest well mat marc cthe deuels also beleue tremble wylte thou know thou vayne man fayth wythout workes deade abraham oure father iustifyed workes offerynge isaac hys sonne vpon altare seyst thou fayth wrought wyth hys workes workes fayth made perfecte scripture fulfylled sayenge gen c rom b gal abraham beleued god counted hym vnto ryghteousnesse called frende god se ye man iustifyed workes fayth lyke wyse also io c raab harlot iustifyed receauyng messaugers sending another way ye body wythout ye sprete deade eue fayth also wtout workes deade iii chapter brethre become many math maysters knowyng ye receaue iudgemente al offende many thynges eccli c b offedeth worde ye perfecte able also lead ye whole body wt brydle yf put brydles horse mouthes leade theyr bodyes aboute consent vnto v behold shyppes whyle great led greate wyndes wyth lytle helme turned aboute ye violence gouernoure wyll eue also tunge lytle mebre truely exalteth greate thynges beholde maner fyre great woode burneth tunge fyre multytude wyckednesse tunge set oure membres whyche defyleth whole body enflameth ye whyle natiuite beynge enflamed hell euery nature beastes byrdes serpentes tamed made meke ye nature man tunge noman tame restlesse euell ful deadly poyso blesse god father ye curse men whych gen created ymage similitude god ye mouth commeth forth blessynge cursynge ought done brother doth fountayne flowe one hole swete bytter water fygge tre brother brynge forth grape vyne fygges euen nother salt water geue swete wyse learned amonge let hym coloss ephes b shew workynge hys good conuersacion mekenesse wysedome yf ye haue rom b bytter hatred ther contencions youre harte reioyce lyars agaynste truth thys wysedome comynge downe fro aboue father lightes earthly beastly deuelysh enuy contencion inconstancy euery euell worke ye wysedome aboue fyrste truely sap bchayste peaceable meke persuadynge consentynge vnto good thynges full mercy good frutes iudgynge wythout simulacion ye frute ryghteousnesse sowe peace vnto ye worke peace iiii chapter fro whence ther warres stryfes amonge cocupisceces whych stryue membres ye desyre haue ye slaye enuye get ye stryue warre haue ye axed ye axe receaue ye axe well ye may bestow vpo cocupisceces ye aduouterers knowe ye gal b ioh c frendshippe thys worlde enemye vnto god whosoeuer therfore wyl frende thys worlde made enemy god thynke ye scripture sayeth nought rom gal c sprete abideth desyreth vnto enuy pro b geueth grace wherfore sayeth god petri b resysteth proude geueth grace vnto ye lowly subiecte vnto god therfore resyst ye deuel shal flye drawe nye vnto god shall draw nye clese handes ye synners pourge harte ye dubble harted ye myserable sorowe wepe let youre laughter turned wepynge ioye heuynesse petri lowly presence lord shall exalte backbyte one another brother ye bacbiteth brother iudgeth hys brother bacbyteth lawe iudgeth lawe yf thou iudgest lawe thou arte doer law iudge ther one lawgeuer iudge ca destroye deliuer rom art thou iudgest thy neghboure eze luce bbeholde ye saye daye morowe shal go cytie continue truely yeare shall occupye gayne whyche knowe shalbe tomorowe youre lyfe vapoure appearynge lytle shal vanysh ye saye act hebre yf lorde wyl yf lyue shall thys yt ye reioyce prydes euery reioycynge wycked luce dto hym therfore good doynge synne vnto v chapter go b ye rich wepe howlynge youre wretchedness ye whych shall come ryches corrupte clothes eate mothes golde syluer rusted theyr rust shalbe wytnesse agaynst shall eate youre flesh fyre ye haue heaped wrath last dayes leuit c deut c tobi c beholde ye wage labourer whych haue reaped downe landes ye whych defrauded doth crye theyr crye entred eares lorde sabaoth luce c ye haue ben mery vpon earth haue noryshed harte vnmeasurablenesses ye haue brought ryghteous day slaughter haue slayne hym dyd wythstade ye paciet therfore brethre vntyll commynge lord beholde husbandman wayteth preciouse frute earth takynge pacience vntyll receaue early latter rayne ye pacient therfore also satle youre harte commynge lord approched sygh one agaynst another brother ye iudged beholde ye iudge stadeth ye dore take brethre ye prophetes ensaple euell ende longe sufferynge workynge pacience whych haue spoken name ye lord behold mat coute happy haue suffered ye haue herde iob c b paciece iob haue sene ende lord ye lorde mercyfull pyteous al thynges brethre math cori c swear nother heauen earth ony soeuer oth el let oth yee yee nay nay ye fall vnder iudgement yf ony sory let hym praye yf mery let hym also synge psalmes yf ony amog sycke let hym brynge elder congregacion let pray ouer hym marc b anoyntynge hym wyth oyle name lorde prayer fayth shal saue sycke lorde shall rayse hym vp yf synnes shalbe forgeue hym knowlege synnes therfore one another praye ech ye maye saued instaute prayer ryghteous much worth reg luc c elia mortall lyke vnto v prayer prayed shuld rayne vpon earth rayned thre yeare syxe monethes reg aand prayed agayne ye skye gaue rayne earth gaue hyr frute brother yf ony shal erre truth ony shall conuerte hym muste knowe causeth synner conuerte erroure hys waye shal saue hys soule death shall couer multitude synnes pthe ende ye canonicall epistle apostle iames fyrst canonicall epistle peter apostle fyrst chapter peter apostle iesus christ ye chosen straungers ac scatterynge abrode pontus galatia cappadocia asia bithinia accordyng ye foreknowlege god father vnto ye sanctificion ye sprete ye obedience heb b c sprenklynge bloude iesu christ cor ephes b grace peace multiplyed vnto pet blessed god father oure lorde iesus christe whyche accordynge hys great mercy hath begotte v agayne lyuely hope cor rysynge agayne iesus christ ye deade rom heretage vncorruptible vndefyled faydynge colo kepte heauen whych power god kept fayth vnto saluacion whych ready shewed last tyme whych ye shall reioyce yf ye must lytle sory dyuerse temptacios iob ia ob tryenge faith foude much precious gold proued fyre vnto prayse math c glory honoure reuelacion iesus christ ioh whome whyle ye haue sene ye loue hym whome nowe also though ye seynge hym ye beleue beleuynge ye shall reioyce wyth vnoutspeakeable ioye glorious bearynge awaye ende youre fayth saluacion soules whych saluacion gen b daniel g gge b ach b ye prophetes haue searched sought whych prophecyed ye grace yt come amonge searchynge whych maner tyme ye sprete god shulde signify shewynge afore sufferynges christe iesu gloryes come vnto whome opened declared vnto selues made manyfeste thynges whych shewed vnto whych preached vnto act ye holy goost beinge sente heaue luc b vpon whome angel desyre loke wherfore luce dthe loynes mynde beynge gyrded vp ye sobre hope perfectly grace yt offered vnto shewynge iesus christe chyldren obedience beyng lyke fashioned vnto ye lustes fore ignoraunce vnto holy whych hath called ye also holy youre conuersacion wrytten leuit g ye shalbe holy holy yf ye cal vpon father whyche math c iudgeth accordynge euery man worke wythout respecte person walke feare tyme indwellyng corin c c knowynge yt ye bought wt corruptible syluer golde fro vayne couersacio ye fatherly tradicionheb ioh b apoc wt precious bloude vnspotted vndefyled lambe christ beyng knowen truely ye creacions ye worlde beynge made manyfest ye last tymes esa b luce b sake whych hym faythfull god whych hath raysed hym deade philip hath geuen hym glorye youre fayth hope shulde god clensynge youre soules ye obedience loue syngle loue brotherheade loue ech earnestly fro ye harte beynge borne agayne corruptible sede vncorruptible worde lyuynge god abydynge foreuer esa eccli b iacob b fleshe grasse hys glory ye floure grasse grasse wythered hys floure fel vvorde god abydeth euer worde deut c whyche preached amonge ii chap layenge ephes coloss hebre awaye therfore al malyce al gyle dissemblynge enuyes backbytynges mat newe borne babe reasonable wythoute gyle couet ye milke yt therin ye may growe vnto saluacion psal yf ye assaye leest yt lorde swete vnto whome comynge neare ephes c quycke stone men truely refused chosen god glorifyed ye also buylded vpon quicke stone ye spiritual house esa holy presthode offerynge ro heb c spiritual sacrifice acceptable vnto god thorow iesus christ wherfore ye scripture cotayneth also esay c math act beholde laye sion heade stone corner stone alowed chose precious yt shal beleue hym shal ashamed vnto therfore yt beleuynge prayse vnto yt beleuyng stone psal buylders refused thesame become heade ye corner esay c stone stomblynge rocke offedicle vnto offende worde nother beleue wheron also set exod ye chosen kynred kyngly presthode deu holy nacion people purchasynge esa ye shewe ye power hym hath called hys wonderful lyght darkenesses ose c rom c whych somtyme people god people god hauynge optayned mercy haue optayned mercy ye beloued beseke strau gers pylgrymes rom b galat c abstayne carnall desyres whyche warre agaynst soule math b hauynge conuersacion good amoge heythen petri b yt backbyte euel doer consyderyng good workes may prayse god ye day visitacio rom titum ye therfore subiecte vnto euery creature man god ether vnto ye kynge ye moost excellente ether vnto chefe officer sent fro hym ye punishmet eueldoers ye prayse good wyll god doyng well ye maye cause ignoraunce foolysh men styll beynge fre hauynge cloke wyckednesse vnto lyberte seruauntes god rom b honoure al men loue brotherheade feare god mat chonoure kynge ephe coloss c titum b ye seruau te obediete vnto maysters wyth feare onely good gentle also frowarde cor bfor grace yf ony man cosciece sake god suffre heuynesses sufferyng vnworthely thankes yf ye synnyg beynge buffetted suffre math petri yf ye doynge well beare pacietly yt grace wt god ther ye called christ also suffred v leauynge ioh b philip ensaple yt ye followe hys footesteppes whiche dyd synne nother ther gyle foud hys mouth math c ioha c wha euel spoke cursed wha suffred threatened deliuered hymselfe vnto hym yt iudged vnryghteously esa eccli luce hath borne synnes hymselfe body vpo ye tre yt beyng dead synne may lyue vnto ryghteousnesse whose strypes ye healed ye shepe goynge astraye ye turned ye shepherde byshop soules iii chap lykewyse also cori ephes c coloss c weme let obediente vnto theyr husbades yt also obey ye word may wonne conuersacion wemen wythout worde beholdynge holy couersacion fear whose apparell tim b outwarde wt broydyng heere puttyng golde puttyng apparell ye inwarde man yt hyd harte quiete meke spret whych rych syght god dyd holy weme also trustyng god tyer themselues beynge obediente vnto theyr owne husbandes sara dyd obeye abraha gene b callynge hym lorde whose doughters ye doynge well fearyng ony perturbacion lykewyse ye dwellynge wyth accordyng knowlege te geuynge woman honoure vnto weaker vessell vnto lyke heyres also grace lyfe youre prayer let conclusion ye onemynded sufferynge together louers brotherheade mercyful soft lowly prou c math rom c rendrynge euel euel curse curse cotrarywyse blessyng therfore ye called gen math c ye possesse blesse heretage psa b yt wyll loue lyfe se good dayes let hym refrayne tuge fro euel lippes yt speak gile let hym eschue euell good let hym seke peace followe eye ye lord vpo ye ryghteous hys eares theyr prayer ye syght ye lord vpo euels yt shall hurte yf ye follower god mat yee yf ye suffre ought ryghteousnes sake blessed ar ye esa c math fear ye theyr threatenynge ye troubled iob c sactifye ye lord christ harte psa f actu beynge euer redy ye satisfyeng euery requyryng accopte yt fayth hope wt mekenesse feare hauyng good cosciece titum petri b yt ye backbyt maye ashamed speake euel couersacion christ petri c math better doynge well yf wyll god suffre doynge euell rom heb c christe also dyed oure synnes ryghteous vnryghteous myght offer v vp vnto god beynge slayne truely flesh quyckened sprete ye whych also commynge preached vnto spretes preso whych gene mat luc c somtyme vnbelyuyng whan wayted pacience god dayes noe whan ye arke made gene whyche eyght soules saued water whych rom baptyme beynge lyke fashion dothe saue layenge away ye fylthynesse flesh ye demau dynge good conscience towarde god rysynge agayne iesus christ whych ryghthad god swalowynge vp death myght become heyres euerlastynge lyfe beynge gone heaue hebre b b cthe angel myghty power beynge subiecte vnto hym iiii chapter therfore christe hauynge suffered flesh ye also armed wyth lyke meanynge rom suffered flesh left synnes lyue resydue tyme resteth flesh ioha c lustes men wyll god eph ynough tyme past spente fulfyllynge wyll heythen vnto haue walked wa tonne lustes dronkennesses backettynges vnmeasurable eatynges drynkynges vnlawfull worshippynges idol whyche maruayled ye ranne vnto lyke confusion excesse speakyng euel whych shall geue accompt vnto hym whyche ready iudge quycke dead pe ri cfor thys also gospell preached vnto deade ioh c truely maye iudged accordynge man fleshe lyue god sprete ye ende thynges shall come neare mat ye therfore wyse watch prayer thynges hauynge continual loue towarde ech amonge yourselues proue b loue couereth multitude synnes hebr harbarous towarde ech wythout grudgyng cor euery one ministrynge grace vnto another hath receaued thesame good stewardes manyfolde grace god ie yf ony man speaketh let hym speake wordes god rom byf ony man ministreth let done power whych god doth ministre al thinges god maye praysed thorowe iesus christ vnto whome glorye empyre euer euer amen dearly beloued let strauge vnto luce f cor c petri b heate whych happeneth ye tryeng though straunge thynge happen vnto takynge parte wyth passion christ tim b reioyce beynge mery ye also may reioyce ye reuelacion hys glorye marc yf ye reuyled name christe ye shalbe happye concernynge vnto honoure glorye power god ye sprete hys doth rest vpon petri c c let noma suffre manslayer thefe cursed speaker desyrer men goodes yf suffre christe man let hym ashamed let hym prayse god thys behalfe iere b ezech tyme iudgemente begynne ye house god yf begynne fyrst v shalbe ende luce yt beleue gospell god pro yf ryghteous shall scarce saued shal wycked synner appeare therfore let also suffre accordynge ye wyll god commytte theyr soules vnto faythful creator weldoynges v chapter elder therfore amonge beseke also elder act c wytnesse passion christe whyche also partener glorye whyche reueled tyme come actu fede flocke god amonge prouydynge compelled wyllyngly according god nother fylthye lucre sake wyllyngly ezech luce b nother rulynge lyke lordes ouer ye lot god hartely tit beynge become ensample flocke wha ye chef ye shepherdes shal appeare ye shal receaue cor tim b vncorruptible crowne glory lykewyse ye yonge men obedient vnto elder men yee shewe lowlynesse euery one another proue iacob god doth resyst proud geueth grace vnto ye lowlybecome ye therfor lowly vnder ye mighty hande god maye exalte tyme visitacion psal c math c luc ccastynge carefulnesse vpo hym careth sobre watch iob b ephe b aduersary deuell goeth aboute roarynge lyon sekynge whome maye deuoure iaco resyst beynge stroge fayth knowynge sufferynge happen vnto brotherheade whych worlde ye god al grace hath called v vnto hys eternal grace christ iesu shall make perfecte confirme staye rom c petri heb haue suffred lytle vnto hym glory empyre euer euer amen syluanus faythfull brother vnto suppose haue wrytten brefely prayenge earnestly requyrynge true grace god whych ye stande chosen congregacion babilon saluteth marke sonne rom b cor c cor b grete ech holy kysse grace wyth whyche christ iesu amen p ende fyrste canonical epistle peter apostle seconde canonicall epistle peter apostle fyrst chapter simon peter seruaut apostle christ iesus vnto haue optayned coequall faythe wyth v ye ryghteousnesse oure god saueoure iesus christ petri grace vnto peace fulfylled knowlege god christ iesu lord thynges godly power whyche belonge vnto lyfe godlynesse geue vnto v hys knowlege whych hath called v hys owne glorye power whome hath geuen v greate precious promyses thereby ye become ioh coloss partaker godly nature flyenge corrupcion ye desyre whych ye worlde ye applyenge care ministre youre faythe vertue vertue knowlege cori knowlege abstinece abstinence pacience pacience godlynesse godlynesse loue brotherheade loue brotherhead charite yf wyth pleteous shall make voyde wythout frute ye knowlege lorde iesus christe hath thynges blynde gropynge wyth hande forgettynge clensynge hys olde synnes wherfore brother endeuoure ye ye make sure callynge chosynge wyth good workes doynge thynges ye shall synne ony tyme shal entraunce euerlastynge kyngdome lorde saueoure iesus christ ministred vnto plentyfully luce wherfore shall begynne admonyshe alwaye thynges truely knowynge beynge stablyshed present truth reken ryghtfull longe thys corin tabernacle rayse admonicion ioh tim beynge sure layenge downe tabernacle shalbe quicke accordynge also lorde iesus christ hath shewed yee wyll geue diligence ofte yt yt may haue death ye make remembraunce thynges haue made knowen vnto power foreknowlege oure lorde iesus christ hauyng followed rude fable ioha b ioh abut beynge become beholder hys greatnesse receauynge god father honoure glory suche voyce fro great glory beyng fallen downe vnto hym math marc luc dthys beloued sonne haue delyte heare hym thys voyce haue herde brought heauen whan wyth hym vpon holy mounte haue sure worde prophecye vnto whych ye well geuynge hede vnto lyghte cor b shynynge darcke place tyl ye daye ryse ye morowe starre ryse harte knowynge thys fyrst yt al ye prophecy scripture done priuate interpretacio daniel b zach b tim b prophecy neuer brought man wyl holy men god haue spoke beynge inspyred holy goost ii chapter bvt ther haue false prophetes also amonge ye people mat actu tim ther shalbe lyeng maysters amonge whych shal brynge sectes perdicio deny lord yt hath bought bryngynge vpo theselues swyft perdicion math b many shall followe theyr lecheryes whome waye truth shalbe blasphemed couetousnesse shal vse marchau dyse vnto whome iudgement longe sence hetherto doth ceasse theyr perdicion slepeth iob b apoc yf god dyd spare angel synnynge beynge drawen downe wyth bade lower partes hell hath delyuered punished kept vnto iudgement gene hath spared ye originall worlde hath kept noe ryght preacher ryghteousnesse bryngyng floude vpon worlde wycked men gene bryngynge cyties sodoma gomorra asshes damned wyth ouerthrowynge settyng ensaple yt shuld euel gen delyuered ryghteous loth beynge oppressed wyth iniury lecherous conuersacion wycked syght hearynge ryghteous dwellynge wyth vexed ye iust soule fro daye daye wyth wycked workes cor b lord knoweth drawe ye godly teptacio reserue wycked vnto ye day iudgemet tormented specyally ye walke flesh desyre vnclenesse despyse power bolde pleasynge theselues fear bryng sectes blasphemyng iud b angel whyle greater strength power bear agaynste themselues cursed iudgemente iere euen vnreasonable beastes naturally iude b blasphemynge thynges yt knowe vnto snare destruccion shal perysh theyr owne corrupcion receauynge ye rewarde vnryghteousnesse estymynge one dayes voluptuousnesse pleasure staynynges spottes ouerflowynge pleasure theyr feastes vsynge excesse hauynge eye full aduoutrye vncesseable synne entycynge vnstable soules hauynge harte exercysed couetousnesse chyldre curse leauynge ryght waye haue erred hauynge followed waye num balaam bosor whych loued rewarde wickednesse nu b hadde tame domme b aste reprofe hys foly speakyng wt man voyce forbad prophetes foolyshnesse fountaynes wythout water iude c cloudes caried wyth tepestes vnto whome ye myst darknesse reserued speakynge wyth pryde vanite entyce lechery desyres flesh escape lytle conuersaut erroure promysynge lyberte whan themselues seruauntes corrupcion ioha c rom b luce f whome ony ouercome hys seruaut also ioha c rom b luce ffor yf flyeng ye stayninges worlde knowlege oure lorde saueoure iesus christ beynge tangled wyth thesame ouercome agayne math c hebre latter endes become worse vnto fyrst ben better knowe waye ryghteousnes tha ye knowlege actu ato turne backwarde holy commaundemente delyuered vnto ye true prouerbe chauced vnto proue b eccli dogge turned agayne vomite sowe beynge washen wallowynge myre iii chapter beholde thys secode epistle wryte vnto dearely beloued whych rayse youre syncere mynde admonicion ye myndefull thynges haue sayd namely wordes holy prophetes apostle preceptes lorde saueoure knowynge also fyrst al act tim tim iude c last dayes shal come mocker deceaueablenesse walkyng theyr owne desyres sayeng ezec thess wher promyse hys comynge sence father slepte thynges remayne begynnynge creature thys knowe wyllyngly heaues fyrst gen ye earthe beynge water water worde god whyche thynges gen worlde peryshed water heauen earth set vp agayne thesame worde kepte thess fyre vnto daye iudgemente destruccion wycked let thys one thynge ygnoraunt vnto ye beloued psal ezech petr one daye lord thousade yeares thousande yeares one daye lorde doth make longe wyth hys promyse suppose rom behaueth hymselfe paciently ezech wyllynge ony perysh men come agayne repe tauce math thess apoc daye ye lorde shall come thefe esay b psal hebre b whych heauens shall passe wyth great rush elementes shalbe lowsed wyth heate earth workes therein shalbe burnte whan al loused whar maner persos ought ye holy conuersacions godlynesses waytynge haistynge vnto comynge ye lordes day ye ye heaues burnynge shalbe lowsed eleme te heate fyre shall fayde e c apoc wayte new heauens new earth esa math hys promyses whyche ryghteousnesse dwelleth wherfore ye dearly beloued waytynge thynges endeuoure founde vnspotted vnstayned vnto hym peace estyme longe sufferynge oure lorde health moost beloued brother paule hath wrytten vnto accordynge wysedome geuen hym euen hys epistle also speakynge thynges ye thynges harde vnderstande whych vnlearned vnstedfast peruerte scripture also theyr damnacion ye brother therfore knowyng beware lefte beynge drawen awaye ye fall owne stedfastnesse growe grace knowlege oure lorde saueoure iesus christe hym glory daye euerlastynge amen pthe ende seconde canonical epistle peter apostle fyrst cacanonicall epistle ihon apostle fyrst chapter whyche fro begynnynge whych haue herd ioh b petri b haue sene wyth eyen whych haue beholden ioh handes haue hadled ye worde lyfe lyfe manifeste haue sene testifye shew vnto ioha ye lyfe euerlastyng whych father appeared vnto v whych haue sene haue herde shewe vnto ye also maye haue fellowshippe wyth v yt oure fellowship wt father wyth hys sonne iesus christ thynges wryt vnto ye may reioyce ioh b b ioha b ioye maye ful ioh b thys tydynges haue herde hym shewe vnto god lyghte ther darkenesse hym psal esay b yf say haue fellowshippe wyth hym walke darkenesse lye truth yf walke lyghte also lyghte haue fellowshippe together heb b petri c apoc bloude hys sonne iesus christe clenseth v synne pro b yf saye haue synne deceaue oure selues truth v reg g io b prou b eccli c psal ayf knowlege synnes faythfull ryghteous forgeue v oure synnes clense v wyckednesse yf saye haue synned make hym lyar hys worde v ii chapter lytle chyldre thynges wryte vnto ye synne althoughe ony man doth synne haue hebre aduocate god father iesus christe ryghteous rom c attonemente oure synnes oures also whole worldes ther knowe loue hym yf kepe hys commaundementes ioha che sayeth hym know god doth kepe hys comaudemetes lyare thesame truth kepeth worde truely loue god perfecte ioh thereby know hym ioh b petri c sayeth hym abyde hym
